  6. Introduction: Revisiting the Social Science Library
  7. 1947年 《启蒙辩证法》：阿多诺与霍克海默诊断启蒙运动的自我毁灭
  8. 1947 Dialectic of Enlightenment: Adorno and Horkheimer Diagnose the Self-Destruction of the Enlightenment
  9. 1948 情境 II：萨特对文学的批判
  10. 1948 Situations II: Sartre Holds Literature to Account
  11. 1949 腓力二世时代的地中海与地中海世界：布罗代尔的交错延续
  12. 1949 The Mediterranean and the Mediterranean World in the Age of Philip II: Braudel’s Interlocking Durations
  13. 1949 亲属关系的基本结构：列维-斯特劳斯基于婚姻交换建立亲属关系
  14. 1949 The Elementary Structures of Kinship: Lévi-Strauss Founds Kinship on Matrimonial Exchange
  15. 1949 男性与女性：米德消除了两性之间的差异
  16. 1949 Male and Female: Mead Denaturalizes the Difference between the Sexes
  17. 1949年 《社会理论与社会结构：默顿为社会学提出行为准则》
  18. 1949 Social Theory and Social Structure: Merton Suggests a Code of Conduct for Sociology
  19. 1950 社会学与人类学：莫斯与社会无意识的神圣化
  20. 1950 Sociologie et anthropologie: Mauss and the Consecration of the Social Unconscious
  21. 1951 极权主义的起源：阿伦特与极权主义的激进创新
  22. 1951 The Origins of Totalitarianism: Arendt and the Radical Novelty of Totalitarianism
  23. 1952 生命的知识：康吉莱姆重新定义生命原则
  24. 1952 Knowledge of Life: Canguilhem Redefines the Principle of Life
  25. 1953 历史之战：费弗尔宣布历史的未来
  26. 1953 Combats pour l’histoire: Febvre Announces History’s Future
  27. 1954年 《缅甸高地的政治制度：利奇揭示社会结构的稳定性》
  28. 1954 Political Systems of Highland Burma: Leach Explodes the Stability of Social Structure
  29. 1955 视觉艺术中的意义：帕诺夫斯基用意义取代美
  30. 1955 Meaning in the Visual Arts: Panofsky Replaces Beauty with Meaning
  31. 1955年 《黑非洲社会学》：巴兰迪尔对非洲的社会学解读
  32. 1955 The Sociology of Black Africa: Balandier Sociologizes Africa
  33. 1956 权力精英：米尔斯与权力没收
  34. 1956 The Power Elite: Mills and the Confiscation of Power
  35. 1957年 《识字的用途：霍加特终于揭示了工人阶级文化》
  36. 1957 The Uses of Literacy: Hoggart Finally Casts Light on Working-Class Cultures
  37. 1957 神话学：巴特运用符号学来揭开神话的神秘面纱
  38. 1957 Mythologies: Barthes Deploys Semiology to Demystify Myth
  39. 1957 国王的两个身体：康托洛维奇与政治的神秘性
  40. 1957 The King’s Two Bodies: Kantorowicz and the Mystique of Politics
  41. 1958年 《富裕社会:加尔布雷斯与贫困的终结》
  42. 1958 The Affluent Society: Galbraith and the Heralded End of Poverty
  43. 1959 日常生活中的自我呈现：戈夫曼将日常生活变成戏剧
  44. 1959 The Presentation of Self in Everyday Life: Goffman Turns Daily Life into Theater
  45. 1960 几个世纪的童年：阿里埃斯重拾童年的感觉
  46. 1960 Centuries of Childhood: Ariès Rediscovers the Feeling of Childhood
  47. 1961  《疯癫史》：福柯重新赋予疯癫以破坏性的力量
  48. 1961 History of Madness: Foucault Reendows Madness with Its Destabilizing Power
  49. 1962 如何用语言做事：奥斯汀和语言作为行动
  50. 1962 How to Do Things with Words: Austin and Language as Action
  51. 1962 公共领域的结构转型：哈贝马斯与“公共性”的衰落
  52. 1962 The Structural Transformation of the Public Sphere: Habermas and the Decadence of “Publicness”
  53. 1962年 《科学革命的结构：库恩将科学视为工作共同体》
  54. 1962 The Structure of Scientific Revolutions: Kuhn Conceives of Science as Work Communities
  55. 1963年 《英国工人阶级的形成：汤普森还原工人阶级的经历》
  56. 1963 The Making of the English Working Class: Thompson Restores the Experience of the Working Class
  57. 1964 手势和言语：Leroi-Gourhan 将手势和言语联系起来
  58. 1964 Gesture and Speech: Leroi-Gourhan Links Up Gesture and Speech
  59. 1965 希腊人的神话与思想：韦尔南与希腊人的经历
  60. 1965 Myth and Thought among the Greeks: Vernant and the Experience of the Greeks
  61. 1965 阅读《资本论》：阿尔都塞与资本的沉默
  62. 1965 Reading Capital: Althusser and the Silences of Capital
  63. 1966 纯洁与危险：道格拉斯·厄舍斯竞赛进入象征秩序的核心
  64. 1966 Purity and Danger: Douglas Ushers Contest into the Heart of the Symbolic Order
  65. 1966年 《普通语言学问题：本维尼斯特超越结构主义》
  66. 1966 Problems in General Linguistics: Benveniste Moves beyond Structuralism
  67. 1966年 《现实的社会建构：伯格和卢克曼奠定了建构主义的基础》
  68. 1966 The Social Construction of Reality: Berger and Luckmann Lay the Bases of Constructivism
  69. 1967 论文字学：德里达发明了一种先于符号的书写
  70. 1967 Of Grammatology: Derrida Invents a Writing Preceding Signs
  71. 1967 民族方法学研究：加芬克尔与社会现象学
  72. 1967 Studies in Ethnomethodology: Garfinkel and the Phenomenology of the Social
  73. 1968 年 《神话与流行》：杜梅齐尔将神话视为社会组织的表达
  74. 1968 Mythe et épopée: Dumézil Views Myth as Expressing Social Organization
  75. 1969 后工业社会：都兰与新型社会的兴起
  76. 1969 The Post-Industrial Society: Touraine and the Onset of a New Type of Society
  77. 1969 宫廷社会：埃利亚斯将宫廷社会定义为文明进程的熔炉
  78. 1969 The Court Society: Elias Defines Court Society as the Crucible for the Civilizing Process
  79. 1969 族群与边界：巴特对族群概念的非实体化
  80. 1969 Ethnic Groups and Boundaries: Barth Desubstantializes the Idea of Ethnic Groups
  81. 1970 退出、声音和忠诚：赫希曼对不满表达的理论
  82. 1970 Exit, Voice, and Loyalty: Hirschman Theorizes the Expression of Discontent
  83. 1971 战败者的视角：瓦赫特尔转换视角看待西班牙征服
  84. 1971 The Vision of the Vanquished: Wachtel Switches Perspective on the Spanish Conquest
  85. 1972年《 内城语言：拉波夫捍卫语言及其社会用途的统一理论》
  86. 1972 Language in the Inner City: Labov Defends a Unified Theory of Language and Its Social Uses
  87. 1972 石器时代经济学：萨林斯推翻生产主义假说
  88. 1972 Stone Age Economics: Sahlins Overthrows the Productivist Hypothesis
  89. 1973 布汶传奇：杜比与基于事件的历史的斗争
  90. 1973 The Legend of Bouvines: Duby Does Battle with Events-Based History
  91. 1973  《文化的诠释》：格尔茨将文化转化为需要阐释的文本
  92. 1973 The Interpretation of Cultures: Geertz Turns Cultures into Texts to Be Interpreted
  93. 1974 现代世界体系：沃勒斯坦与现代资本主义的全球扩张
  94. 1974 The Modern World-System: Wallerstein and the Planetary Expansion of Modern Capitalism
  95. 1975 少女、食物和金钱：梅亚苏与亲属关系的消化结构
  96. 1975 Maidens, Meals, and Money: Meillassoux and the Alimentary Structures of Kinship
  97. 1976年 《奶酪与蠕虫》：金兹堡推出微观史
  98. 1976 The Cheese and the Worms: Ginzburg Launches Microhistory
  99. 1976 面包与马戏：维恩与善行的逻辑
  100. 1976 Bread and Circuses: Veyne and the Logic of Good Deeds
  101. 1977 致命的话语：法夫雷特-萨达对实证主义的解读
  102. 1977 Deadly Words: Favret-Saada Casts a Spell on Positivism
  103. 1977  《野蛮心灵的驯化：古迪探索与写作相关的智力技术》
  104. 1977 The Domestication of the Savage Mind: Goody Explores the Intellectual Technologies Connected to Writing
  105. 1978年 解读法国大革命：菲雷将革命归于过去
  106. 1978 Interpreting the French Revolution: Furet Consigns the Revolution to the Past
  107. 1978 东方主义：萨义德以西方的视角看待东方
  108. 1978 Orientalism: Said Views the Orient in the Mirror of the West
  109. 1979 未来过去：科塞莱克阐述了他的历史时间理论
  110. 1979 Futures Past: Koselleck Sets Out His Theory of Historical Time
  111. 1979 杰出：布迪厄与趣味的社会生产
  112. 1979 Distinction: Bourdieu and the Social Production of Taste
  113. 1980 日常生活的实践：德塞托与日常实践的创造力
  114. 1980 The Practice of Everyday Life: De Certeau and the Creativity of Ordinary Practice
  115. 1981 国王的肖像：马林与代表权力
  116. 1981 Portrait of the King: Marin and the Power of Representation
  117. 1981 年 L'exercice de la Parenté：继承人统一了亲属关系领域
  118. 1981 L’exercice de la parenté: Héritier Unifies the Field of Kinship
  119. 1982 奴隶制与社会死亡：帕特森将奴隶制定义为社会死亡
  120. 1982 Slavery and Social Death: Patterson Defines Slavery as Social Death
  121. 1982 艺术世界：贝克尔将艺术变成了一份像其他工作一样的工作
  122. 1982 Art Worlds: Becker Turns Art into a Job Like Any Other
  123. 1982 污秽与芬芳：科尔宾赋予我们的感官以历史
  124. 1982 The Foul and the Fragrant: Corbin Endows Our Senses with a History
  125. 1982 伟人的诞生：戈德利尔与多种统治形式
  126. 1982 The Making of Great Men: Godelier and the Multiple Forms of Domination
  127. 1983年《 殖民地印度农民起义的基本方面：古哈恢复了下属的政治意识》
  128. 1983 Elementary Aspects of Peasant Insurgency in Colonial India: Guha Rehabilitates the Political Consciousness of Subalterns
  129. 1983年 《个人主义论文集》：杜蒙特对西方例外的透视
  130. 1983 Essays on Individualism: Dumont Places Western Exception in Perspective
  131. 1983 想象的共同体：安德森揭示了国家的虚构基础
  132. 1983 Imagined Communities: Anderson Unveils Nations’ Fictional Underpinnings
  133. 1984 法国的巴氏杀菌法：拉图尔为非人类开辟了空间
  134. 1984 The Pasteurization of France: Latour Makes Room for the Nonhuman
  135. 1985 时间与叙事：利科尔重新定义时间
  136. 1985 Time and Narrative: Ricœur Refigures Time
  137. 1986年 《风险社会》：贝克宣布科学的自我祛魅
  138. 1986 Risk Society: Beck Announces Science’s Self-Disenchantment
  139. 1987 近代早期法国的印刷文化用途：Chartier 和社会领域的文化史
  140. 1987 The Cultural Uses of Print in Early Modern France: Chartier and the Cultural History of the Social Realm
  141. 1987《 家族财富》：大卫杜夫和霍尔分析性别与阶级的共建
  142. 1987 Family Fortunes: Davidoff and Hall Analyze the Co-construction of Gender and Class
  143. 1988 天赋的性别：斯特拉森将性别转化为行动的能力
  144. 1988 The Gender of the Gift: Strathern Turns Gender into a Capacity for Action
  145. 1989 灵长类动物视野：哈拉维在灵长类动物学中发现激进抗议的工具
  146. 1989 Primate Visions: Haraway Finds in Primatology Tools for Radical Protest
  147. 1990 性别麻烦：巴特勒制造性别麻烦
  148. 1990 Gender Trouble: Butler Sows Trouble in Gender
  149. 1990 爪哇的十字路口：伦巴第重新洗牌全球历史
  150. 1990 Le carrefour javanais: Lombard Reshuffles the Cards of Global History
  151. 1991 中间立场：理查德·怀特与跨文化适应
  152. 1991 The Middle Ground: Richard White and Intercultural Accommodations
  153. 1992 身份与控制：哈里森·怀特与新兴社会形态
  154. 1992 Identity and Control: Harrison White and Emerging Social Formations
  155. 1993 大数政治：德罗西埃尔探究统计知识的本体论
  156. 1993 The Politics of Large Numbers: Desrosières Investigates the Ontology of Statistical Knowledge
  157. 1994 极端的时代：霍布斯鲍姆讲述十九世纪资产阶级社会的终结
  158. 1994 The Age of Extremes: Hobsbawm Recounts the End of Nineteenth-Century Bourgeois Society
  159. 1995 从体力劳动者到雇佣劳动者：卡斯特尔与工资制度的侵蚀
  160. 1995 From Manual Workers to Wage Laborers: Castel and the Erosion of the Wage System
  161. 1996 圣路易斯：勒戈夫遇见圣路易斯
  162. 1996 Saint Louis: Le Goff Meets Saint Louis
  163. 1997  《分裂的城市》：洛罗表明遗忘是政治的核心
  164. 1997 The Divided City: Loraux Shows Forgetting Is Central to Politics
  165. 1998 艺术与代理：盖尔独立于美学重新定义艺术
  166. 1998 Art and Agency: Gell Redefines Art Independently of Aesthetics
  167. 1999 资本主义的新精神：博尔坦斯基和夏佩罗重新解读资本主义之谜
  168. 1999 The New Spirit of Capitalism: Boltanski and Chiapello Readdress the Enigma of Capitalism
  169. 2000年 《大分流》：彭慕兰解释中国为何“落后”于西方
  170. 2000 The Great Divergence: Pomeranz Explains Why China “Lagged” behind the West
  171. 2001 在不确定的世界中行动：卡隆、拉斯科姆和巴特重新思考民主
  172. 2001 Acting in an Uncertain World: Callon, Lascoumes, and Barthe Rethink Democracy
  173. 2002 幸存的图像：迪迪-于贝尔曼将时间作为图像的基本维度
  174. 2002 The Surviving Image: Didi-Huberman Makes Time the Fundamental Dimension of Images
  175. 2003 一神论的代价：阿斯曼与一神论的暴力
  176. 2003 The Price of Monotheism: Assmann and the Violence of Monotheism
  177. 2003 法律与革命：伯曼与西方法律的革命
  178. 2003 Law and Revolution: Berman and the Revolutions of Western Law
  179. 2003 历史体制：哈托格与当代经验
  180. 2003 Regimes of Historicity: Hartog and Experience of the Present
  181. 2004 志愿奴役：特斯塔特、不平等的起源和国家的出现
  182. 2004 La servitude volontaire: Testart, the Genesis of Inequalities and the Emergence of the State
  183. 2005 互联历史探索：Subrahmanyam 连接欧亚世界
  184. 2005 Explorations in Connected History: Subrahmanyam Connects the Euro-Asian Worlds
  185. 2005 超越自然与文化：德斯科拉将自然引入社会科学
  186. 2005 Beyond Nature and Culture: Descola Steers Nature into the Social Sciences
  187. 2006 年 Charonne，1962 年 8 月：Dewerpe 尸检国家暴力
  188. 2006 Charonne, 8 février 1962: Dewerpe Autopsies State Violence
  189. 2007年 《灭绝岁月：弗里德兰德将大屠杀置于纳粹研究的核心》
  190. 2007 The Years of Extermination: Friedländer Puts the Holocaust at the Heart of Scholarship on Nazism
  191. 2008 暴力：柯林斯将暴力视为情境效应
  192. 2008 Violence: Collins Makes Violence an Effect of Situation
  193. 2009 不被统治的艺术：斯科特与无政府主义历史的人类学结果
  194. 2009 The Art of Not Being Governed: Scott and the Anthropological Outcome of an Anarchist History
  195. 2010 酋长如何成为国王：基尔希赋予波利尼西亚自己的古老国家
  196. 2010 How Chiefs Became Kings: Kirch Endows Polynesia with Its Own Archaic State
  197. 2011年 债务：格雷伯希望终结债务暴力
  198. 2011 Debt: Graeber Wishes to End the Violence of Debt
  199. 2012 穿过针眼：布朗回归基督教财富问题的根源
  200. 2012 Through the Eye of a Needle: Brown Returns to the Roots of the Christian Problem of Wealth
  201. 2013 二十一世纪资本论：皮凯蒂解读世纪经济不平等的变迁
  202. 2013 Capital in the Twenty-First Century: Piketty Decrypts Shifts in Economic Inequalities over the Centuries
  203. 2014 身体的用途：阿甘本与生命作为用途
  204. 2014 The Use of Bodies: Agamben and Life as Use
  205. 2015 世界尽头的蘑菇：青追踪资本主义废墟中的生活
  206. 2015 The Mushroom at the End of the World: Tsing Tracks Life in the Ruins of Capitalism
  207. 2016 金钱：阿格列塔揭示金钱的矛盾本质
  208. 2016 Money: Aglietta Unveils the Contradictory Nature of Money

A HISTORY OF THE SOCIAL SCIENCES IN 101 BOOKS

101本书中的社会科学史

A HISTORY OF THE SOCIAL SCIENCES IN 101 BOOKS

由 Cyril Lemieux、Laurent Berger、Marielle Macé、Gildas Salmon 和 Cécile Vidal 编辑

edited by Cyril Lemieux, Laurent Berger, Marielle Macé, Gildas Salmon, and Cécile Vidal

译者：Adrian Morfee

translated by Adrian Morfee

麻省理工学院出版社

The MIT Press

Cambridge, Massachusetts

英国伦敦

London, England

内容

Contents

引言：重访社会科学图书馆

Introduction: Revisiting the Social Science Library

1947年 《启蒙辩证法》：阿多诺与霍克海默诊断启蒙运动的自我毁灭

1947 Dialectic of Enlightenment: Adorno and Horkheimer Diagnose the Self-Destruction of the Enlightenment

1948 情境 II：萨特对文学的批判

1948 Situations II: Sartre Holds Literature to Account

1949 腓力二世时代的地中海与地中海世界：布罗代尔的交错延续

1949 The Mediterranean and the Mediterranean World in the Age of Philip II: Braudel’s Interlocking Durations

1949 亲属关系的基本结构：列维-斯特劳斯基于婚姻交换建立亲属关系

1949 The Elementary Structures of Kinship: Lévi-Strauss Founds Kinship on Matrimonial Exchange

1949 男性与女性：米德消除了两性之间的差异

1949 Male and Female: Mead Denaturalizes the Difference between the Sexes

1949年 《社会理论与社会结构：默顿为社会学提出行为准则》

1949 Social Theory and Social Structure: Merton Suggests a Code of Conduct for Sociology

1951 The Origins of Totalitarianism: Arendt and the Radical Novelty of Totalitarianism

1978年 解读法国大革命：菲雷将革命归于过去

引言：重访社会科学图书馆

Introduction: Revisiting the Social Science Library

本书旨在重读二战以来出版的101本著作，它们对法国乃至全球社会科学的构建产生了深远的影响。在此过程中，我们将接触到无数的研究对象、名称、信条和争论。我们将见证那些如今已成为我们理解和干预社会世界核心概念的诞生。我们将追寻那些牢固交织的思想脉络，并观察其他思想的衰落和瓦解。从阿多诺的文化诊断到朱迪斯·巴特勒引入的性别困境，从布罗代尔《地中海》的长篇时间框架到柯林斯对暴力微观情境的分析，从列维-斯特劳斯的亲属关系体系到青安娜笔下资本主义废墟中如雨后春笋般涌现的社会科学探索，本书展现了社会科学非连续性、多面向的探索，同时也表明它是一项由共同的努力和项目支撑的追求。

The purpose driving this work is to reread 101 books, published since the Second World War, that have left their mark on how the social sciences have been built, year after year, in France and around the world. In so doing, we shall encounter countless objects of study, names, tenets, and debates. We shall witness the birth of concepts now central to how we apprehend and intervene in the social world. We shall follow solidly woven lines of thought and look on as others fray and fall apart. From the cultural diagnosis of Theodor W. Adorno to the gender trouble introduced by Judith Butler, from the long time frame of Fernand Braudel’s “Mediterranean” to Randall Collins’s analysis of micro-situations of violence, from Claude Lévi-Strauss’s kinship systems to Anna Tsing’s mushroom growing amid the ruins of capitalism—this book portrays the discontinuous, multifaceted endeavor of the social sciences while showing it to be a pursuit sustained by a common effort and project.

引人注目的是，此前无人应对过这一挑战。社会科学尽管已发展近一个半世纪，却似乎仍在努力理解其统一性。为了展现其发展，社会科学依赖于特定学科的回顾展和选集，而非关注它们如何共同推动当代思想的核心运动。而我们试图捕捉的正是这个由众多不同领域组成的整体。因为，除了通过知识动态、转化和辩论相互联系之外，这些学科与生命科学有着共同的立场，最重要的是，它们都参与其中。在一个共同的项目中——增加当代社会的集体反思性并进一步批判民族中心主义偏见。

Strikingly, no one has addressed this challenge before. It is as though the social sciences, despite being constituted as such for nearly a century and a half, still struggle to grasp what confers their unity. To portray their development, they have relied on discipline-specific retrospectives and anthologies rather than focusing on how they conjointly drive a movement that is central to contemporary thought. And it is precisely this whole, composed of many different fields, that we seek to capture. For, in addition to being connected by intellectual dynamics, transfers, and debates, these disciplines share a common position vis-à-vis the life sciences and, above all, partake in a common project—adding to the collective reflexivity of contemporary societies and furthering our critiques of ethnocentric bias.

在我们看来，这项解放性的工程至关重要。如果社会科学值得我们投入精力，那是因为它们提升了我们以非自然的眼光审视社会及其制度的集体能力。社会科学孜孜不倦地探索人类实践的无限多样性，运用其所设计的方法和技术，实际上与它们能够揭开我们行为上显而易见的表象，揭示一种必然性，同时也是任意性，影响着我们的集体组织的能力息息相关。这就是社会科学的解放作用——即使它们愿意，也无法放弃这种作用。在研究人类生活的各种表现形式时，社会科学揭示了其基础，这些基础虽然由生物学决定，但或许主要由社会历史力量塑造。

This emancipating project is, to our minds, the crucial element. If the social sciences merit the energies expended on them, it is because they increase our collective capacity to view our societies and their institutions in a denaturalizing light. The movement by which they tirelessly explore the infinite variety of human practices, via the methods and techniques they have devised, is in fact related to their capacity to peel away the veneer of obviousness overlaying our behavior and reveal that a form of necessity, yet equally of arbitrariness, influences our collective organization. This is the emancipating effect of the social sciences—an effect they could not relinquish if they wished to. In studying human life in all its diverse manifestations, the social sciences bring to light its foundations, which, though biologically determined, are fashioned perhaps primarily by sociohistorical forces.

从事社会科学

Doing Social Science

要赞扬这种解放性的影响，就必须在每本书中展现其具体形态。这也要求我们不仅面向专业读者，更要面向所有欣赏社会科学所带来的知识和自由的读者。但让这些书籍更通俗易懂、更容易理解并不意味着放弃对其技术层面的讨论，尤其是方法论问题（有时颇具挑战性）在推动社会科学发展的辩论中所占据的地位。任何试图抹去这些书籍超越关于社会世界的简单陈述的本质的尝试，都将使其显得虚假。因此，我们的讨论必然涵盖调查方案、数据收集技巧、对资料的批判性分析以及比较和分析工具，并由此必然包含概念和理论框架的生成。正是这种技术层面，基于既定的调查和反思程序，将每门社会科学“规训”起来。这些维度也与社会科学研究的根本集体性（即使研究工作围绕着一个名称而具体化）以及研究共同体的存在相关，而研究共同体的发展和自主判断支撑着知识的进步。

Paying tribute to this emancipating effect entails exhibiting the shape it takes in each book presented. It also demands that we address not just a specialist readership but all those who appreciate the social sciences for the knowledge and freedom they bring. But making these books simpler and more accessible does not imply forgoing discussion of their technical dimensions, particularly the place held by the (at times difficult) problems of method in the debates driving the social sciences. Any attempt to erase what makes them more than simple statements about the social world would belie them. Our discussion thus necessarily covers investigation protocols, data-gathering techniques, critical analysis of sources, and tools for comparison and analysis, taking in, as a corollary, the production of concepts and theoretical frameworks. This technical aspect is what “disciplines” each social science, based on established procedures for investigation and reflexivity. These dimensions also relate to the fundamentally collective nature of working in the social sciences (even when the undertaking crystallizes around a name) and to the existence of research communities, whose development and autonomy of judgment undergird advances in knowledge.

因此，除了关注这些书籍的论述之外，进一步考察它们如何为其论证提供依据也至关重要。同样重要的是，关注每本书如何参与其之前的一系列研究辩论，这些辩论往往会改变辩论的参数和后续进程，这实际上提出了社会科学中知识累积性的问题。

In addition to focusing on what these books state, it is thus important to further examine how they ground what they say. It is likewise important to pay attention to how each partakes in a series of research debates preceding it, often modifying the parameters and subsequent course of these debates, which amounts to raising the issue of the cumulative nature of knowledge in the social sciences.

我们邀请了目前在法国及其他地区从事不同学科领域和研究对象的顶尖专家。他们探讨了每本书的出版如何代表了各自领域的一个事件，解释了该书对科学辩论的影响，并明确了当今人们对其的关注点，但并未将每本书与现实研究背景隔离开来，也未将其奉为与任何科学传统或集体事业隔绝的博物馆藏品。

We have called on some of the leading specialists currently working in France and elsewhere in the various disciplinary fields and objects of study. They go over how the publication of each book represented an event in its field, explain the effects the book produced on scientific debate, and specify where the interest lies today, without immuring each book from the living context of research or enshrining it as a museum piece cut off from any scientific tradition or collective undertaking.

这种方式旨在向社会科学界表达双重敬意。首先，通过将这些书籍和研究人员聚集在一起，我们希望强调代际团结。从第二次世界大战至今，每一代新的研究人员都从前一代研究人员那里获得了技术和知识方面的训练，如果没有这些训练，他们将无法创作出自己的著作。然而，这种团结不仅仅是承认这一遗产：它更意味着通过批判来吸收借鉴，通过与前辈的思想和方法保持距离来传承遗产，从而开辟新的视野。其次，通过邀请如此多的作者，我们也希望表达我们对社会科学作为一个统一整体的愿景。目前，这种愿景正受到持续的专业化趋势的威胁，在这种趋势下，社会科学研究人员越来越多地被视为某个问题或领域的“专家”。这揭示了过去七十年来研究实践的全面变革，展现了大众高等教育的出现以及近年来研究成果的管理化如何彻底改变了社会科学研究者的意义，影响了职业培训、知识奉献的过程、研究实践、研究技术的传承、出版模式，甚至影响了研究者的精神特质和相关的职业理想。但我们珍视的跨学科团结精神却并未改变。消失了。大约一百名研究人员已经将我们的方法视为他们自己的方法，而这本书的存在可以被视为一种抵抗行为，一种坚定的提醒，即社会科学是一个统一的事业。此外，这本书可以被视为证明，在当今其他科学工作方法——提倡研究领域的碎片化、强调个人策略和专业知识——被标榜为通用模式的时代，这样的项目对我们许多人来说仍然有意义。毫无疑问，像我们这样的项目在未来会获得更多的支持，因为人们感到有必要超越过度专业化的动态，这种动态榨干了所有反思性，并使社会科学背离了其解放性目标。

This approach is intended as a dual tribute to the social sciences community. First, in bringing these books and researchers together, we wished to emphasize intergenerational solidarity. From the Second World War through to the present day, each new generation of researchers has received from the preceding one the technical and intellectual training without which they would have been incapable of producing their own works. This solidarity, however, is not merely a matter of acknowledging this legacy: rather, it entails appropriation through critique, carrying the legacy forward by building up a distance from predecessors’ thought and approach, thereby opening up new vistas. Second, by calling on so many authors, we also wished to profess our vision of the social sciences as a unified whole. Such a vision is currently imperiled by the ongoing trend toward specialization, in which researchers in the social sciences are increasingly viewed as mere “experts” on a given question or domain. This reveals the full extent of the changes to research practices over the past seventy years, illustrating how the advent of mass higher education and, more recently, the managerialization of research output have radically altered what it means to be a researcher in the social sciences, affecting career training, the processes of intellectual consecration, investigation practices, the transmission of research techniques, publication modes, and even the very ethos of the researcher and associated professional ideal. But the interdisciplinary solidarity that we hold dear has not disappeared. A hundred or so researchers have recognized our approach as their own, and the existence of this book may be viewed as an act of resistance, an assertive reminder that the social sciences form a unitary endeavor. Further, this book can be seen as proof that such a project still makes sense to many of us, at a time when other approaches to scientific work—promoting the fragmentation of research fields, emphasizing individual strategies and expertise—are being paraded as a universal model. No doubt projects such as ours will garner ever more support in the future, as the need is felt to move beyond the dynamic of hyper-specialization that bleeds all reflexivity dry and turns the social sciences away from their emancipatory project.

比万神殿更好

Better than a Pantheon

一个机构事件促成了我们有机会宣扬这一统一而解放的愿景并应对这一挑战——那就是 2017 年法国高等研究实用学院 (EPHE) 成立“经济与社会科学”新系七十周年。众所周知，该系于 1947 年成立，在当时的法国具有重要的科学意义。同样公认的是，这是该学院的核心，该学院于 1975 年发展并取得自主权，成为社会科学高等学院 (EHESS)，本书的编辑们就在该学院工作。这个回顾社会科学七十年历史的偶然机会是本书诞生的萌芽。

It took an institutional event to trigger the opportunity to profess this unitary and emancipatory vision and to tackle this challenge—namely, the seventieth anniversary in 2017 of the creation of a new department devoted to “economic and social sciences” at the École pratique des hautes études (EPHE). As is widely recognized, the department’s creation in 1947 was of major scientific importance in France at that time. It is equally acknowledged that this was the kernel of the institution that developed and then acquired autonomy in 1975 as the École des hautes études en sciences sociales (EHESS), where the editors of this book work. This fortuitous occasion to go back over the previous seventy years of the social sciences was the germ whence this book grew.

这样，读者就能更好地理解我们为何选择1947年至2017年这个时间段。但我们仍然需要解释我们是如何开展这项工作的——也就是说，我们是如何挑选、遴选并优先考虑某本书的。为了解决这个显然无法解决的问题，五位编辑在2016年多次会面。在这些会议中，我们小组进行了激烈的讨论。尽管我们设定的目标是列出一份自1947年以来出版的100本左右的书籍清单，但新的、“不可或缺的”书籍不断涌现，并声称自己有权被列入清单。我们费尽周折，才将清单缩减到101本，而不是100本，因为100本太过简洁、太整齐了。这个数字也促使其他人继续……重新开放并丰富这一选择，并尽可能地减少此类项目固有的印象，即所列出的作品在某种程度上是“最好的”。

Our readers will thus better understand why we settled on the period 1947–2017. But we still need to explain how we went about our undertaking—that is, how we selected, chose, and prioritized such and such a book. To tackle this obviously irresoluble problem, the five editors met on numerous occasions in 2016. During these meetings, our group engaged in fierce discussions. Although we had fixed the objective of drawing up a list of 100 or so books published since 1947, new and “indispensable” books kept on coming and asserting their right to be included. It was only very gradually, painfully, that we whittled down our list to 101 titles, rather than 100, which is too neat, too tidy a number. The figure also invites others to continually reopen and enrich this selection and, as far as possible, lessens the impression inherent to this type of project that the works listed are somehow the “best.”

我们从未想过要将选集限制在一系列被奉为经典的作家作品中，这些作品被认为代表了20世纪60年代和70年代左右社会科学的黄金时代。相反，我们关注的是社会科学，将其视为一项持续不断的事业，其特点是跌宕起伏、充满惊喜和强度波动。我们决定每年都纳入选集，并且任何一位作家，无论其影响力如何，都不会出现超过一次。我们也选择将这些学科一直延续到今天，同时警惕由于缺乏必要的距离而无法从最新的作品中准确筛选出合适的作者所带来的困难。最后，我们希望限制不同学科之间、法国和非法国作家之间、男性和女性之间以及不同历史时期和文化区域之间的不平衡，尽管我们的选集显然受到了当时社会研究条件（主要为男性，主要来自欧洲和美国）以及我们项目是在法国机构的核心进行的影响。

There was never any question in our minds of restricting our selection to an abridged series of canonized authors, supposedly equating to some golden age of the social sciences around the 1960s and 1970s. Rather, it was a matter of following the social sciences as an ongoing endeavor, characterized by its ups and downs, surprises, and fluctuations in intensity. We decided that each year was to be represented, and no author, however influential, was to appear more than once. We also opted to follow these disciplines through to the present day while remaining alert to the difficulties occasioned by lacking the requisite distance to pick our way surely through the most recent output. Lastly, we wished to limit imbalances between disciplines, between French and non-French authors, between men and women, and between historical periods and cultural areas, though our selection is obviously marked by the social conditions of research—mostly male, mostly European and American—during the period under consideration and by our project having been carried out at the heart of a French institution.

所以，这部作品并非一座小型的万神殿。它不那么宏伟，也不受任何束缚。我们的读者被邀请自由地在书中穿梭，而非去欣赏它们。它也并非客观的选择，仿佛标准可以完全脱离选择者的社会历史处境而存在。我们没有如此激进的客观性概念。我们清楚地知道，我们的选择必然是处境化的。首先，我们的选择处境化于时间，因为我们必然会从学科的现状出发，审视它们的过去，寻找那些流传至今、被视为“值得关注”或“非凡之作”的作品，甚至是它们自身未曾预见到的潮流的“奠基性”或“代表”。但我们并非从自身期望的角度来解读过去的作品，而是从它们的视角重新审视它们——因此，那些已经不言而喻的论点，会以它们提出时的新颖性重新演绎。其次，我们的选择是建立在空间上的，对于我们的事业来说，是在法国研究机构进行的，该机构采取了一种面向社会科学全球史的立场（毫无疑问，这与我们的美国同事们如果被要求列出这样的清单，肯定会有所顾虑。然而，我们考虑到了所选书目在法国和欧洲以外地区的重要性。因此，尽管我们明确地“定位”，但我们的方法却始终致力于在时间和空间上使其去中心化。

So, this work is not a little pantheon. It is less monumental and less fettered. Our readers are invited to circulate freely among the books, not to admire them. Nor is it the result of a selection that could be described as objective, as if criteria could exist wholly detached from the sociohistorical situation of those choosing. We have no such radical conception of objectivity. It is clear to our minds that our choices are necessarily situated. First, our choices are situated in time, for it is necessarily from where our disciplines now stand that we have scrutinized their pasts, looking for works that have come down through the years, standing out as “noteworthy” or “remarkable,” even as “foundational” or “representative” of a current they themselves did not envisage. But rather than engaging with the works of the past from the standpoint of our expectations, we have reconsidered them from theirs—thus arguments that have become self-evident are rehearsed afresh with the novelty they had when formulated. Second, our selections are situated in space, for our enterprise, conducted in a French research establishment, which assumes a standpoint toward the global history of the social sciences (no doubt a very different one from that our American colleagues would have assumed if asked to draw up such a list). However, we considered the importance attached to the selected titles in places outside France and Europe. Thus, though clearly “situated,” our approach is driven by a constant effort to decenter it in both time and space.

冲突与选择

Clashes and Choices

我们的总体思路使我们做出了一系列深思熟虑的选择。首要且主要的选择是采取社会科学而非某一特定学科的立场。这并不意味着拥护某种平淡无奇的社会科学愿景。相反，我们主张一种更具结构性的愿景，尤其借鉴了巴黎高等经济与社会科学系的历史及其对年鉴学派的借鉴。1我们牢记让-克洛德·帕瑟隆 (Jean-Claude Passeron) 所说的社会科学三大基础学科——历史学、人类学和社会学——之间存在的“认识论上的不可区分性” 2。围绕这一基础，还存在着一系列具有根本不同认识论的其他学科——法律、语言学、哲学、艺术史、文学研究、经济学、认知科学等等。当然，它们与三大基础学科互动的全部意义就源于这种差异。诚然，将某些学科置于中心，将其他学科置于边缘本身就颇具争议。显然，社会科学构建其构成领域之间关系的方式引发了冲突。此外，尽管这三大学科是社会科学背后的主要力量，但它们并非单独存在，而是共同赋予了这种驱动力，它们汲取了周边学科基于另一种认识论而产生的交流、理论辩论和质疑，并对其产生了影响。例如，我们只需思考一下语言学在20世纪60年代所扮演的标志性角色。

Our overall line led us to embrace a certain number of deliberate choices. The first and main such choice is to adopt the standpoint of the social sciences rather than of a particular discipline. That does not mean championing some flat, bland vision of the social sciences. Rather, we profess a more structured vision, drawing notably on the history of the EPHE economics and social science department and what it owed to the Annales school.1 We are mindful of what Jean-Claude Passeron has called the “epistemological indiscernibility”2 of the three disciplines underpinning the social sciences—history, anthropology, and sociology. Around this base is a constellation of other disciplines with fundamentally different epistemologies—law, linguistics, philosophy, the history of art, literary studies, economics, the cognitive sciences, and so on. The whole interest of their interaction with the three underpinning disciplines springs, of course, from this difference. Admittedly, placing certain disciplines at the center and others on the periphery is in itself controversial. Clearly, the way in which the social sciences figure the relationships between their constitutive fields sparks clashes. Additionally, while these three disciplines are the main force behind the social sciences, it is only conjointly, not singly, that they impart this drive, drawing on the exchanges, theoretical debates, and questionings issuing from the surrounding disciplines grounded in another epistemology and affecting them. One has only to think, for example, of the emblematic role played by linguistics in the 1960s.

第二个经过深思熟虑的选择，对我们而言至关重要，是尊重一种特定的学术形式——即以作者（或多位作者）名义出版的书籍。目前的变化有利于文章，以及在较小程度上有利于会议或研讨会合集的章节。出版界鼓励社会科学研究人员撰写简短的论文、教科书和其他“贡献”。所有这些形式各有千秋，既能满足不同公众的需求，又能促进社会科学的产出，提升其影响力。但从历史上看，书籍出版无疑是社会科学建设的核心，也是社会科学在公众心目中树立声誉的主要途径。我们选择将书籍列为学术成果的首要形式，这解释了为什么一些重要的著作——尤其是文章——没有出现在我们的名单上，具体的期刊、词典或百科全书也没有。书籍被列入名单并非仅仅源于社会科学与自然科学（其中最重要的形式是文章）之间的本质区别之一，也体现了社会科学——从一开始就——与文学世界紧密相连的纽带。3社会科学具有不可简化的解释学和叙事维度，这不仅源于其研究对象（人类活动及其历史变迁），也源于其所需的劳动类型，即将现实构建为谜团，力求“言说真话”。这要求，或者应该要求，任何人都不能逃避表达和关注描述和分类现实所涉及的问题。在这一点上，并非所有人都会同意。就此而言，在我们这个小小的编辑团队中，文学问题引发了激烈的争论——而形式问题的地位、“散文”本身就是一种高贵体裁的感受，或写作的努力是所有思考的核心的信念，并非总是占上风。声称某种学术成果形式具有主导地位，或谴责我们这个时代对学术成果的处理方式，必然是高度多元化的研究领域中冲突的关键问题之一，而且不可能以不同的视角来看待。

A second deliberate choice, which is important to us, is to honor a particular form of scholarship—namely, books published under the author’s (or authors’) name. Changes currently favor the article and, to a lesser extent, chapter in a joint volume from a conference or colloquium. For its part, the world of publishing encourages social science researchers to produce brief essays, textbooks, and other “contributions.” All these formats have their merits, meeting the requirements of different publics while adding to the production and raising the profile of the social sciences. But historically, the publication of books has assuredly been central to building the social sciences, and it is the main means by which they have forged their reputation with the general public. Our choice to privilege books as the preeminent form of scholarly output explains why a certain number of important works—particularly articles—do not figure on our list, and nor do specific journal issues, dictionaries, or encyclopedias. This place granted to books does not issue solely from one of the essential differences between the social sciences and the natural sciences (in which the seminal format is the article). It also expresses the tie linking them—from the outset—to the world of the literature.3 The social sciences have an irreducibly hermeneutic and narrative dimension that stems not solely from their object of study (human activities and their historical transformations) but also from the type of labor they require, which entails framing reality as an enigma, seeking to “speak true.” This demands, or should demand, that none shirk the task of voicing and being mindful of the issues involved in describing and categorizing reality. Here once again, not everyone will agree. Within our little editorial group, for that matter, the literary question gave rise to lively debates—and the place accorded to matters of form, the feeling that the “essay” is an inherently dignified genre, or the belief that the effort involved in writing is central to all thinking, did not always emerge victorious. Claiming that one format of scholarly output has primacy, or denouncing how it is treated by our epoch, necessarily figures among the issues at stake in clashes within the highly diverse world of research and could not transpire in a different light.

哪本社会科学史？

Which History of the Social Sciences?

通过以全新的、更新的、国际化的视角来审视社会科学知识宝库中的主要著作（以及一些鲜为人知的著作），我们勾勒出的全景图使我们能够衡量这些科学的变化及其发展方向。本书假设了这些限制，并且得益于其协作性质，可以有力地阐明这些不连续性以及随之而来的融合和密集化的影响，从而突出变化的主要路线。

In offering a renewed, updated, and internationalized perspective on the major (together with some lesser known) works in the repository of knowledge built up by the social sciences, the panorama we sketch allows us to gauge changes in these sciences, together with the directions in which they have evolved. This book assumes these constraints and, thanks to its collaborative nature, is strongly placed to set out these discontinuities and attendant effects of convergence and densification, thus highlighting the major lines of change.

其中一条变化轨迹——或许是最明显的，也绝非什么新发现，但在本文研究的几十年中却发生了显著的转折——是结构主义思想所描绘的曲线，从二战后不久的兴起，到20世纪60年代的主导地位，再到其所谓的衰落。在结构理念的庇护下，社会科学是否成功地向自身证明了自身的统一性，并在一段时间内取得了胜利，直到那些天生具有批判精神的研究者开始瓦解这一统一的信念？一些论述兜售着这种怀旧而幻灭的愿景，将社会科学简化为20世纪60年代的景象——某种与其“伟人”时代相对应的“黄金时代”。然而，我们所走的道路使我们能够以不同的视角看待事物，并在对结构主义的批判（始于20世纪70年代，兴盛于20世纪80年代）及其重新评估和重新解读中，认识到社会科学统一性的全新表达。这场批判运动从一个学科到另一个学科借鉴了类似的模式（强调主体性，拒绝总体化，关注情境约束等），提出了经常趋同的方法论建议，并且其规模如此之大，以至于我们完全有资格以不同的眼光看待社会科学三十年前开启的那个阶段。这种观点不再基于衰落或危机的理念——其特征是分散、碎片化，甚至无力化——而是基于这样的信念：这一阶段展现出一种形式多样但共同的努力，旨在超越结构主义事业的局限，并进一步实现改变社会世界本质的目标。从 20 世纪 90 年代开始，在世界各地大多数从事社会科学教学和实践的大学校园中，跨学科的通用语言往往以“社会建构”的概念为中心，这成为这些科学对公共辩论贡献的最重要标志。

One of the lines of change—perhaps the most flagrant, and in no way a discovery, but with a notable inflection over the decades studied here—is the curve traced by structuralist thought, from its emergence just after the Second World War through its domination in the 1960s, followed by its supposed decline. Did the social sciences, under the aegis of the idea of structure, manage to demonstrate their unity to themselves and triumph awhile, before researchers, naturally given to critique, set about dismantling this unifying belief? Some such nostalgic and disillusioned vision is hawked in accounts that abridge the social sciences to what they are held to have been in the 1960s—some “golden age” corresponding to that of their “great names.” But the path we follow allows us to see things differently and to recognize in the very critique of structuralism (commencing in the 1970s and flourishing as of the 1980s), in its reappraisals and rereadings, a renewed expression of the unity of the social sciences. This critical movement borrows from one discipline to the next such similar schema (emphasizing agency, refusing totalizations, paying attention to situational constraints, etc.), makes methodological recommendations that so frequently converge, and operates on such a scale that we are fully entitled to view the phase on which the social sciences embarked thirty or so years ago in a different light. This view is no longer based on the idea of decline or crisis—characterized by dispersal, fragmentation, and powerlessness even—but on the conviction that this phase exhibits a multiform yet common effort to move beyond the limits of the structuralist enterprise and to take further the goal of denaturing the social world. Starting in the 1990s, on most university campuses around the world involved in teaching and practicing the social sciences, the common language across disciplines tended to center on the idea of “social constructs,” which emerged as the most significant marker of these sciences’ contribution to public debate.

由此，我们或许可以追溯到第二次演变，这与女性主义研究以及殖民研究、庶民研究和后殖民研究的重要性有关。女性主义研究出现于20世纪40年代末，其他浮现于 20 世纪 50 年代。然而，直到 20 世纪 70 年代和 80 年代，它们才真正在英语学术界流行起来。它们过了一段时间才传入法国，并在那里受到了批判。然而，在这里——尽管无可否认是在社会科学的核心学科而不是在被组织成“研究”的领域——它们也重新激发了人们对性、性别、殖民化、帝国和统治等问题的兴趣，引导社会科学研究恢复被统治者的“能动性”。在这种情况下，社会科学无疑比其他科学更能表明它们是如何团结在一个共同的课题上，即增强社会内部的反思性：在使主体能够非自然化传统的统治关系的同时，这些社会的转型也使女权主义、属下和后殖民主义论点拥有了不断扩大的受众和影响范围。作为回报，社会科学方法也发生了深刻的改变：面对迄今为止未曾预料到的实际困难，它们现在寻求更好地“对称化”主导者和被主导者的观点，并避免在其概念化和研究程序中引入主导者的偏见。

From there, we may trace a second evolution, relating to the importance acquired by feminist studies, together with colonial, subaltern, and postcolonial studies. Feminist studies appeared in the late 1940s, and the others surfaced during the 1950s. It was only during the 1970s and the 1980s, however, that they genuinely took off in English-speaking academia. It took a while for them to reach France, where they were received critically. Yet here, too—though admittedly in the central disciplines of the social sciences rather than in the fields organized into “studies”—they sparked renewed interest in matters of sex, gender, colonization, empire, and domination, steering research in the social sciences toward rehabilitating the “agency” of the dominated. In this case, no doubt more than others, the social sciences show how they are united around a common project to increase reflexivity within societies: In enabling subjects to denaturalize traditional relations of domination, the transformations to these societies gave feminist, subaltern, and postcolonial arguments an ever-expanding audience and reach. In return, social science methods have been profoundly modified: confronting hitherto unsuspected practical difficulties, they now seek to better “symmetrize” the point of view of the dominant and the dominated and to avoid importing the prejudices of the dominant enswathed within their conceptualizations and research procedures.

让我们再提一下最后一个演变，它可以说是我们如何体验当代世界的核心：社会科学理解人类整体及其局限性的方式发生了变化。在此，对民族国家的质疑是关键因素。建构主义思想再次发挥了主导作用，它使得社会科学（通常是无意识地）在理解“民族”、“社会”和“族群”等实体时所偏爱的那些概念中过于自然化的方面得以被清除。因此，人们努力“解构”这些概念，并将它们所覆盖的现实视为表演而非既定事实。同样，人们也设计出了一些创新的工具，主要是方法论方面的工具，以成功地改变理解现象的分析尺度，并从“网络”的角度思考社会活动，而不受社会群体和边界所提供的既有蓝图的束缚。从这个角度出发，我们可以理解自 21 世纪以来，社会科学对资本主义动力、国家主权的丧失、生态危机监管（和思考）的失败以及资源枯竭的重视。自然资源——所有这些都要求我们从以民族国家为中心的观点中解放出来进行分析。

Let us mention one final evolution, which arguably lies at the heart of how we experience the contemporary world: the change in how the social sciences apprehend humanity as a whole and the limits of our planet. Here, it is the questioning of the nation-state that is the crucial element. Constructivist thought once again played a prime role here, making it possible to flush out the overly naturalizing aspects in the conceptions that the social sciences (often unconsciously) favor for apprehending such entities as “nations,” “societies,” and “ethnic groups.” Hence the effort to “deconstruct” these notions and conceive of the realities they overlay as performances rather than as givens. Hence, too, the devising of innovative instruments, primarily methodological, to successfully vary the scales of analysis for apprehending phenomena and for thinking of social activities in terms of “networks,” without being hidebound by the preexisting blueprint afforded by social groups and borders. This is the viewpoint from which to understand the singular importance that, since the 2000s, the social sciences have attached to the dynamics of capitalism, the loss of state sovereignty, the failures in regulating (and thinking about) the ecological crisis, and the depletion of natural resources—all of which require us to extricate our analysis from a viewpoint centered on nation-states.

在此，社会科学再次展现了它们与其所处社会的演变之间的联系。它们以全球化为对象，并在全球化运动中思考自身的任务，呼吁我们关注催生这些学科的社会历史条件，并确立其真正的政治作用。

Here, once again, the social sciences show how they are connected to evolutions in the societies within which they develop. By taking globalization as their object and conceiving of their task within this movement, they summon us to be mindful of the sociohistorical conditions engendering them and assert their genuinely political role.

西里尔·勒米厄、洛朗·伯杰、玛丽埃尔·梅塞、吉尔达斯·萨蒙和塞西尔·维达尔

Cyril Lemieux, Laurent Berger, Marielle Macé, Gildas Salmon, and Cécile Vidal

笔记

Notes

1 . André Burguière，L'école des Annales：Une histoire intellectuelle（巴黎：Odile Jacob，2006）。简·玛丽·托德 (Jane Marie Todd) 翻译成英文，名为《年鉴学派：一部思想史》（纽约州伊萨卡：康奈尔大学出版社，2009 年）。

1. André Burguière, L’école des Annales: Une histoire intellectuelle (Paris: Odile Jacob, 2006). Translated into English by Jane Marie Todd as The Annales School: An Intellectual History (Ithaca, NY: Cornell University Press, 2009).

2 . Jean-Claude Passeron，《社会学的合理性：Un espace non poppérien de l'argumentation》（巴黎：Albin Michel [“Bibliothèque de 'L'évolution de l'Humanité'”]，[1991] 2006）。雷切尔·戈梅 (Rachel Gomme) 翻译成英文，名为《社会学推理：非波普尔论证空间》（牛津：巴德韦尔出版社，2013 年）。

2. Jean-Claude Passeron, Le raisonnement sociologique: Un espace non poppérien de l’argumentation (Paris: Albin Michel [“Bibliothèque de ‘L’évolution de l’humanité’”], [1991] 2006). Translated into English by Rachel Gomme as Sociological Reasoning: A Non-Popperian Space of Argumentation (Oxford: Bardwell Press, 2013).

3.例如，请参阅沃尔夫·莱佩尼斯（Wolf Lepenies）著《三种文化》（慕尼黑：卡尔·汉瑟出版社，1985年）。RJ·霍林代尔（RJ Hollingdale）将其译为英文，题为《文学与科学之间：社会学的兴起》（剑桥：剑桥大学出版社，1988年）。

3. See, for example, Wolf Lepenies, Die Drei Kulturen (Munich: Carl Hanser Verlag, 1985). Translated into English by R. J. Hollingdale as Between Literature and Science: The Rise of Sociology (Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 1988).

1947

1947

启蒙辩证法：阿多诺与霍克海默诊断启蒙运动的自我毁灭

Dialectic of Enlightenment: Adorno and Horkheimer Diagnose the Self-Destruction of the Enlightenment

《启蒙辩证法》于二战后不久在阿姆斯特丹出版，是西奥多·W·阿多诺（1903—1969）和马克斯·霍克海默（1895—1973）流亡美国期间合作的研究成果。该书旨在理解“人类为何非但不能进入真正人性化的状态，反而陷入了一种新的野蛮状态”。他们非但没有将此解读为回归某种原始野蛮状态，反而将其解读为启蒙理性核心矛盾的表现。尽管启蒙运动（广义上理解为“思想进步”，超越任何时间界限）曾承诺将人类从恐惧中解放出来，但它却只能通过压制这种情感基础，将理性贬低为工具性成分，使其沉迷于算计，被迫只为自保，从而沿着这条道路前进。理性本应为人类的解放而努力，却必然成为统治的工具，阿多诺和霍克海默将理性分为三个领域：运用理性的主要目的是通过劳动赋予人类对自然的力量，而自然被视为一种威胁；这一计划的成功意味着每个个体都将这种统治内化，从而摧毁一切内在的东西，尽管这些内在的东西仍然具有这种性质（作者认为这是精神分析的决定性批判贡献的一种标志）；这种统治结构随后在社会中重复出现，从此统治与被统治不可避免地发生了冲突。

Dialektik der Aufklärung (Dialectic of Enlightenment), published in Amsterdam shortly after the Second World War, is the result of work jointly conducted by Theodor W. Adorno (1903–1969) and Max Horkheimer (1895–1973) when in exile in the United States. It sets out to understand “why humanity, instead of entering a truly human state, is sinking into a new kind of barbarism.” Far from interpreting this as a return to some state of original savagery, they interpret it as expressing a contradiction at the heart of Enlightenment rationality. Though the Enlightenment (taken in the broad meaning of “thought in progress,” above and beyond any chronological demarcation) had promised to free men of fear, it only progressed along this path by repressing this affective substratum and by reducing rationality to its instrumental component, obsessed with calculating means and pressed into the sole service of self-preservation. Reason, which was meant to work for humankind’s emancipation, necessarily became the instrument of domination, divided by Adorno and Horkheimer into three registers: exercising reason has the prime aim of endowing humans, through work, with power over nature, which is perceived as a threat; the success of this program then implies that each individual interiorizes this domination, thereby mutilating everything internal, which nevertheless partakes in this very nature (a way, for the authors, to mark the decisive critical contribution of psychoanalysis); this structure of domination is then repeated within society, in the conflict inevitably thenceforth opposing dominant and dominated.

作者列举了构成“理性自我毁灭”的“困境”的一系列发生方式。启蒙运动的理想被否定于标准化、刻板化的“文化产业”产品和“文化商品”之中，远非塑造自主的个体，促进市场秩序，强化大众的顺从。至于反犹主义，其表面的非理性，不过是启蒙理性屈服于偏执狂的“极限”的另一面：“虚假社会秩序自发孕育的毁灭意志”被投射到犹太人身上。

The authors set out a series of ways in which this “aporia” constituting “the self-destruction of reason” transpires. The ideals of the Enlightenment are denied in the standardized and stereotypical products of the “cultural industry,” and “cultural goods,” far from working to form autonomous individuals, promote the order of the market and reinforce the submission of the masses. As for anti-Semitism, its apparent irrationality is only the other side of the “limits” of Enlightenment rationality succumbing to paranoia: “the will to destroy spontaneously born of a false social order” is projected onto the Jews.

在这些“哲学碎片”（阿多诺和霍克海默于1944年分发给几位亲密同事的第一个非商业版本的标题）的演进过程中，在为权威和偏见的更实证研究奠定基础并铺平道路的同时，三个发人深省的观点逐渐清晰：法西斯主义远非现代性历史的倒退或某种异常偏差，事实上，它深深植根于西方理性的活力之中。科学理性的进步与其说是抵制一切形式的道德和政治倒退的手段，不如说是一种症状，一种杠杆，即使在文化向野蛮状态的可怕逆转中也是如此。至于自由民主国家，它们过于深陷资本主义规律，无法构成壁垒，因此在“操纵群众”方面与威权主义政权一样娴熟。

Over the course of these “philosophical fragments” (the title of the first non-trade version that Adorno and Horkheimer distributed to a few close associates in 1944), while building on and paving the way for more empirical research into authority and prejudice, three provocative ideas come into focus: Fascism, far from being a move backward or some aberrant deviation in the history of modernity, was in fact deeply rooted in the very dynamic of Western rationality. The progress of scientific rationality was not so much a means of resisting all forms of moral and political regression as it was a symptom, a lever even in this monstrous reversal of culture into barbarism. As for liberal democracies, they were too profoundly subject to the law of capitalism to constitute a rampart and thus just as adept as authoritarian regimes in “manipulating the masses.”

然而，将阿多诺和霍克海默归类为“反启蒙”思想家是错误的，因为他们关注的是通过与启蒙本身的概念对立，对启蒙进行内在批判，以便更好地以理性的名义谴责其未兑现承诺的明显丑闻。本书的批判性工作难道还不足以证明，理性一旦能够发挥其自我反思的能力，就会发挥积极作用吗？

It would, however, be mistaken to classify Adorno and Horkheimer as “anti-Enlightenment” thinkers, as their concern was to conduct an immanent critique of the Aufklärung by confronting it with its own concept, the better to denounce, in the name of reason, the blatant scandal of its unfulfilled promise. Is not the critical work conducted in this book sufficient proof of the positive function of reason once it manages to exert its capacity for self-reflection?

《启蒙辩证法》如同“投进大海的瓶子”，其目的无疑并非为了立即产生效果，而是为了维护未来批判性思维的前景。该书于20世纪60年代中期问世，与消费社会的批判产生了共鸣，强化了许多反对殖民帝国主义的抗议活动，并强化了新兴的女性主义诉求。阿多诺和霍克海默将统治问题置于分析的核心，并通过对自然的引用扩展了对经济剥削的传统批判，从而为批判提供了新的视角。某种“生产主义”的理论，马克思主义未必能与之划清界限。在福柯之前（如果我们相信他后来的声明，福柯本人并不知情），阿多诺和霍克海默就揭示了知识如何与权力密不可分。他们勾勒出了一种支配社会学的轮廓，而这种社会学在布迪厄的手中——尽管布迪厄的方法论与他们的基础著作之间存在方法论上的差异——进一步证明了它是多么的丰富。至于构成最后一章的“笔记和草图”（它们刻意分散，强化了整体的碎片化基调），它们被呈现为一种“辩证人类学”，与心理学不同，它考察的不是个体，而是资本主义历史这一阶段出现的新型非个人的人。

Like a “bottle thrown into the sea,” Dialectic of Enlightenment was doubtless not intended to produce immediate effects but rather to safeguard the prospects for future critical thought. When it surfaced in the mid-1960s, the book resonated with critiques of consumer society, reinforcing many protests against colonial imperialism and strengthening nascent feminist demands. By placing the issue of domination at the heart of their analyses, Adorno and Horkheimer also expanded on traditional criticisms of economic exploitation through their reference to nature, feeding into criticism of a certain “productivism” from which Marxism had not necessarily managed to distance itself. Before Foucault (and, if we believe his subsequent avowals, without his knowledge), Adorno and Horkheimer brought to light how knowledge is inextricably bound up with power. They sketched the outlines of a sociology of domination, which, in the hands of Bourdieu—and irrespective of the methodological differences between his approach and their foundational work—went on to prove just how fertile it could be. As for the “notes and sketches” that form the final chapter (and which, in their deliberate dispersal, reinforce the fragmentary tenor of the whole), they are presented as a “dialectical anthropology” that, unlike psychology, examines not the individual but the new type of impersonal human being emerging at this stage in the history of capitalism.

《启蒙辩证法》坚决跨越学科界限，以便更好地理解一种似乎无力阐释的现实，从而引发了争议和激烈的辩论，尤尔根·哈贝马斯和阿克塞尔·霍耐特等人也参与其中，他们声称自己继承了“法兰克福学派”的遗产，尽管在他们看来，这部著作体现了早期“批判理论”的所有缺陷，尤其是因为它宣扬了一种悲观主义和末世论式的“历史哲学”。毫无疑问，这本书理应得到比现在更好的评价，因为它只是个陪衬。阿多诺和霍克海默选择合著这本书，并选择了片段的形式，他们坚决地与所有系统的总体化保持距离，并通过他们带有夸张色彩的微观分析，开创了一种至今仍未过时的理论风格。

Resolutely transgressing disciplinary divides, the better to make intelligible a reality whose irrationality seems to defy all attempts at elucidation, Dialectic of Enlightenment did not fail to spark controversy and polemical debate, including among those, such as Jürgen Habermas and Axel Honneth, who set about claiming the legacy of the “Frankfurt school,” even though the work, in their eyes, embodied all the shortcomings of initial “critical theory,” particularly because it promoted a pessimistic and apocalyptic “philosophy of history.” No doubt the book deserves better than this status as a foil. By choosing to write this book together, and by opting for the form of a fragment, Adorno and Horkheimer resolutely distanced themselves from all systematic totalization and, through their micrological analyses punctuated with hyperbolic exaggerations, invented a theoretical style that remains as untimely as ever.

雅克-奥利维尔·贝戈特

Jacques-Olivier Bégot

西奥多·W·阿多诺和马克斯·霍克海默，《启蒙辩证法》（阿姆斯特丹：Querido出版社，1947年）。英文译本为《启蒙辩证法》，由约翰·卡明译（纽约：Seabury出版社，1969年）和埃德蒙·杰夫科特译（斯坦福，加州：斯坦福大学出版社，2002年）。

Theodor W. Adorno and Max Horkheimer, Dialektik der Aufklärung (Amsterdam: Querido, 1947). Translated into English as Dialectic of Enlightenment, trans. John Cumming (New York: Seabury Press, 1969) and trans. Edmund Jephcott (Stanford, CA: Stanford University Press, 2002).

1948

1948

情境二：萨特对文学的解释

Situations II: Sartre Holds Literature to Account

《情境 II》包含（或曾经包含（2010 年的新版本对《情境》系列进行了不同的划分））一系列关于第二次世界大战后文学地位的文章，最初于 1947 年发表在《现代》杂志上。

Situations II contains—or used to contain (a new edition in 2010 divided up the Situations series differently)—a set of essays about the position of literature in the aftermath of the Second World War, originally published in the journal Les Temps modernes in 1947.

在瓦尔特·本雅明或夏尔·佩吉笔下，“情境”一词表明他们将文学置于历史之中，从而使写作政治化。到了让-保罗·萨特（1905-1980）时期，这个词成为文学应对战争要求的最有效工具。全集以非常著名的《文学是什么？》开篇。萨特在这份自由宣言中首次提出了“介入”（承诺）的概念。虽然这些文字广为人知，但我们需要以一种全新的惊奇感去阅读它们，尤其要惊叹于萨特如何处理这个问题，他不把写作视为一种价值，而是一种匿名的实践，探究其符号学性质、根本目的以及社会用法和意图：写作意味着什么；为什么写作；为谁写作？

Under the pen of Walter Benjamin or Charles Péguy, the word “situation” had signaled that they placed literature within history, thereby politicizing writing. With Jean-Paul Sartre (1905–1980), the word became the most effective instrument for literature to confront the requisitions of the war. The collection opens with the very famous Qu’est-ce que la littérature? (What is literature?). This manifesto for freedom is where Sartre first theorized the notion of “engagement” (commitment). Though these pages are well known, we need to read them with a fresh sense of surprise, marveling particularly at how Sartre addresses the issue, taking writing not as a value but as an anonymous practice, inquiring into its semiotic nature, fundamental purpose, and social usage and intent: What does it mean to write; why write; for whom does one write?

萨特是如何看待这些全新的问题的呢？他批判经典，正如菲利普·鲁辛所言，“终结了法国文学仅仅通过传统来感知自身的模式”。首先，通过将文学与历史联系起来，并追究历史的责任——从战争以及占领和酷刑的教训中汲取教训——他推导出了所有先前文学的意义。以战争的名义，他质疑文学作品所谓的无偿性、文学语言的割裂性、以及文学作品的例外性。作者。在反对文学“贵族主义”的过程中，他认为文学和民主的生活方式是相互支持的，都处于同样脆弱的状态：“散文艺术与散文唯一有意义的体制息息相关：民主。当其中一个受到威胁时，另一个也会受到威胁。”通过根据文学复制现实的能力来评判文学，通过对文学进行社会学分析，萨特撕毁了文学的幻想，探究了文学的合法性，唤醒了人们对文学不当之处的认识（因此，1945 年的诊断加剧了 1916 年的诊断，当时，面对“休假者的沉默”，语言，进而是文学，被判定为无能为力，似乎无法上升到集体经验的水平）。

How does Sartre treat these radically new questions? He repudiates the classics and, as Philippe Roussin observes, “puts an end to French literature’s perceiving itself solely through its tradition.” First, by relating literature to history and holding it to account—from the war and from the lessons of the Occupation and torture—he deduces the meaning of all prior literature. In the name of the war, he takes issue with the supposed gratuity of literary works, the separation of their language, the exceptionality of their authors. Combating literary “aristocracism,” he argues that literature and the democratic form of life are mutually supporting, bound in a state of equal vulnerability: “The art of prose is bound up with the only regime in which prose has meaning: democracy. When one is threatened, the other is too.” In judging literature in the light of its capacity to replicate reality, in sociologizing it, Sartre tears down its chimeras, probes its legitimacy, awakens feelings of its impropriety (1945 thus compounded the diagnosis of 1916, when, faced with “the silence of those on leave,” language, and thereby literature, had been decreed powerless, seemingly incapable of rising to the collective experience).

但萨特也正是通过与法国民族史的决裂，终结了法国文学以自我为中心的倾向。他借用美国小说，将其与法国散文（美国作家提供了一种不同的模式，即不恰当的独一性，与通用语言的纠缠）进行对比，汲取国际经验，并为埃里希·奥尔巴赫所提出的“我们的语文学家园不再是民族：而是地球”的理念铺平了道路。

But it was also by breaking with French national history that Sartre put an end to French literature’s self-focusing bent. He took the American novel and played it off against French prose (American authors offered a different model, that of improper singularity, tussling with the common language), drew on international references, and paved the way for the awareness, formulated by Erich Auerbach, that “our philological home can no longer be the nation: it is the earth.”

然而，尽管后来对它的一些分析很有成功——散文和诗歌之间的区别被认为是无法理解的（如果我们还记得萨特对诗歌的热爱，这倒是很有挑衅性）；将阅读理论化为一种受自由驱动的事情；作家与其读者之间关系的历史——尽管这部作品构成了所有后续立场的基线，包括莫里斯·布朗肖的《火之作品》、罗兰·巴特的《写作零度》和第三世界主义著作，但一篇文学论文在构成社会科学大厦的所有这些书籍中又起着什么作用呢？

Yet, despite the subsequent fortune of some of its analyses—the distinction between prose and poetry, said to be inengageable (provocatively, if we remember Sartre’s love of poems); the theorization of reading as something driven by freedom; the history of the relationship between a writer and his or her public—and despite the importance of a work that formed the baseline for all subsequent positions, including Maurice Blanchot’s La part du feu (The Work of Fire), Roland Barthes’s Le degré zéro de l’écriture (Writing Degree Zero), and third-worldist writings, what is a literary essay doing here among all these books forming the edifice of the social sciences?

萨特在他的文章中发明了一种批判实践，将文学引向社会世界和主体自由——文学由此诞生，并发生了彻底的改变。他对经典的憎恨，他对过去文学（与声望相符）的“自给自足”以及对追逐这种声望的资产阶级作家的批判，奠定了布迪厄后来在与《家庭白痴》作者的一次几乎无声的对话中，构建了他后来的《艺术规则》（Les règles de l'art）的思路，这部作品同样描绘了“他的福楼拜”。萨特奠定了未来的文学——他希望文学能够激发人们对道德和文化经验的批判，将其作为反对奴役的盟友，致力于后来被弗朗茨·法农、爱德华·赛义德和朱迪斯·巴特勒等人所接受的解放诗学。

In his essay, Sartre invents a critical practice that sets literature along the path toward the social world and for subjective freedom—from which literature emerged changed for good. His hatred of the classics, the charges he brings against the “autarky” of past literature (identified with prestige) and bourgeois writers (running after this prestige) established the line on which Bourdieu, in a scarcely submerged dialogue with the author of L’idiot de la famille, later built his Les règles de l’art [The Rules of Art] that likewise depicted “his Flaubert.” Sartre established the literature to come—the literature he hoped for and that he wished his contemporaries capable of—as the spur to a critique of moral and cultural experience, summoning it as an ally against enslavement, working on a poetics of emancipation later taken up by Frantz Fanon, Edward Said, and Judith Butler, among others.

但或许这本书也标志着文学被视为理所当然的时代的结束。因为，在追问文学是什么时，它认为答案并非不证自明，从而将文学置于偶然之中。它也标志着文学思想和文学实践明显参与知识制造的时代的结束。这种参与有一个名字：散文。然而在社会科学领域，后来没有什么比“散文主义”更令人怀疑的了。正是这种散文主义——将写作的参与、对当下的批判和自我动员联系在一起（在《现代》和《批评》这两本综合性期刊虽然由作家创办，但却披上了《新法兰西评论》的外衣）——萨特在其巅峰时期体现了这一点（巴特在他之后也这样做了，尽管要脆弱得多）。

But perhaps this book also marks the end of a period when literature was a given. For, in asking what literature is, it holds the answer to be not self-evident, thus consigning literature to contingency. It also marks the end of the time when it was obvious that literary thought and literary practice partook in the manufacture of knowledge. This involvement had a name: the essay. Yet within the social sciences, nothing would subsequently be more suspect than “essayism.” It is this essayism—connecting the engagement of writing, the critique of the present, and self-mobilization (in a landscape in which Les Temps modernes and Critique, generalist journals, albeit founded by writers, had assumed the mantle of the Nouvelle Revue Française)—that Sartre embodied at his peak (as Barthes did after him, though far more fragilely).

这部社会科学简史以萨特为开端，探讨了这些科学一直以来所质疑的东西：将思想置于形式之上的尊严，即弗朗西斯·蓬热所称的“表达的狂热”。重要的并非写作行为本身——以及它的动机和目的——萨特以此为中心，对文学的定义也愈发独断——是否更优雅或更个人化，而是它是否更真实。而我们今天所见的正是这种表达的狂热，历史学家、人类学家和社会学家们不仅以真诚的态度探究如何进行科学写作，而且也致力于文学和社会科学共同的目标：对现实的坚定描述。这正是萨特对散文所要求的投入的核心意义：确保没有人能够声称对世界一无所知，并且所有人都必须为此负责。

It is significant that this brief history of the social sciences opens, with Sartre, on what these sciences have continually doubted: the dignity of engaging thought in matters of form, what Francis Ponge has called “the rage for expression.” Because what matters is not whether the act of writing, with its motives and destination—around which Sartre wove his definition of literature ever more sovereignly—is more elegant or more personal, but whether it is more true. And it is precisely this rage for expression we encounter today in the sincerity with which historians, anthropologists, and sociologists not only ask how to go about writing their science but engage with the purpose that literature and the social sciences have in common: namely, an unyielding description of reality. This is the meaning at the heart of the engagement that Sartre demanded of prose: to ensure that nobody could claim ignorance of the world, and that all be answerable for it.

玛丽埃尔·马塞

Marielle Macé

让-保罗·萨特，《情境 II》（巴黎：伽利玛，1948 年）。由伽利玛重新出版，2012 年。

Jean-Paul Sartre, Situations II (Paris: Gallimard, 1948). Republished by Gallimard, 2012.

1949

1949

腓力二世时代的地中海和地中海世界:布罗代尔的交错持续时间

The Mediterranean and the Mediterranean World in the Age of Philip II: Braudel’s Interlocking Durations

1940年至1945年间，费尔南·布罗代尔（1902-1985）在德国战俘营中完成了他二十年前开始的关于西班牙国王菲利普二世时期地中海的论文的最终架构。他选择将自己的研究分解成不同的层面或层次，并区分了构成其分析的三个时间框架。第一部分是“长时段”：一段“几乎静止”、“几乎永恒的历史”，对应着地中海的气候和环境、地貌的起伏和稳定性，以及与撒哈拉沙漠、北欧、俄罗斯和大西洋相连的扩张的地中海。第二部分考察了十六世纪的时局及其经济波动；这对应着一段“慢节奏”的“社会”历史，描述了价格周期、贸易流动、社会阶层分化以及各种形式的战争。接下来是第三部分，致力于事件和政治，正如布罗代尔所观察到的，这是更“传统”的部分，呈现了西班牙与奥斯曼帝国之间战争的快速发展、外交谈判和条约，包括关于菲利普二世之死的著名篇章。

Between 1940 and 1945, while in a German prison camp, Fernand Braudel (1902–1985) put the finishing touches to the definitive architecture of his thesis, started twenty years earlier, about the Mediterranean in the time of King Philip II of Spain. He chose to dissect his study into various planes, or tiers, distinguishing between three time frames structuring his analysis. The first is that of the longue durée: a “virtually motionless,” “almost timeless history,” corresponding to the Mediterranean climate and environment, geomorphological relief and stability, and an expanded Mediterranean linked to the Sahara, northern Europe, Russia, and the Atlantic Ocean. The second part examines the conjuncture of the sixteenth century and its economic oscillations; this corresponds to a “slow rhythmed” “social” history, describing price cycles, trade flows, the stratification of societies, and the various forms of warfare. Then comes the third part, devoted to events and politics, the more “traditional” part, as Braudel observes, presenting the rapid movement of battles pitting Spain against the Ottomans, diplomatic talks and treaties, and including the famous pages about the death of Philip II.

布罗代尔希望《地中海》一书能够成为战争结束后书写和研究历史的新方式的宣言。这一方法，在1947年高等研究实践学院（EPHE）新成立的经济与社会科学系的制度支持下，发扬了与《年鉴》相关的社会和经济史类型。尽管这本书最终几乎没有使用数字和测量数据，但它试图建立与经济史和社会学的对话。然而，在书中纷繁复杂的描述和丰富的隐喻中，读者主要从中领悟到的是对社会历史时期的层次化理解。直到后来，布罗代尔才彻底改变了他在这一主题上的史学立场：在他发表于《年鉴》的著名文章《长时段》（1958）中，他呼吁整个社会科学，在结构主义的背景下，将地理和环境的长期影响融入到社会事实的分析和理解中，从而使历史学科在“人文科学”的统一中占据主导地位。

Braudel wanted La Méditerranée (The Mediterranean) to function as a manifesto for a new way of writing and doing history now that the war was over. This approach, with the institutional backing provided by the founding of the new economics and social science section in 1947 at the École pratique des hautes études (EPHE), carried forward the type of social and economic history associated with the Annales. Although the book finally contained little in the way of figures and measurements, it sought to establish a dialogue with economic history and sociology. Nevertheless, among its mosaic of descriptions and bountiful metaphors, what readers mainly took from the book was the layered conception of sociohistorical times. It was only later, though, that Braudel radicalized his historiographical positions on this subject: In his famous article in the Annales on the longue durée (1958), he invited the social sciences as a whole, in the face of structuralism, to integrate the long-term effects of geography and the environment in analyzing and understanding social facts, thus giving the historical discipline a predominant place in the unity of the “human sciences.”

“我已经不知道多少次重启《地中海》了”，他在 1977 年解释道。事实上，在撰写《文明与资本主义》第一卷（1967-1979 年）的同时，布罗代尔还准备了第二卷，该卷经过了大量修改，影响深远，其美国译本（1972 年）为他赢得了国际认可。凭借他在年鉴、欧洲政治与经济学院和法国学院的地位，他现在被杰克·赫克斯特讽刺地称为“布罗代尔世界”的圈子所包围，这是一个由学生、通讯员和同事组成的庞大网络，他们为新成立的历史研究中心出版的“商务与商人”和“港口、道路、交通”系列丛书作出了贡献。他们的作品为《地中海》补充了笔记、地图以及关于16世纪意大利领土或大西洋的新资料。他们共同证实了本书的主要论点之一——地中海的政治重要性和经济繁荣一直持续到17世纪中叶甚至更久远。布罗代尔参考了从西班牙、法国、意大利和杜布罗夫尼克收集的大量文献，但他意识到，要复兴近代地中海研究，就必须更好地了解土耳其档案和奥斯曼世界。《地中海》一如既往地充满了直觉和启发，并不断开拓新的研究领域，例如环境史、商人网络和行为、迁徙和人员流动、沿海社会海上贸易的形式以及债役劳工。

“I have restarted La Méditerranée I don’t know how many times,” he explained in 1977. In fact, while writing the first volume (1967–1979) of Civilisation matérielle, économie et capitalisme (Civilization and Capitalism), Braudel also prepared a second, substantially reworked and influential edition, whose American translation (1972) brought him international recognition. On the strength of his position at Annales, at the EPHE, and at the Collège de France, he was now surrounded by what Jack Hexter ironically dubbed the “Braudelian world,” an entire extended network of students, correspondents, and associates contributing to works published by the newly formed Centre de recherches historiques in the “Affaires et gens d’affaires” (Trade and traders) and “Ports, routes, trafics” (Ports, roads, traffic) series. Their work supplemented The Mediterranean with notes, maps, and new data about the Italian lands in the sixteenth century or the Atlantic. Together, they confirmed one of the main theses of the book—namely, that the political importance and economic prosperity of the Mediterranean were maintained through to the mid-seventeenth century and beyond even. Braudel, who had drawn on a mass of documentation gathered in Spain, France, Italy, and Dubrovnik, nevertheless came to realize that the renewal of studies on the Mediterranean in the early modern period necessarily entailed better knowledge of Turkish archives and the Ottoman world. As full of intuitions and suggestions as ever, La Méditerranée continued to feed into new avenues of inquiry, such as environmental history, merchant networks and behavior, migrations and personal mobility, the forms taken by maritime trade traffic in coastal societies, and bonded labor.

布罗代尔在《地中海》中阐述的关于空间和时间的思考方式，在过去四十年中极大地激发了人们对尺度和持续时间如何相互交织的思考。此外，正如哲学家们（其中首当其冲的是保罗·利科）所指出的那样，对于任何对历史叙事情节感兴趣的人而言，布罗代尔的作品仍然是必读之作。例如，关于1571年勒班陀战役的段落包含反事实命题，表明布罗代尔也是一位研究历史进程中可能性和非连续性的历史学家。布罗代尔的地理史学风格也被应用于世界各地的其他“地中海地区”，例如东南亚、印度洋、加勒比海和波罗的海。甚至“全球”历史学家也将自己的血统追溯到布罗代尔，尽管这里偶尔存在误解，因为在他的例子中，“全球性”与涵盖整个世界的规模无关，而与“系统地超越历史问题的界限”的方式有关。

Braudel’s way of thinking about space and time, as set out in La Méditerranée, has substantially fueled thought over the past forty years on how scales and durations interlock. Additionally, as shown by philosophers (first among them, Paul Ricœur), Braudel remains essential reading for anyone interested in the plotting of historical narratives. For example, the passages on the 1571 Battle of Lepanto contain counterfactual propositions, showing that Braudel was also a historian of the possibilities and discontinuities within historical processes. Braudel’s style of geohistory has also been applied to other “Mediterraneans” around the world—for example, Southeast Asia, the Indian Ocean, the Caribbean, and the Baltic Sea. Even “global” historians trace a lineage back to Braudel, despite there being the occasional misunderstanding here, for in his instance the “globality” has less to do with a scale encompassing the whole world than with a way of “systematically going beyond the limits” of a historical problem.

《地中海》一书显然包含一些过时的段落，例如关于“伊斯兰文明”落后的论述，这些论述带有其写作时的殖民主义和发展主义语境的印记，导致布罗代尔忽视了近代早期西欧与伊斯兰世界之间相互借鉴的同时性和互惠性。该书也因其以欧洲为中心的“地中海主义”而受到批评。在布罗代尔之后，“地中海研究”这个充满不确定性的领域持续探讨着地中海世界所呈现的统一、分裂和断裂的形式。如今，地中海不再被视为一个“例外”，而是一个充满活力的历史和社会科学研究实验室——而费尔南·布罗代尔的杰作无疑为其奠定了基础。

La Méditerranée obviously contains dated passages, such as those about the backwardness of “Islamic civilizations,” which bear the mark of the colonial then developmentalist context in which it was written, leading Braudel to neglect the simultaneity and reciprocity of borrowings between Western Europe and Islam in the early modern period. The book has also been criticized for its Eurocentric “Mediterraneanism.” In the wake of Braudel, the uncertain field of “Mediterranean studies” has continually debated the forms of unity, fragmentation, and fracture affecting the Mediterranean world. Nowadays, the Mediterranean is no longer thought of as an “exceptional” figure but as a very lively laboratory for research in history and the social sciences—a laboratory whose foundations were undeniably laid by Fernand Braudel’s masterpiece.

纪尧姆·卡拉法特

Guillaume Calafat

费尔南·布罗代尔，《地中海与菲利普二世时代的地中海世界》，3 卷。 （巴黎：阿曼德·科林，1949）。由阿曼德·科林 (Armand Colin) 重新出版，2017 年。由西安·雷诺兹 (Siân Reynolds) 翻译成英文，名为《菲利普二世时代的地中海和地中海世界》 (纽约：Harper & Row，1972-1973)。

Fernand Braudel, La Méditerranée et le monde méditerranéen à l’époque de Philippe II, 3 vols. (Paris: Armand Colin, 1949). Republished by Armand Colin, 2017. Translated into English by Siân Reynolds as The Mediterranean and the Mediterranean World in the Age of Philip II (New York: Harper & Row, 1972–1973).

1949

1949

亲属关系的基本结构：列维-斯特劳斯在婚姻交换的基础上建立了亲属关系

The Elementary Structures of Kinship: Lévi-Strauss Founds Kinship on Matrimonial Exchange

美国人类学家罗伯特·洛维在美国流亡数年后，于索邦大学阅读了克劳德·列维-斯特劳斯（1908-2009）所捍卫的《国家论》时，简洁地将其描述为“风格宏大”。如果说列维-斯特劳斯关于《南比克瓦拉印第安人的家庭和社会生活》的次要论点非常古典，那么主要论点《亲属关系的基本结构》则因其项目、风格和方法的雄心而格外突出。它的伟大成就在于提出了一个综合理论，该理论涵盖了一系列此前已被广泛争论但迄今为止仍被单独设想的事实：我们该如何解释乱伦禁令的普遍性（它是所有地方最低限度的禁止婚姻形式）及其应用的极大可变性（被禁止的人群范围在不同社会之间差异很大）？为什么亲属群体是外婚的？我们该如何解释某些堂兄弟姐妹的孩子（交叉堂兄弟姐妹）之间会出现特权结合，而两姐妹或两兄弟的孩子（平行堂兄弟姐妹）之间却不会出现特权结合？我们该如何从社会进化的角度解释亲属制度的出现？在回答这些问题时，列维-斯特劳斯提出了一系列答案，这些答案的独创性表明了一种方法——结构分析——受到了索绪尔和雅各布森语言学的启发。

On reading the thèse d’État defended by Claude Lévi-Strauss (1908–2009) at the Sorbonne after several years of exile in the United States, the American anthropologist Robert Lowie laconically described it as being “in the grand style.” If Lévi-Strauss’s secondary thesis on La vie familiale et sociale des Indiens Nambikwara (Family and Social Life of the Nambikwara Indians) is highly classical, the primary thesis—Les structures élémentaires de la parenté (The Elementary Structures of Kinship)—stands out starkly for the ambition of its project, style, and method. Its great achievement is to present a synthetic theory of a set of facts that had already been extensively debated but hitherto envisaged separately: How are we to explain both the universality of the incest prohibition (it is a minima a forbidden form of marriage in all places) and the extreme variability with which it is applied (with the circle of prohibited people varying considerably from one society to another)? Why are kinship groups exogamous? How are we to explain the occurrence of privileged unions between certain cousins, the children of a brother and a sister (cross-cousins) and not between children of two sisters or two brothers (parallel cousins)? How are we to interpret the emergence of kinship systems from the viewpoint of social evolution? In answering these questions, Lévi-Strauss puts forward a series of answers whose originality announces a method—structural analysis—inspired by the linguistics of Ferdinand de Saussure and Roman Jakobson.

正如语言的音素没有内在意义，只有位置意义，亲属群体也不能独立存在。彼此。在亲属关系领域，优先于这些条款的关系是婚姻。婚姻不能简化为两个人之间的私人契约，而是一种交换形式，两个家庭群体结成联盟，各自让出一名成员。将交换作为亲属关系体系的主要原因（基于莫斯的著作）有两个好处。它使得解决乱伦禁令的来源问题成为可能。婚姻交换包含了这一禁令的逻辑含义，因为它强制人们与自己的亲属圈外的人结婚。由于一个男人不可能娶自己的姐妹或女儿，他被迫娶另一个男人的姐妹或女儿，而另一个男人则放弃与自己的近亲结婚。因此，无需推测乱伦禁令的起源。外婚和乱伦禁令只是同一家庭单位之间交换命令的两个方面——一个是消极的，一个是积极的——否则，这些家庭单位就会被孤立。这种亲属结构理论也是一种进化论的设想，因为从此以后，我们无法想象在乱伦禁令出现之前，家庭单位的存在。家庭的概念并非晚于文化的出现，而是文化最明显的伴随表达。

In the same way as the phonemes of a language have no intrinsic but only positional meaning, so kinship groups do not exist independently of one another. In the field of kinship, the relationship that takes precedence over the terms is marriage. Marriage, which cannot be reduced to a private contract between two people, is a form of exchange in which two family groups enter into an alliance in which each cedes one of its members. Taking exchange as the prime reason for kinship systems (building on work by Mauss) presents two advantages. It makes it possible to solve the question of where the incest prohibition comes from. Matrimonial exchange contains the logical implication of this prohibition, in that it imposes marrying outside one’s own circle of relatives. Since it is impossible for a man to marry his sister or daughter, he is compelled to marry the sister or daughter of another man, who in turn renounces marrying his own close relatives. There is thus no need to speculate on the origin of the incest prohibition. Exogamy and incest prohibition are just the two faces—one negative, one positive—of a same imperative of exchange between family units otherwise condemned to isolation. This structural theory of kinship is also an evolutionist scenario, for it is henceforth impossible to imagine the existence of family units prior to the emergence of the incest prohibition. The idea of the family is not posterior to the emergence of culture, it is the most manifest concomitant expression thereof.

这种分析的第二个优势在于，它解释了关于交叉堂表兄弟姐妹之间婚姻的看似武断的原则。列维-斯特劳斯区分了两种结构：一种是基本结构，在基本结构中，婚姻联盟受到禁令的约束，尤其是与某某亲属结婚的禁令；另一种是复杂结构，在复杂结构中，虽然确定了被禁止的亲属范围，但没有制定任何关于配偶选择的指导方针。

The second advantage of such an analysis is that it explains the apparently arbitrary principles relating to marriage between cross-cousins. Lévi-Strauss distinguishes between elementary structures, in which matrimonial alliances are regulated by prohibitions but especially by injunctions to marry such and such a relative, and complex structures in which the circle of prohibited relatives is identified, though without laying down any guidelines about the choice of spouse.

基于对澳大利亚、南印度、中国乃至西伯利亚的比较研究，列维-斯特劳斯梳理出了两种交换模式：受限交换，即两个男人交换姐妹的双边婚姻；以及广义交换，与母系婚姻的不对称性相关，基于至少三个群体相互指向的循环（A给予B，B给予C，C给予A）。第三种模式，即父系婚姻，介于前两者之间，类似于一种延迟受限交换，互惠行为被延迟。父系婚姻不仅会延续到下一代，还会造成不对称婚姻，导致周期缩短、整合度降低。与澳大利亚实践所体现的双边婚姻不同，也与马塞尔·格拉涅在中国和荷兰学派在印度尼西亚观察到的母系婚姻不同，父系婚姻更符合模式而非经验观察。列维-斯特劳斯倡导的转型分析——后来因其对美洲印第安人神话的广泛比较研究而得到微调——将所研究的每一种亲属关系体系变成了所有其他亲属关系体系的变体。该书于1969年由罗德尼·尼达姆译成英文，但列维-斯特劳斯的形式主义对于英国的经验主义传统来说似乎过于抽象和推测，正如他与埃德蒙·利奇就缅甸克钦族普遍交流进行的著名辩论所证明的那样。尽管如此，列维-斯特劳斯的直觉还是在印度南部结出了硕果，这要归功于路易·杜蒙特 (Louis Dumont) 的工作，当时杜蒙特在亚马逊地区开展了民族志研究，而该地区也开始兴起。

Based on comparative work encompassing Australia, southern India, China, and even Siberia, Lévi-Strauss teases out two formulas for exchange: restricted exchange, bilateral marriage in which two men exchange their sisters; and generalized exchange, associated with the asymmetry of matrilateral marriage, based on cycles in which at least three groups point toward each other (A gives to B who gives to C who gives to A). The third formula, that of patrilateral marriage, comes somewhere between the other two and is assimilated to a deferred restricted exchange, with reciprocity being delayed to the following generation, but also to asymmetric marriage, giving rise to shorter and less integrative cycles. Unlike bilateral marriage, exemplified by practices in Australia, and unlike matrilateral marriage, whose existence was observed by Marcel Granet in China and by the Dutch school in Indonesia, patrilateral marriage is more consistent with the model than with empirical observation. The transformational analysis advocated by Lévi-Strauss—and subsequently fined-tuned by his vast comparative undertaking on Amerindian myth—turned each kinship system studied into a variant of all the others. The book was translated into English by Rodney Needham in 1969, but Lévi-Strauss’s formalism seemed too abstract and speculative for the British empirical tradition, as evidenced in the famous debate with Edmund Leach about the generalized exchange of the Kachin of Burma. Lévi-Strauss’s intuitions nevertheless bore fruit in southern India, thanks to work by Louis Dumont, then in Amazonia, after ethnographic research took off into this part of the world.

最严厉的批评直指交换的概念：要么从女权主义视角质疑女性作为男性群体之间交换对象的从属地位，要么质疑交换的普遍性，尤其是在那些偏重内生结合（例如兄弟子女之间的结合）或对婚姻几乎不予承认的社会（例如中国的“那”）中。但列维-斯特劳斯坚持自己的理论，通过颠倒概念（女性也可以交换男性，而无需改变任何模式）并主张交换的普遍性是亲属关系体系的必要条件，驳斥了女权主义的批评。《基本结构》出版近七十年后，依然是一部既深刻鼓舞人心又令人深感不安的独特著作。它享有罕见的特权，至今仍受到与其主张同等力度的质疑和推崇。

The severest criticisms have been directed toward the idea of exchange: either in disputing, from a feminist perspective, the subordinate position of women as objects of exchange between groups of men, or by questioning the universality of exchange, in the light of societies that privilege endogenous unions (between the children of two brothers) or those that afford only marginal recognition to marriage (the Na of China). But Lévi-Strauss stood by his theory, refuting feminist criticisms by inverting the terms (women could just as well exchange men without altering any aspect of the model) and by arguing for the universality of exchange as a necessary condition for kinship systems. Nearly seventy years after it was first published, Les structures élémentaires remains a unique work that is both deeply inspiring and profoundly disconcerting. It enjoys the rare privilege of still being contested and celebrated with a force equaling the power of its propositions.

洛朗·加贝尔

Laurent Gabail

克洛德·列维-斯特劳斯 (Claude Lévi-Strauss)，《Les Structures élémentaires de la Parenté》（巴黎：Presses universitaires de France [“Bibliothèque de philosophie contemporaine”]，1949 年）。由 Éditions de l'EHESS 重新出版，2017 年。由 James Harle Bell、John Richard von Sturmer 和 Rodney Needham 翻译成英文，名为《亲属关系的基本结构》（波士顿：Beacon Press，1969）。

Claude Lévi-Strauss, Les structures élémentaires de la parenté (Paris: Presses universitaires de France [“Bibliothèque de philosophie contemporaine”], 1949). Republished by Éditions de l’EHESS, 2017. Translated into English by James Harle Bell, John Richard von Sturmer, and Rodney Needham as The Elementary Structures of Kinship (Boston: Beacon Press, 1969).

1949

1949

男性与女性：米德消除了两性之间的差异

Male and Female: Mead Denaturalizes the Difference between the Sexes

西蒙娜·德·波伏娃 (Simone de Beauvoir) 发表《第二性》 ( Le deuxième sexe )的同一年，玛格丽特·米德 (Margaret Mead，1901-1978) 考察了男性和女性身份的建构，比较了她之前研究过的八个社会中两性关系的个体发生，这八个社会是波利尼西亚（《萨摩亚的成年》 ，1928 年）、印度尼西亚（《巴厘人的性格》 ，1942 年，与她的第三任丈夫人类学家格雷戈里·贝特森 (Gregory Bateson) 合著）、美国（《保持你的火药干燥》，1942 年）和美拉尼西亚（《在新几内亚长大》，1930 年；《三个原始社会中的性和气质》，1935 年）。

In the same year that Simone de Beauvoir published Le deuxième sexe (The Second Sex), Margaret Mead (1901–1978) examined the construction of male and female identities, comparing the ontogenesis of the relations between the sexes in eight societies she had already studied in Polynesia (Coming of Age in Samoa, 1928), Indonesia (Balinese Character, 1942, written with anthropologist Gregory Bateson, her third husband), the United States (And Keep Your Powder Dry, 1942), and Melanesia (Growing up in New Guinea, 1930; Sex and Temperament in Three Primitive Societies, 1935).

米德在哥伦比亚大学师从弗朗兹·博厄斯和露丝·本尼迪克特，他信奉文化主义，强调幼儿在社会化和文化熏陶下习得的行为的多样性，以及成年人在传统文化中的交流和同化。自20世纪20年代起，心理学和精神分析学逐渐融入这些人类学家的思想。尽管他们经常驳斥弗洛伊德的“教条”，尤其是俄狄浦斯情结，但他们仍在探寻除了语言之外，社会中“潜意识”存在并代代相传的东西。

A pupil of Franz Boas and Ruth Benedict at Columbia, Mead adhered to culturalism, which stresses the variability of behaviors acquired through the socialization and enculturation of young children and by the communication and acculturation of traditions among adults. As of the 1920s, psychology and psychoanalysis fed into the thought of these anthropologists who, though often refuting the Freudian doxa, particularly the Oedipus complex, sought what, in addition to language, is “unconscious” within societies and transmitted from one generation to the next.

米德关注亲子关系，以探寻在不同文化中，男性和女性获得从事某种活动、以某种方式行事的能力的条件。她的方法基于两个关键理念：男性和女性角色的固定源于两性之间功能和解剖学上的差异，这些差异与物种的繁衍息息相关，但并非由这些差异决定（弗朗索瓦丝·埃里蒂尔称之为“性别的差异价”）；这种与性别相关的属性的习得发生在儿童和青少年时期的关系动态，基于身体孔口（口腔和肛门）和生殖器官（外阴和阴茎）的差异化使用。

Mead focuses on parent/child relations to identify the conditions in which men and women acquire aptitudes to carry out such and such an activity, to behave in such and such a manner, from one culture to another. Her approach is driven by two key ideas: The fixing of male and female roles derives from functional and anatomical differences between the sexes linked to the reproduction of the species yet without being determined by these (what Françoise Héritier went on to call the “differential valence of the sexes”); this acquisition of sex-related attributes takes place within the relational dynamics at work in childhood and adolescence, based around the differentiated usage of bodily orifices (the mouth and anus) and the genital organs (the vulva and penis).

米德理论的精妙之处就在于此，该理论以贝特森关于“分裂发生”的研究为基础，却常常被误解：科学界列举的性别化身体的生物学不变量看似先天性，但实际上，只有通过男女之间互补对称或互惠的关系，它们才能被实现、取代、强化或抑制。例如，男性分泌大量睾酮可能导致支配态度，但男性的这种行为也会引发女性的顺从态度，反过来强化这些性别属性之间的相互依存关系（“互补性分裂发生”），以至于女性会模仿和复制这种依存关系，从而在两种性别中相互加剧，最终产生两种等同的性别（“对称性分裂发生”）。只有互惠原则才能稳定这些互补或对称调整的行为，在第一种情况下，通过两性交替变换支配和服从的形式，或者在第二种情况下，通过同时放弃激进形式的支配行为。

This is where the subtlety of Mead’s theory, underpinned by Bateson’s work on “schismogenesis,” has often been misunderstood: The biological invariants of sexuated bodies listed by the sciences may seem to be innate predispositions; but they are in fact only actualized, or replaced, reinforced, or inhibited, through complimentary symmetrical or reciprocal relations deployed between men and women. For example, the secretion of large quantities of testosterone may lead to attitudes of dominance, but such behavior by men also triggers an opposed attitude of submission among women, retroactively reinforcing the interdependence of these gendered attributes (“complimentary schismogenesis”), to the extent that it will be imitated and reproduced by these women and thus mutually exacerbated in either sex, hence engendering two equivalent genders (“symmetrical schismogenesis”).
