This is the entire thrust of the first part of the book, written after the second: It describes in great detail the lifestyle of the working class—their way of living, thinking, judging, and appreciating—so as to reposition the cultural products imposed on them within their way of life. The error was to suppose that individuals were like putty, in which the stereotypical messages of mass culture were imprinted. On the contrary, Hoggart argues, the new cultural products were linked in complex ways with the traditional values of this working class, who actively reinterpreted them to support new attitudes. Additionally, the second error of the declinist approach was to screen off or underestimate what individuals did with the cultural products that they admittedly consumed: Irony, skepticism, nonchalant consumption, oblique attention—all functioning as forms of resistance and distancing—are fundamental to understanding what actually happens when reading a tabloid or sensational magazine.

如果说霍加特在这本书出版时已年届四十，是一位愤怒的年轻人，那么他首先是一个缺乏纪律的人，而这种缺乏纪律的各种表现形式为文化研究开辟了丰富的途径，首先是赋予了“文化”一个更广泛的定义，因为它现在涵盖了生活方式和生活方式。但创新之处也在于他的方法，再次打破了传统实践，又对其进行了拓展。凭借文学教育，霍加特借鉴了文学批评的工具，但将其应用于那些自认为是流行文化作品以来就不合法的文化产品。同样，他也打破了知识分子居高临下的姿态：他的写作采用了主观维度来审视文化。知识生产，文本结合了民族志研究和自传段落。他的作品大量借鉴了他作为年轻孤儿的记忆，他在一个由祖母、两个姑妈和一个谦逊的叔叔组成的家庭中长大。事实上，在回应那些指责他忽视劳动世界和生产关系分析，而不是关注家庭领域时，他回应说，他作为奖学金获得者的身份使他更加牢牢地困在了这个远离传统男性价值观的“女性”世界中。最后，如果说阅读《识字的用途》是一种享受，那无疑是因为他对细节的不懈关注，以及他所写一切的民族志精确性：对感觉、姿势、手势和气味的重视；使用间接的自由话语，使得知识分子的措辞中充满了“常识”的表达。所有这些让我们能够听到内心的对话，几乎是感官地体验到一位文学教授的怀旧之情，有时甚至是痛苦的矛盾，这位文学教授在改变了阶级之后，现在成为了文化研究的颂扬者。

If Hoggart, who was forty years old when the book came out, was an angry young man, he was above all undisciplined, and the various forms of this indiscipline opened fruitful paths for research into culture, first by providing this term with a far larger definition, since it now encompassed ways of life and lifestyles. But the innovation also resided in his method, once again both breaking with and expanding on traditional practice. With his literary education, Hoggart drew on the tools of literary criticism but applied them to cultural products that were illegitimate since decidedly works of popular culture. Equally, he broke with the stance of the intellectual looking down from on high: His writing assumes the subjective dimension to the production of knowledge, with the text combining ethnographic study and autobiographical passages. His writing draws abundantly on his memories as a young orphan brought up in a world of women in a household composed of a grandmother, two aunts, and a self-effacing uncle. Indeed, in answer to the accusation that he neglected the world of work and analysis of production relations, instead of focusing on the domestic sphere, he responded that his position as a scholarship boy had kept him even more firmly enclosed in this “feminine” world removed from traditional masculine values. Lastly, if it is such a pleasure to read The Uses of Literacy, it is no doubt because of his unflagging attention to detail, the ethnographic precision permeating everything he writes: the importance accorded to sensations, postures, gestures, and smells; the use of indirect free discourse causing the intellectual phrasing to be strewn with “common sense” expressions. All this allows us to hear the interior dialogues and to experience, almost sensorially, the nostalgia and at times the painful contradictions of a professor of literature who, having changed class, was now the eulogist of cultural studies.

正因如此，《读写能力的用途》堪称一本开创性的著作。它引入了思考文化、文化影响及其受众的新视角；它提倡多学科交叉，并引发了关于社会科学写作方式的持续争论。

For all these reasons, The Uses of Literacy is a pioneering book. It introduced new ways of thinking about culture, its effects, and its publics; it promoted multidisciplinarity and initiated the ongoing debate on ways to write the social sciences.

克里斯汀·德特雷兹

Christine Détrez

理查德·霍加特（Richard Hoggart），《识字的用途：工人阶级生活的方方面面，特别指出版物和娱乐》（伦敦：Chatto & Windus，1957 年）。

Richard Hoggart, The Uses of Literacy: Aspects of Working-Class Life with Special Reference to Publications and Entertainments (London: Chatto & Windus, 1957).

1957

1957

神话学：巴特运用符号学来揭开神话的神秘面纱

Mythologies: Barthes Deploys Semiology to Demystify Myth

《神话学》至今仍是罗兰·巴特（1915-1980）最常被提及的著作。它的成功出乎意料。这本1957年出版的著作收录了巴特1954年至1956年间发表于期刊的文章，几乎全部涉及时事（巴特在其1971年的序言中称之为“我的时事”）：多米尼奇事件、媒体对皮埃尔神父的追捧、布热迪主义对政坛的介入、雪铁龙DS 19的推出、塑料如何渗透到日常生活中、好莱坞史诗巨片。乍一看，《神话学》并没有什么迹象表明它会成为未来的经典，或引领一种新的研究类型。

Mythologies is still the book most often associated with Roland Barthes (1915–1980). Its success is counterintuitive. The 1957 volume is a collection of articles published in periodicals between 1954 and 1956, nearly all of which are about current affairs (“my current affairs” as Barthes states in his 1971 preface): the Dominici affair, the lionization of Abbé Pierre in the media, the irruption of Poujadism into politics, the launch of the Citroën DS 19, the way plastic was making its way into everyday life, Hollywood epics. On the face of it, nothing marked Mythologies out as a future classic, or as giving rise to a new type of research.

所有的奉献至少部分基于一种误解。到了20世纪80年代，巴特所讨论的“材料”已不再具有任何“时效性”。他的许多参考文献已变得晦涩难懂。虽然并非所有物件和事件都已被遗忘，但它们都已过时，足以滋生怀旧的解读：DS 19如今将读者带回了过去，而半熟牛排则散发着昔日的滋味。神话获得了一种复古的魅力。它被阅读、模仿，并以感伤的语气被单独挑出；它已成为“复古”。巴特早已预见到这一点：在最后一页，他指责自己赋予了某些物件一种“令人惊喜的紧凑性，我对此欣喜若狂”，但这与其批判性和战斗性的目的格格不入。

All consecrations are at least partly based on a misunderstanding. By the 1980s, there was no longer anything “current” about the “material” discussed by Barthes. Many of his references had become opaque. While not all the objects and events had fallen into oblivion, they were all sufficiently outdated to foster nostalgic interpretations: The DS 19 now transported readers back to earlier days, while the rare steak tasted of times past. Mythologies had acquired a retro charm. It was read, imitated, and singled out in sentimental terms; it had become “vintage.” Barthes had foreseen this: on the final page he accuses himself of having endowed certain objects with a “surprising compactness which I savored with delight,” but which was ill-suited to its critical and militant purpose.

说实话，无论是为了感性地探究过去而援引“小神话”，还是将其纳入一本插图华丽的版本（2010年），都无法解释它们所引发的冲击波。要衡量其影响力究竟有多大，我们需要先把后续的解读放在一边。并重新认识到《神话学》是一项多么新颖的事业。在第四共和国即将结束的日子里，它就像一个晴天霹雳。1957 年，所有读者都感到震惊。让·拉克鲁瓦在《世界报》上称其为“一本非凡的书”（这个词的含义很强烈：他非但没有喜欢这本书，反而认为它，也许还有它的作者，是“深刻而残酷的”）。虽然《神话学》可能会让我们微笑，但它却让最初的读者感到震惊，当巴特出现在电视节目《Lectures pour tous》中时，节目主持人皮埃尔·德格劳普斯明显有点吃惊。

To tell the truth, neither the enlisting of “little mythologies” for sentimental research into times past nor their insertion in a sumptuously illustrated edition (2010) can account for the shockwave they produced. To gauge just how powerful this was, we need to set the subsequent readings to one side and appreciate anew how fiercely novel an undertaking Mythologies was. In the dying days of the Fourth Republic, it came like a bolt out of a not-so-blue sky. In 1957, readers all experienced a sense of shock. Writing in Le Monde, Jean Lacroix spoke of “an extraordinary book” (in the strong meaning of the term: far from delighting in it as palatable, he held it, and perhaps its author, to be “profound and cruel”). Though Mythologies might make us smile, it alarmed its initial readers, and when Barthes appeared on the TV show Lectures pour tous, the show’s host, Pierre Desgraupes, was visibly a bit startled.

巴特让物体说话的方式，是他首先震撼读者的震撼，也是他抓住读者的第一个举动。据一则关于让-保罗·萨特的著名轶事所述，他从柏林接触到现象学后，向朋友雷蒙·阿隆解释了他所获得的启示：一杯啤酒也能引发哲学思考！《神话学》的启示在于，我们可以对勒内·科蒂总统的一瓶多梅尼酒或一包洗衣粉进行社会批判和政治分析。更妙的是，我们可以运用后记中阐述的方法，以严谨甚至科学的方式进行分析。

The first shock, the first move that grabbed the reader, was the way in which Barthes made objects talk. According to a well-known anecdote about Jean-Paul Sartre, on returning from Berlin, where he had come across phenomenology, he explained to his friend Raymond Aron the revelation he had encountered: It is possible to philosophize about a glass of beer! The revelation of Mythologies was that it was possible to conduct social critique and political analysis concerning President René Coty’s bottle of Daumesnil or a packet of washing powder. Better still, one could do it rigorously, scientifically even, using a method set out in the afterword.

“今日的神话”。巴特借鉴索绪尔的理论，将神话重新定义为“二阶符号学系统”——“在第一个系统（索绪尔式的“概念与意象的联想总体”）中作为符号的东西，在第二个层次中变成了“纯粹的能指”。因此，神话被称为“元语言”，因为它是一种第二语言，人们用它来谈论第一语言。这种形式化的尝试很快招致了语言学家（乔治·穆宁）、新兴符号学（翁贝托·埃科）——以及首先是巴特本人——的尖锐批评，他预言他的神话学家将会遇到“一些困难，即使不是方法上的，至少也是感觉上的”。即使假设神话学的整体体系是符号学的一个“合理”的分支学科，神话学家仍然是一个分裂的人物，用科学探索的外衣（诺亚方舟？）掩盖着其内在的政治倾向。因此，他陷入了更加严重的困境：他只有远离“消费”神话的集体，才能对抗神话。在为神话工作的过程中，他把自己封闭起来。他摧毁了自己无可替代的“集体语言”，并置身于历史的边缘，以历史的名义探究神话的本质。语言的滥用。巴特最终将这种纯粹的否定性主体与圣茹斯特进行了比较，并宣称：“共和国的构成，正是对反对它的事物的彻底摧毁。”

“Myth today.” Drawing on Saussure, Barthes authorizes himself to redefine myth as a “second-order semiological system”—“that which is sign in the first system” (the Saussurean “associative total of a concept and an image”) becomes a “mere signifier” within the second level. Myth is thus said to be a “meta-language, because it is a second language, in which one speaks about the first.” This attempt at formalization soon attracted fairly sharp criticism from linguistics (Georges Mounin), from nascent semiology (Umberto Eco)—and first and foremost from Barthes himself, who predicted his mythologist would encounter “some difficulties, if not of method, at least of feeling.” For even supposing the overall scheme of mythology to be a “justified” subdiscipline of semiology, the mythologist remains a divided figure, covering an inherently political move with the cloak (Noah’s cloak?) of scientific endeavor. He is thus even more seriously torn: He can only combat myths by distancing himself from the collectivity who “consume” them, and from whom, in working for them, he shuts himself off. He destroys the “collective language” for which he has nothing to substitute and remains on the sidelines of history, in whose name he investigates the mythological abuses of language. Barthes ends up comparing this pure agent of negativity to Saint-Just, declaring: “what constitutes the Republic is the total destruction of what opposes it.”

这种奇特的革命性参照将《神话学》置于其真实的视角——一种通过符号学进行的政治澄清。而澄清的正是神话的概念本身，半个多世纪以来，从乔治·索雷尔及其“社会神话理论”，到乔治·巴塔耶和罗杰·卡约瓦，当然还有路易·阿拉贡、安德烈·布勒东、让-理查德·布洛赫、安德烈·马尔罗或阿尔弗雷德·罗森伯格，神话的概念一直被不断挥舞。毋庸置疑，他们对神话的理解不仅仅存在细微的差别，也不仅仅存在意识形态立场的差异。然而，所有这些版本或多或少都源于索雷尔对神话的理解：神话是不可辩驳的（它并非一种真理判断），是人们可以接受或拒绝（赞成或反对）的东西，是充满活力的（它是集体能量的源泉，是一种可以运用的武器）。巴特将神话定义为“一种话语”，可以进行“符号学”分析，从而彻底终结了关于神话在政治上究竟有益还是有害的无休止且（在他看来）毫无意义的争论。早在1939年，萨特就率先谴责知识分子固执地围绕神话打转，“以至于我像这些作者一样，担心如今存在着一种关于神话的神话，它本身就应该成为社会学研究的对象。”

This strange revolutionary reference places Mythologies in its true light—that of a political clarification operated through semiology. And the thing clarified is the very notion of myth as ceaselessly brandished for over half a century, from Georges Sorel and his “theory of social myths” to Georges Bataille and Roger Caillois, without forgetting Louis Aragon, André Breton, Jean-Richard Bloch, André Malraux, or Alfred Rosenberg. There is no need to point out that there are more than just nuances differentiating their conceptions of myth, and more than mere differences between their ideological positions. Nevertheless, all these versions stem to a greater or lesser extent from Sorel’s vision of myth as irrefutable (it is not a truth judgment), as something one may take or leave (approve or disapprove), and as dynamic (it is a source of collective energy, a weapon to be deployed). By defining myth as “an utterance” that may be subject to “semiological” analysis, Barthes puts a definitive end to the interminable and (to his mind) pointless debate about whether myth is politically useful or harmful. Sartre had been the first, back in 1939, to decry intellectuals’ obdurate circling around myth “to such an extent that I fear, to speak like these authors, that there is today a myth of myth, which should itself be the subject of a sociological study.”

早在 1957 年，《神话学》就为图像符号学、政治话语分析和广告信息符号学随后的发展指明了方向；语言分析的首要地位为语言学转向铺平了道路——只不过它的伟大成就并不在于从根本上揭开任何特定的法国小神话的神秘面纱，而在于神话本身，即哲学和政治语言学中最伟大、最被滥用和最无效的词汇之一。

Back in 1957, Mythologies mapped out the path subsequently taken by semiology of the image, of political discourse analysis, and of advertising messages; the primacy accorded to language analysis paves the way for the linguistic turn—only its great achievement does not lie in radically demystifying any given minor French mythology, but myth itself, one of the great, most overused, and inoperative words in the philosophical and political logosphere.

菲利普·罗杰

Philippe Roger

罗兰·巴特，《神话》（巴黎：Éditions du Seuil [“Pierres vives”]，1957）。新闻文章的插图传真版，Éditions du Seuil，2010 年。由 Points（“Essais”）重新出版，2014 年。由 Richard Howard 和 Annette Lavers 翻译成英文《神话》（纽约：Hill 和 Wang，2012 年）。

Roland Barthes, Mythologies (Paris: Éditions du Seuil [“Pierres vives”], 1957). Illustrated facsimile edition of press articles, Éditions du Seuil, 2010. Republished by Points (“Essais”), 2014. Translated into English by Richard Howard and Annette Lavers as Mythologies (New York: Hill and Wang, 2012).

1957

1957

《国王的两个身体:康托洛维奇与政治的神秘性》

The King’s Two Bodies: Kantorowicz and the Mystique of Politics

恩斯特·坎托洛维奇（1895-1963）自1939年起流亡美国，在被任命为普林斯顿高等研究院教员六年后出版了《国王的两个身体》。1949年，在伯克利，他反对参议员约瑟夫·麦卡锡的反共清洗运动，尽管三十年前，作为一名年轻的德国犹太人，他曾参与在慕尼黑对共产党员的迫害。凭借其学术自由捍卫者的声誉，随着本书的出版，坎托洛维奇成为二十世纪最重要的中世纪学者之一。

Ernst Kantorowicz (1895–1963), having lived in exile in the United States since 1939, published The King’s Two Bodies six years after being appointed a faculty member at the Princeton Institute for Advanced Study. At Berkeley, in 1949, he had opposed Senator Joseph McCarthy’s anti-communist purges, despite having participated as a young German Jew in the persecution of the communists in Munich thirty years earlier. Bolstered by his reputation as a champion of academic freedom, with the publication of this book, Kantorowicz became one of the most important medievalists of the twentieth century.

《国王的两个身体》分析了中世纪政治权威的二元论原则——自然的、凡人的、肉体与超自然的、永恒的、神秘的身体之间的对立——后者是一种“人造的非现实性”，人类沦为其中的“奴隶”。这本书虽然姗姗来迟，但产生了巨大的影响（例如，直到1989年才被翻译成法语）。它凝聚了康托洛维奇数十年对中世纪“政治神学”及其与早期现代意识形态关系的研究成果。康托洛维奇对中世纪政治神学的研究始于1927年为皇帝腓特烈二世撰写的传记，之后又陆续发表了几篇深刻的论文，例如一篇探讨“亲祖国”（pro patria mori）这一理念的著名论文（1951年）。

The King’s Two Bodies analyzes the dualist principle underpinning political authority in the Middle Ages—the opposition between a natural, mortal, physical body and a supernatural, eternal, mystical body—a “man-made irreality” of which men had become “slaves.” This book, which went on to exert great though delayed influence (only being translated into French in 1989, for example), was the outcome of several decades of research on medieval “political theologies” and how they related to early modern ideologies. Kantorowicz’s study of medieval political theologies developed over a series of publications, starting in his 1927 biography of Emperor Frederick II and continuing in several penetrating essays, such as a famous one devoted to the formula “pro patria mori” (1951).

定义《国王的两个身体》的核心研究对象并非易事：“观念”、“公式”、“信仰”或“概念”这些术语既过于简化，又过于严谨。康托洛维茨借鉴了学术论文，彩绘手抄本、壁画、法律汇编，以及但丁和莎士比亚的礼拜仪式和诗歌。他的分析范围体现了符号学的雄心壮志，但其研究重点仍停留在知识层面而非人类学层面——这是他研究中世纪王权的方法与马克·布洛赫在《王权的魔力》 （Les rois thaumaturges）一书中的主要区别之一。

It is no easy task to define the object of research at the heart of The King’s Two Bodies: The terms “ideas,” “formulas,” “beliefs,” or “concepts” are both too reductive and too rigorous. Kantorowicz draws on learned treatises, illuminated manuscripts, frescoes, and compilations of law, as well as liturgy and the poetry of Dante and Shakespeare. The scope of his analysis suggests the ambitions of semiotics but remains on an intellectual plane rather than an anthropological one—this is one of the major differences between his approach to medieval royal power and Marc Bloch’s in Les rois thaumaturges (The Royal Touch).

康托洛维奇从伊丽莎白时期的英国法律传统出发，追溯二元论原则应用于国王（或王后，尽管他从未提及伊丽莎白一世是女性）的谱系。君王兼审判者，如同基督，兼具人性和神性，将两种本性融于一身。由此原则衍生出一系列根本的法律区别，从宪法理论的巅峰到最琐碎的财产纠纷，层层递进。世俗权威从宗教话语、礼拜仪式和基督教神学中借用这些意象和隐喻，加以阐释，之后又将它们回馈给教会。如果没有这种交流，没有这种神秘的基督论维度，我们就不可能理解王权观念的发展，以及由此延伸而来的西方政治权力观念。

Kantorowicz starts from the English legal tradition of the Elizabethan period and works back through the genealogy of the dualist principle as applied to the body of the king (or queen, though he never addresses the problem of Elizabeth I being a woman). The King-judge, like the Christ, whose nature is both human and divine, conjoins two natures in a single person. From this principle follows a cascade of fundamental legal distinctions, working their way down from the summit of constitutional theory to the most humdrum property disputes. Secular authorities borrowed these images and metaphors from religious discourse, liturgy, and Christian theology and elaborated them before, in turn, lending them back to the Church. Without this exchange, without this mystical and Christological dimension, it would be impossible to understand the development of the idea of royalty and, by extension with it, the notion of political power in the West.

诚然，这种二元论引发了一系列悖论和一种怪诞的权力生理学，英国著名法律史学家弗雷德里克·W·梅特兰（Frederic W. Maitland）认为其荒谬可笑，但康托洛维奇却恰恰相反，他对此予以认真对待，并指出其在构建超越死亡的非个人化国家和法律理念方面至关重要。康托洛维奇含蓄地摒弃了充满常识的英语国家宪法史传统，揭示了即使在美国公司中也依然存在的宗教内核，这些现代神秘的团体/法人同样渴望超越人类的持久和权力。

Admittedly, this dualism gives rise to a certain number of paradoxes and a bizarre physiology of power that the famous English historian of law, Frederic W. Maitland, found ridiculous but which Kantorowicz, on the contrary, takes seriously, demonstrating its crucial importance in building up an impersonal idea of state and of the law, transcending mortality. Having implicitly rejected the august English-speaking tradition of constitutional history, awash in common sense, Kantorowicz unveiled the religious kernel that persists even in American Incs., those modern-day mystical bodies/corporations that likewise aspire to superhuman duration and power.

康托洛维奇在《国王的两个身体》一书中彻底抛弃了两次世界大战期间他所从事的历史学家身份，当时他创作了另一部伟大而奇特的著作《两个身体的弗里德里希皇帝》。这本书二十年前在柏林出版，没有脚注，甚至在写作过程中，就受到了年轻的康托洛维奇在弗里德里希立法者中遇到的那些耀眼人物的影响，更受到了预言和赞美的影响。围绕皇帝而繁荣的文学。到了1957年，康托洛维奇的写作风格大不相同，他使用了新的语言，用一种更亲切、更直接、充满幽默感的散文取代了他年轻时作品中那种令人回味的诗意力量。腓特烈二世代表了一种日耳曼神话和一种国家权力的理想，这种理想建立在君主与法律的认同之上（皇帝有意识地认同了这种认同，他将自己定义为“地球上的活法律”）。相反，在《国王的两个身体》中，康托洛维奇放弃了传记结构或任何神话建构；他因此放弃了日耳曼主义，转而选择了一种更广阔的西方文明视野。从腓特烈二世开始，他保留了体现在皇帝身上的法律观念，即“lex animata in terris”这一公式，该公式再次出现在《国王的两个身体》中，同时出现的还有其他看似神学的法律公式：Christus-fiscus（基督的钱包）和Dignitas non moritur（职位不死）。

With The King’s Two Bodies, Kantorowicz definitively turned his back on the historian he had been in the interwar period, when he had written his other great, strange book, Kaiser Friedrich der Zweite. Published in Berlin twenty years earlier, without footnotes, this book was influenced, even in its writing, by the dazzling figures the young Kantorowicz encountered among Frederick’s lawmakers and even more by the prophecy and the encomiastic literature that had flourished around the emperor. By 1957, Kantorowicz wrote very differently, now in a new language, replacing the evocative and poetic power of his youthful work with a more amiable, more direct prose, leavened with humor. Frederick II had represented a Germanic myth and an ideal of state power founded on an identification between Prince and Law (an identification consciously assumed by the emperor, who defined himself as the “living law on Earth”). With The King’s Two Bodies, Kantorowicz, on the contrary, renounced the biographical structure or any construction of myth; he thus abandoned Germanism in favor of a broader vision of Western civilization. From Frederick II, he retained the vision of the law embodied in the person of the emperor, the formula lex animata in terris, which reappears in The King’s Two Bodies, alongside other theological-looking legal formulas: Christus-fiscus (Christ’s purse) and Dignitas non moritur (the office does not die).

他曾在诗人斯蒂芬·乔治的反动唯美主义圈子里读书，如今仍留有几分当年的痕迹。他的一些同事认为这些痕迹玷污了他的名声，在他去世后为此斥责他。20世纪20年代乔治县的神话诗学实践与纳粹意识形态之间的联系显而易见，却又错综复杂，因为康托洛维奇和这些几乎视自己为秘密社团的知识分子唯美主义者也培养了对希特勒的蔑视。三十年后，逃离迫害并在集中营失去家人后，康托洛维奇仍然是“旧世界”的一员，或许是精英主义者，但无疑不是纳粹同情者。他的思想遗产远比历史学家珀西·恩斯特·施拉姆或法学家卡尔·施密特的遗产问题更少。康托洛维茨在《国王的两个身体》中，以一个转变的世界为背景，向他的新的英语读者表达了广泛的自由和民主情绪，指出了政治的神秘本质以及想象力对人类现实发挥的巨大力量。

There remain a few traces of the man he had once been as a student in the reactionary and aestheticizing circle of the poet Stefan George. Certain of his colleagues, holding these traces to be a discreditable stain on his reputation, chided him for them after his death. The links between the mythopoetics practiced in the George-Kreis during the 1920s and Nazi ideology are clear to see, yet complicated, for Kantorowicz and these intellectual aesthetes, who viewed themselves virtually as a secret society, also cultivated their disdain for Hitler. Thirty years later, having fled persecution and lost family members in the camps, Kantorowicz remained a man of the “Old World,” elitist perhaps, but doubtless no Nazi sympathizer. His intellectual legacy is far less problematic than that of the historian Percy Ernst Schramm, for example, or of the jurist Carl Schmitt. With The King’s Two Bodies, in a transformed world, and addressing his new English-speaking readers with broadly liberal and democratic sentiments, Kantorowicz pointed out the mystical essence of politics and the great power the imagination exerts over human reality.

塞雷娜·费伦特

Serena Ferente

恩斯特·坎托洛维奇，《国王的两个身体：中世纪政治神学研究》（新泽西州普林斯顿：普林斯顿大学出版社，1957 年）。

Ernst Kantorowicz, The King’s Two Bodies: A Study in Medieval Political Theology (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 1957).

1958

1958

富裕社会:加尔布雷斯与贫困的终结

The Affluent Society: Galbraith and the Heralded End of Poverty

约翰·肯尼斯·加尔布雷斯（1908-2006）的《富裕社会》自出版以来便畅销不衰。尽管这本书描述性很强，在方法论创新方面介绍甚少，但它却是对战后生产主义和消费主义模式的首次概述。加尔布雷斯的文学才华（他毫不掩饰对约翰·斯坦贝克散文的钦佩）和他的条理性发挥了重要作用。此后，每本历史书籍都会以加尔布雷斯著作的标题来概括美国战后乃至整个西方直至20世纪70年代中期的发展。强劲的经济增长及其必然结果——大众消费——最终驱散了1929年大萧条的阴影。在冷战高峰时期，这位加拿大裔哈佛大学经济学教授加尔布雷斯剖析了美国经济模式的优势，并像许多知识分子一样，描述了一个由共同的消费主义价值观紧密联系在一起的中产阶级社会的兴起。

From the moment it was published, The Affluent Society by John Kenneth Galbraith (1908–2006) was a best seller. Although a very descriptive book introducing little in the way of methodological innovation, it was the first overview of the postwar productivist and consumerist model. Galbraith’s literary talent (he did not hide his admiration for the prose of John Steinbeck) and his sense of formulation did the rest. Thereafter, every history book would employ the title of Galbraith’s volume to summarize the postwar years in the United States and, more generally, the West through to the mid-1970s. Strong economic growth and its corollary, mass consumption, definitively chased away the specters of the 1929 Great Depression. Writing at the height of the Cold War, Galbraith, a Harvard professor of economics of Canadian origin, dissected the strengths of the US economic model and, like many intellectuals, described the emergence of a middle-class society bound together by shared consumerist values.

从一开始，这本书的反响就引发了持久的误解。与许多同时代的经济学家不同，加尔布雷斯并没有采取必胜主义的论调。他刻意批判地审视着许多同行经济学家希望向世界各地，尤其是新独立的国家推广的现代化进程。他带着其写作中常见的道德主义论调，重新探讨了他的精神导师之一托尔斯坦·凡勃伦（1857-1929）在本世纪初提出的一个话题。在研究从稀缺文化到富足文化的转变以及有闲阶级的出现时，凡勃伦担忧社会和文化这种“炫耀性消费”的后果。加尔布雷斯将这一问题应用于20世纪50年代，并反过来担忧社会批判如何被大众消费的重压所淹没。他尤其针对那些日益远离关于不平等的批判性话语、转向共识性、枯燥的数学建模的经济学家。

From the outset, the book’s reception generated a lasting misunderstanding. For unlike many of his contemporaries, Galbraith did not adopt a triumphalist tone. He cast a deliberately critical eye over the process of modernization that many of his fellow economists wished to export around the world, particularly to newly independent nations. With the note of moralism that often characterized his writing, he returned to a topic raised at the dawn of the century by one of his spiritual mentors, Thorstein Veblen (1857–1929). In studying the shift from a culture of rarity to one of abundance and the emergence of a leisure class, Veblen worried about the social and cultural consequences of this “conspicuous consumption.” Galbraith applied this line of questioning to the 1950s, worrying in turn about how social critique was buried beneath the weight of mass consumption. He particularly targeted economists who were increasingly turning away from critical discourse about inequality toward consensual, arid mathematical modeling.

这就是本书的出发点，本书是应卡内基公司之邀撰写的。20 世纪 50 年代初，这个慈善基金会想知道二战期间经济的恢复增长是否减少了贫困人口的数量。为了回答这个问题，加尔布雷斯借鉴了旅居美国的俄罗斯经济学家西蒙·库兹涅茨的论点。库兹涅茨在 1955 年乐观地写道，不平等现象即将消失。库兹涅茨以加尔布雷斯所谴责的建模习惯，画出了一条倒 U 形曲线：工业化的第一阶段加剧了不平等现象，在国家干预的第二阶段趋于稳定，然后在最后阶段，不平等现象必然会减少。在研究过程中，加尔布雷斯始终秉持这种乐观态度，尽管他对其示意图的表达方式仍持谨慎态度。得益于自20世纪30年代以来实施的工资、货币和财政政策，美国已进入经济曲线的下行阶段，贫困已成为“残留”，仅限于传统经济领域和残疾人。然而，加尔布雷斯希望美国保持警惕，因为该国“尚未彻底解决”。他深受心理学的影响，担心对穷人的“关注”（该术语的心理学含义）可能会在这个富裕社会中消失——这是他向经济学家和美国公众发出的警告。

This forms the starting point of the book, written at the request of the Carnegie Corporation. In the early 1950s, this philanthropic foundation wanted to know if the return of economic growth during the Second World War had reduced the number of people living in poverty. To answer this, Galbraith drew on the thesis of a Russian economist living in the United States: Simon Kuznets. Inequalities, Kuznets optimistically wrote in 1955, were about to disappear. With the wont for modeling that Galbraith deplored, Kuznets drew an upside-down U-shaped curve: A first phase of industrialization increased inequalities, which were stabilized in a second phase of state interventionism, before a final phase saw them inevitably decline. Over the course of his research, Galbraith embraced this optimism, even if he remained wary of its schematic presentation. Thanks to the wage, monetary, and fiscal policies implemented since the 1930s, the United States had entered the downswing of the curve, and poverty in the country was now “residual,” limited to spheres of the traditional economy and handicapped people. Yet Galbraith wanted the US to remain vigilant for the country’s “slate was not left cleaned.” Being strongly influenced by psychology, he feared that a “preoccupation” (in the psychological meaning of the term) with the poor might disappear amid this affluent society—a warning that he issued to economists and the American public alike.

但自本书出版之日起，这一警告就被美国社会例外论的观点所掩盖。在斯普尼克号卫星发射引发恐慌的一年后，美国民众通过阅读加尔布雷斯犀利笔下所描述的美国模式在经济和社会方面的成功来安抚自己。然而，在知识界和学术界，人们对加尔布雷斯的接受度却较为保守：经济学家们对他运用心理学的运用持怀疑态度，指责他缺乏理论模型，甚至有人毫不留情地称他为“为非经济学家服务的经济学家”。但最重要的是，许多知识分子对他模棱两可的立场表示谴责。加尔布雷斯倾向于生产主义意识形态，但他从未对此提出质疑。另一些人指责他低估了贫困的规模。在当时的另一本畅销书《另一个美国》（1962 年）中，天主教知识分子迈克尔·哈林顿直接抨击了加尔布雷斯的分析，对计算贫困线时使用的统计近似值以及贫困受地域限制的假设表示遗憾。但对加尔布雷斯提出最尖锐批评的却是瑞典知识分子贡纳尔·默达尔。在1963 年出版的《向富裕发起挑战》中，默达尔指出，贫困并非富足社会的残留现象，恰恰相反，它是富裕时代的产物。向后福特主义经济的转变只会增加美国的贫困人口数量，默达尔首次将这些人同化为“下层阶级”，这一术语注定会对贫困研究产生持久影响。从默达尔到托马斯·皮凯蒂，进化论的平等观屡遭批评。富裕社会除了可能忽视社会问题之外，还孕育着许多危险。从环境风险到生产主义假设，再到增长需求，社会科学从未停止对《富裕社会》中所描述的模式的探究。

But from the moment the book was published, this warning was eclipsed by an exceptionalist view of US society. One year after the scare occasioned by Sputnik being put into orbit, the country reassured itself by reading about the economic and social success of its model as depicted by Galbraith’s sharp pen. The reception was more reserved in intellectual and academic spheres: Economists were very skeptical about his use of psychology, reproaching him for the lack of theoretical modeling, going so far as to describe him as an “economist for non-economists,” as one uncharitably noted. But above all, many intellectuals deplored his ambiguous position toward productivist ideology, which he never called into question. Others accused him of underestimating the scale of poverty. In another best seller of the period, The Other America (1962), the Catholic intellectual Michael Harrington directly attacked Galbraith’s analyses, regretting the statistical approximations in calculating the poverty threshold and the postulate that poverty was geographically limited. But it was a Swedish intellectual, Gunnar Myrdal, who put forward the sharpest repudiation of Galbraith. In Challenge to Affluence, published in 1963, Myrdal shows that poverty was not a residual phenomenon in the society of plenty but, on the contrary, a product of the age of affluence. The shift toward a post-Fordist economy would only increase the number of poor people in the United States, who Myrdal assimilated for the first time to an “underclass,” a term destined to have a lasting impact on poverty studies. From Myrdal to Thomas Piketty, the evolutionist vision of equality has repeatedly come in for criticism. The affluent society bore the seed of many dangers other than the possibility of neglecting the social question. From environmental risks to productivist postulates and the requirement for growth, the social sciences have never ceased inquiring into the model described in The Affluent Society.

罗曼·于雷

Romain Huret

约翰·肯尼斯·加尔布雷斯，《富裕社会》（纽约：霍顿·米夫林，1958 年）。

John Kenneth Galbraith, The Affluent Society (New York: Houghton Mifflin, 1958).

1959

1959

日常生活中的自我呈现：戈夫曼将日常生活变成戏剧

The Presentation of Self in Everyday Life: Goffman Turns Daily Life into Theater

《日常生活中的自我呈现》最初由一家苏格兰小型出版社于1956年出版。最初鲜为人知，但1959年在美国再版后，它便成为经典之作。其伟大之处在于将“面对面的互动”作为合法的科学探究对象。本书认为，日常生活和日常接触中交换的手势、言语和眼神，都需要进行具体的社会学研究。

The Presentation of Self in Everyday Life was first published in 1956 by a small Scottish publisher. Initially known only to a few, it became a classic on being republished in 1959 in the United States. Its great originality lies in taking “face-to-face interaction” as an object of legitimate scientific inquiry. The book considers that the gestures, words, and glances exchanged in ordinary life and everyday contact call for specific sociological investigation.

这种直觉在欧文·戈夫曼（1922-1982）1949年至1953年间萌生，当时他正在设得兰群岛准备博士论文。他追随导师的脚步，前往那里研究一个小型半乡村社区，但回国后却带回了一个新的社会学研究对象：“对话互动”。

This intuition came to Erving Goffman (1922–1982) between 1949 and 1953, when preparing his PhD thesis in the Shetland Islands. Following in the footsteps of his supervisor, he had gone there to study a small semirural community but returned with a new object of sociological inquiry: “conversational interaction.”

戈夫曼自称是埃米尔·涂尔干的追随者（而非“符号互动论”的成员，尽管他有时被错误地与该运动联系起来），他设计了这个新对象，并提出了分析它的方法。要从社会学角度分析对话互动（以及更普遍意义上的面对面互动），需要将其视为一个独立于参与个体个体的系统。戈夫曼提出了一种整体视角，而非以个体主义或主体间性的方式看待日常互动，他关注个体之间的日常交流，并非关注其内容，而是关注其形式——即“社会交往的结构——即社会生活中那些在人们直接接触彼此时产生的实体的结构”。

Goffman, a self-identified disciple of Émile Durkheim (and not a member of “symbolic interactionism,” a movement with which he is sometimes wrongly associated), devised this new object, in tandem with the method to analyze it. To sociologically analyze conversational interactions (and face-to-face interactions more generally), they need to be considered as a system independent of the singularity of the individuals taking part. Goffman puts forward a holistic perspective, rather than an individualist or intersubjective way of viewing daily interactions, focusing on ordinary exchanges between individuals not for their content but for their form—that is, for the “structure of social encounters—the structure of those entities in social life that come into being whenever persons enter one another’s immediate physical presence.”

其目的是将构成日常生活的一切细枝末节非自然化。戈夫曼将社会生活比喻为戏剧，并提出了一套从戏剧学角度描述“面对面互动”的概念。这表明我们是舞台上不知疲倦的演员，面对着公众，始终担心自己的表演质量，展示着我们认为合适的“面孔”，并以不同程度的意识和良知，羞涩地掩盖着任何可能与自己的表演相矛盾的东西。我们不能不关注别人的印象，哪怕是轻微的关注；而我们作为观众，则时刻留意其他演员身体存在所释放出的最细微的信息，以便正确地定义情境——对戈夫曼来说，一切都是信号。

The purpose is to denaturalize all the little things making up everyday life. Pushing the metaphor of social life as a theater as far as it will go, Goffman produces a set of concepts for describing “face-to-face interactions” from a dramaturgical perspective. This shows us to be tireless actors placed on stage in front of a public, always worried about the quality of our performance, displaying a “face” we regard as appropriate and, with varying degrees of awareness and conscientiousness, coyly cloaking anything that might contradict our performance. We cannot fail to monitor, however slightly, the impressions others receive, while for our part, as spectators, remaining on the lookout for the slightest information emitted by the sheer bodily presence of other actors to properly define the situation—for Goffman, everything is a signal.

诚然，大多数时候我们都会达成“暂时共识”，从而避免最糟糕的结果：尴尬。因此，我们组建“团队”，这些团队会在整个互动过程中持续存在，并遵循某些共同的规则：“谨慎”（根据情况选择合适的队友）、“高度忠诚”（尊重团队成员的态度）和“纪律”（掌控自身角色的能力）。我们利用空间组织提供的资源，巧妙地利用“前区”（舞台）和“后区”（侧厅）之间的区别。

Admittedly, most of the time we reach a “temporary consensus,” thus warding off the worst possible outcome: embarrassment. We thereby form “teams” that last for the duration of the interaction and follow certain shared rules: “circumspection” (the choice of the right teammates for the situation), “dramatic loyalty” (respecting the attitudes adopted by team members), and “discipline” (the capacity to master one’s role). We draw on the resources offered by spatial organization, playing on the distinction between the “front region” (stage) and “back region” (wings).

但我们常常陷入“矛盾的角色”。于是，我们便会求助于队友来摆脱尴尬的境地。戈夫曼举了一个例子：一位企业经理为了避免客户丢“面子”（这是他著作中的一个核心概念，适用于整个社会体系），迅速结束与客户的会议，“方法是教他们的秘书在合适的时机，用合适的借口打断他们。”

But we are often caught in “contradictory roles.” We then draw on teammates to get us out of awkward situations. Goffman gives the example of how business managers put a rapid end to a meeting with a client to prevent the latter losing “face” (a central concept in his work, applied to the social apparatus as a whole) “by teaching their secretary to come and interrupt them at the right moment on the right pretext.”

戈夫曼虽然对自我呈现很感兴趣，但他似乎更乐于描述它如何适得其反。这样的描述有​​两个作用。第一个作用是方法论上的，与那些看似顺畅的互动秩序形成对比。第二个作用是分析上的：强调不确定性对互动的影响。

While Goffman is interested in self-presentation, he seems to get even more pleasure out of describing how it can backfire. Such descriptions have two functions. The first is methodological, contrasting with what was holding the order of interaction together when it seemed to be flowing smoothly. The second is analytical: emphasizing the uncertainty weighing on interactions.

事实上，所有互动都处于紧张状态：“虽然发生中断的可能性在不同互动之间差异很大，虽然可能发生的中断的社会重要性在不同互动之间差异很大，在每一次互动中，似乎参与者都会冒着明显的尴尬或极度羞辱的风险。”

And indeed, all interactions exist in a state of tension: “While the likelihood of disruption will vary widely from interaction to interaction, and while the social importance of likely disruptions will vary widely from interaction to interaction, still it seems that there is no interaction in which the participants do not take an appreciable chance of being slightly embarrassed or a slight chance of being deeply humiliated.”

戈夫曼的处女作在民族方法学（以哈罗德·加芬克尔为代表）、传播民族志（戴尔·海姆斯）和会话分析（哈维·萨克斯）兴起的时代，对社会学的复兴起到了至关重要的作用。尽管戈夫曼始终与这些思潮保持着一定的距离，但《自我呈现》对社会科学的具体影响在于，它使对个体“自我”的分析不再局限于心理学的范畴，而是提出了一种完全社会学的分析方法：“因此，在分析自我时，我们关注的是它的拥有者，关注的是那个从中获益最多或损失最大的人，因为他和他的身体仅仅提供了一个挂钩，一些合作制造的东西会暂时挂在上面。而生产和维持自我的手段并不存在于这个挂钩之中；事实上，这些手段往往被固定在社会制度中。”

This first book by Goffman played a major role in the renewal of sociology at a time when ethnomethodolgy was emerging (around the figure of Harold Garfinkel), along with the ethnography of communication (Dell Hymes) and conversational analysis (Harvey Sacks), though Goffman always maintained a certain distance from these currents. For the specific effect of The Presentation of Self on the social sciences was that it removed the analysis of individuals’ “self” from the sole domain of psychology, instead proposing a fully sociological treatment: “In analyzing the self, then, we are drawn from its possessor, from the person who will profit or lose most by it, for he and his body merely provide the peg on which something of collaborative manufacture will be hung for a time. And the means for producing and maintaining selves do not reside inside the peg; in fact, these means are often bolted down in social establishments.”

戈夫曼在回应两位符号互动论权威代表对其著作的批评时，更直接地表明了自己与心理学的距离。1在这场争议中，戈夫曼被指责进行“结构主义”分析，未能将个体的独特性考虑在内。这让戈夫曼有机会强调，作为涂尔干和阿尔弗雷德·拉德克利夫-布朗的读者，自其论文发表以来，他主要致力于通过解释社会生活中可观察到的、构成个体位置的“原则性方式”，将“互动”一词从社会心理学的束缚中“拯救出来”，并针对每个个体的故事，取得了不同程度的成功。

Goffman distanced himself from psychology even more directly in the response he gave to criticism of his work by two authorized representatives of symbolic interactionism.1 In this controversy, Goffman was accused of practicing “structuralist” analysis that failed to take individuals’ singularity into account. This provided Goffman with the opportunity to emphasize that as a reader of Durkheim and Alfred Radcliffe-Brown, ever since his thesis he had primarily endeavored to “rescue the term ‘interaction’” from the grasp of social psychology by explaining “principled ways” observable in social life by which place is made, with varying degrees of success, for each of these singular stories.

爱德华·加德拉

Édouard Gardella

欧文·戈夫曼，《日常生活中的自我呈现》（纽约：Anchor Books，1959 年）。

Erving Goffman, The Presentation of Self in Everyday Life (New York: Anchor Books, 1959).

1 请参阅 Erving Goffman，《评论：对 Denzin 和 Keller 的回复》，《当代社会学》第 10 卷，第 1 期（1981 年 1 月）：第 60-68 页。

1 See Erving Goffman, “Review: A Reply to Denzin and Keller,” Contemporary Sociology 10, no. 1 (January 1981): 60–68.

1960

1960

几个世纪的童年：阿里埃斯重拾童年的感觉

Centuries of Childhood: Ariès Rediscovers the Feeling of Childhood

谁能想到，在左翼主导思想和出版物的战后法国，法国历史学界一个庞大分支的复兴，竟然出自一位自诩为“传统右翼”的“真正反动派”的人之手？菲利普·阿里埃斯（1914-1984）虽然身处学术边缘，却热衷于阅读“新史学”思潮中那些历史学家的著作；最终，他被他们接纳，甚至在1978年雅克·勒戈夫、罗杰·沙蒂尔和雅克·雷维尔以该书名出版的著作中贡献了整整一章。同年，他加入了法国社会科学高等研究院（EHESS）的历史研究中心。他撰写的章节主题是“心态史”，正是在这个略显老套的标签下，他至今仍为人所知，并受到人们的赞赏。

Who would have thought that in postwar France, where the left dominated minds and publications, the renewal of a large branch of French historical scholarship would stem from a man who described himself, with sly humor, as a “true reactionary” hailing from the “traditional right”? Though on the margins of academia, Philippe Ariès (1914–1984) was an avid reader of the works of historians coalescing in the “new history” current; he ended up being accepted by them to the point of contributing an entire chapter to the volume published under this title by Jacques Le Goff, Roger Chartier, and Jacques Revel in 1978, the same year he joined the Centre de recherches historiques at the École des hautes études en sciences sociales (EHESS). His chapter was on “the history of mentalities,” and it is under this slightly old-fashioned label that he is still known and appreciated today.

《童年的几个世纪》（L'enfant et la vie familiale sous l'Ancien Régime）是法国家庭研究体系的一部分，家庭被视为人口衰落和复兴的摇篮、与经济生活起伏交织的细胞以及个人和集体行为的熔炉。历史人口学这一新兴学科的快速发展，极大地影响了阿里埃斯研究的方向。但他对早期人口变化给出了非常个人化的解读，力求揭示支配个人行为的无意识结构。他此前已仔细查阅教区登记册，尤其关注生育率及其控制；这项档案研究的成果于1948年问世，由éditions出版社出版。塞尔夫的著作名为《十八世纪以来法国人口及其生活态度史》（Histoire des pops françaises et de leurs attitudes devant la vie depuis le XVIII e siècle）。他清晰地阐述了自己的核心观点：“人口统计学的文化影响”。这部著作引起了法国国家人口研究所（INED）人口统计学家的关注，但并未在学术界流传。

L’enfant et la vie familiale sous l’Ancien Régime (Centuries of Childhood) is part of the body of research in France relating to the family, viewed as the cradle of demographic decline and renewal, a cell reverberating with the ups and downs of economic life, and the crucible of individual and collective behavior. The impulse from a new and rapidly developing discipline, historical demography, considerably influenced the choices guiding Ariès’s inquiry. But he gave a very personal interpretation of the changes affecting populations of earlier times, seeking to bring to light the unconscious structures dictating individual behavior. He had already trawled through parish registers, paying particular attention to fertility and its control; the book resulting from this archival research appeared in 1948, published by éditions Self, under the title Histoire des populations françaises et de leurs attitudes devant la vie depuis le XVIII e siècle (History of French populations and their attitudes toward life since the eighteenth century). He insisted clearly on his main point: the “cultural incidences of demography.” This work attracted the attention of demographers working for the Institut national des études démographiques (INED) but did not circulate among academic circles.

《旧制度下的儿童与家庭生活》直接承接了这部早期著作。阿里耶斯解读了看似最僵化的社会内部的变革，研究了它们面对外部冲击的韧性和适应能力。阿里耶斯出生并成长于保皇党和维希主义的社会环境中，深受“法兰西行动”（一种反犹太、民族主义和社团主义思潮）的思想和天主教传统的价值观的熏陶，他从未放弃对国家及其对私人领域的入侵的怀疑。尽管阿里耶斯事先做好了防范被他所认为的真正社会地下力量扼杀的准备，但他仍然背离了家族传统，转而关注“变革的集体意识”。尽管他是一个传统主义者，也是一名非典型的右翼骑兵，但他既不拒绝也不惧怕技术进步：这可以从他在热带水果贸易中的职业生涯中看出，他引入了自动化和计算机化的文档程序（他的职责范围），同时也体现在他对进步如何打开世界的惊叹中。

L’enfant et la vie familiale sous l’Ancien Régime carries on directly from this earlier work. Ariès deciphers change within the seemingly most immobile societies, studying their resilience to external blows and their capacity to adapt. Born and brought up in a royalist and Vichyist milieu and attached to the ideas of Action française (an anti-Semitic, nationalist, and corporatist current) and the values of the Catholic tradition, Ariès never relinquished his distrust of the state and its incursions into the private sphere. Forearmed against the smothering of what he saw as the true underground forces of society, he nevertheless departed from the family legacy in the attention he paid to “collective consciousness of change.” Though a traditionalist and an atypical member of the right-wing cavalry, he neither refused nor feared technological progress: This may be seen in his career in the tropical fruit trade, in which he introduced automatized then computerized procedures for documentation (his area of responsibility), while it also transpired in his wonder at the how progress opened up the world.

他在家族史这片沉寂的死水中插上的那面旗帜，或许是保皇派老卫士的旗帜，但在他手中，它却焕发出新的生机。《孩子与家庭生活》的初版引起了历史学家的兴趣，但并未引起更广泛的反响。该书的英文译本（1962年）将他的思想介绍给了更广泛的美国读者，其中包括社会学家和心理学家。但直到1973年瑟伊再版，他的著作才在法国历史学界以外的圈子里引起关注。

The banner he planted in the sleepy backwater of family history was perhaps that of the royalist old guard, but in his hands, it fluttered in a new breeze. The first edition of L’enfant et la vie familiale attracted the interest of historians, but without resounding more widely. Its translation into English (1962) introduced his ideas to a larger American readership, including sociologists and psychologists. But it was not until the 1973 republication by Seuil that he reached circles outside the historical profession in France.

他论证的两条主线与儿童受教育的环境有关。在传统社会中，教育的基础是模仿成人的行为。这种学习方式意味着幼儿很快就会融入成人世界，从而被社会化。诚然，自中世纪晚期以来，家庭就将婴儿期视为一个特定的年龄，但指称后续阶段的术语缺乏精确性。儿童发展清楚地表明，我们无法将童年描绘成一个特定的年龄。因此，第二条探究线索与儿童在家庭中的封闭性有关。面对这种侵入性状态，家庭自我封闭，并由此必然导致自17世纪起发展起来的教育机构。本书的很大一部分（占了一半）致力于“学校生活”，在这种生活中，学生被置于成人世界之外。这在各个年龄段之间形成了明确的界限，促使成年人以新的方式看待儿童，并重新将家庭情感置于儿童之上。阿里埃斯认为，这种现象从18世纪到20世纪得到了强化。

The two main lines of his demonstration relate to the circumstances in which children were educated. In traditional societies, education was based on imitating what adults did. This learning meant young children were very quickly plunged into the adult world and thus became socialized. Admittedly, since the late Middle Ages, families represented infancy as a particular age, but the lack of precision in the terms referring to subsequent phases in child development clearly indicate the inability to represent childhood as a specific age. The second line of inquiry thus relates to the enclosing of children within the family, which, faced with an invasive state, closed in on itself and, as a corollary, developed educational institutions as of the seventeenth century. A substantial part of the book (one-half) is devoted to “school life,” in which pupils were placed outside the adult world. This generated a firm demarcation between ages, causing adults to view children in a new way and re-center family affections around them, a phenomenon that, Ariès argues, was reinforced from the eighteenth through to the twentieth century.

阿列耶斯的独创性还在于他所采用的资料来源，他不仅借鉴了人口统计学观察，还参考了文学文本、私人领域的档案，尤其是他热衷于研究的图像。然而，批评家们指责他“印象派”，而这正是他的致命弱点。中世纪学者嘲笑他对中世纪时期的扁平化理解，认为童年时期的情感阶段远比他想象的要丰富多彩得多——但他们的嘲笑毫无意义，因为他欣然承认了这一指责。人口史学家反对他关于核心家庭兴起的过于线性的视角，并修改了他的年表。他的分析仅仅关注法国，也受到了质疑。然而，他的后人对他的模棱两可之处保持警惕，并迅速提出相关的警告，因此卓有成效。成果太多了吗？ “但愿（家庭史）不会像（人口史）那样受到通货膨胀的影响，”他在 1973 年带着一丝虚荣说道。

Ariès’s originality also lies in the sources he employs, drawing not only on demographic observations but also on literary texts, archives pertaining to the private realm, and especially images, which he studies with passion. This was his Achilles’ heel for critics who accused him of “impressionism.” Medievalists mocked his flattened vision of the medieval period that neglected the stages in the feeling of childhood, which was far richer and more varied than he thought—but their derision was to no avail because he cheerfully admitted this accusation. Demographic historians objected to the overly linear vision of the emergence of the nuclear family and revised his chronology. And the exclusively French focus of his analyses was also questioned. Nevertheless, his posterity, alert to his ambiguities and quick to make the relevant caveats, has been fruitful. Too fruitful? “God grant that [the history of the family] is not subject to the same inflation as [demographic history],” he breathed with a touch of vanity in 1973.

克里斯蒂安·克拉皮施-祖贝尔

Christiane Klapisch-Zuber

Philippe Ariès，《L'enfant et la vie familiale sous l'Ancien Régime》（巴黎：Plon，1960）。由 Éditions du Seuil（“L'Univers historique”）再版，1973 年。由 Points（“Histoire”）再版，2014 年。由 Robert Baldick 翻译成英文，名为《童年的世纪：家庭生活的社会史》（纽约：Alfred A. Knopf，1962）。

Philippe Ariès, L’enfant et la vie familiale sous l’Ancien Régime (Paris: Plon, 1960). Republished by Éditions du Seuil (“L’Univers historique”), 1973. Republished by Points (“Histoire”), 2014. Translated into English by Robert Baldick as Centuries of Childhood: A Social History of Family Life (New York: Alfred A. Knopf, 1962).

1961

1961

《疯癫史》 :福柯重新赋予疯癫以破坏性的力量

History of Madness: Foucault Reendows Madness with Its Destabilizing Power

1961 年，普隆出版了《疯癫与疯狂：经典疯癫史》 （Folie et déraison: Histoire de la folie à l'âge Classique），该书收录在菲利普·阿里埃斯（家庭和“精神”史学家）主编的文集中。作者是时年 35 岁的米歇尔·福柯（1926-1984），他曾在精英名校巴黎高等师范学院学习哲学，并拥有精神病理学学位。这本书的出版本身注定不会有什么大事，因为这本书取材于一篇哲学博士论文，而哲学是一种以高度规范化和缺乏惊喜而闻名的学术格式。然而，这本书（1972 年由伽利玛出版社再次出版）却代表了一场真正的文化变革。它是一个很大程度上无法辨认的文学作品。它包括艰深的推测性概念段落（关于相同与他者的关系，以及理性与疯狂的辩证法），细致的学术部分（关于医学分类，不同的拘留实践，治疗武器库等），以及对拉辛和狄德罗的抒情飞行，整体以华丽的巴洛克风格进行，由叙事动力联系在一起。

In 1961, Plon published Folie et déraison: Histoire de la folie à l’âge Classique (History of Madness) in a collection edited by Philippe Ariès (the historian of the family and of “mentalities”). Its author was thirty-five-year-old Michel Foucault (1926–1984), who had studied philosophy at the elite École Normale Supérieure and also held a diploma in psychopathology. In itself, this publication promised to be a nonevent, since the book was taken from a doctoral thesis in philosophy, an academic format renowned for being highly codified and short on surprises. Yet this book (which was published again in 1972 by Gallimard) amounted to a genuine cultural shift. It was a largely unidentifiable literary object. It includes arduous speculative conceptual passages (on the relationship between the Same and the Other, and the dialectic of Reason and Madness), meticulous highly learned sections (on medical classifications, diverse internment practices, therapeutic arsenals, etc.), together with lyrical flights on Racine and Diderot, the whole conducted in a flamboyant and baroque style bound together by narrative impetus.

《疯癫史》是一部形而上学的戏剧，也是一则政治寓言。形而上学的戏剧讲述了教条的、至高无上的理性如何将疯癫排除在外；政治寓言则讲述了傲慢的医学如何缓慢地剥夺了疯癫在社会和文化上造成不稳定的力量。这场演示分为三个主要阶段。第一阶段取材于16世纪，是将疯子送上船。这既是一种社会实践，也是一个文学主题（“疯子之船”）。精神病患者被市政当局交给船主，然后船主从……起航。城镇之间。诗人们则以诗意的笔触描绘这些充满愚昧之人的容器。对福柯而言，这幅图像展现了文艺复兴时期对那些能够传递来自冥界信息的疯狂之声的宽容与关注。蒙田的怀疑智慧甚至使人能够理解，疯狂或许也是理性的边缘，是呼吸与幻想的场所。

Histoire de la folie is a metaphysical drama and a political fable. The metaphysical drama is that of the exclusion of Madness by dogmatic and sovereign Reason; the political fable is the tale of how arrogant medicine slowly confiscated madness’s powers of social and cultural destabilization. The demonstration is conducted in three main stages. The first, taken from the sixteenth century, is the sending of fools aboard boats. This was both a social practice and a literary theme (the “ship of fools”). The insane were handed over by municipal authorities to boat owners, who then sailed from town to town. For their part, poets penned poetic descriptions of these vessels filled with the witless. For Foucault, this image demonstrates how tolerant and how attentive even the Renaissance was toward voices of madness, capable of carrying messages from netherworlds. The skeptical wisdom of Montaigne even makes it possible to understand that madness is perhaps also a margin of reason, a place of respiration and fantasy.

本书以戏剧性的方式深入古典时代，其戏剧性是由历史决定的。“一个日期可以作为里程碑：1656年，巴黎颁布法令，成立了综合医院。” 疯癫不再是一种诗意的遐想，也不再是一个关于现实与理性相对性的哲学思考的契机。“医院”一词不应误导我们；我们指的是监禁和隔离的场所。起初，医院并无医疗用途。任何扰乱巴黎街头的事物——贫困、罪恶、疯癫——都被关进了比塞特尔和拉萨尔佩特里埃的医院。疯癫最初是一种疾病，一种公共骚乱。对合理与不合理之事的区分，恰好与礼貌与不当、保守与越轨之事的区分相吻合。

The theatricality with which the book ventures into the classical age is historically determined. “A date can serve as a landmark: 1656, the decree that founded, in Paris, the Hospital General.” Madness is no longer a poetic reverie, an occasion for philosophical musings on the relativity of reality and the reasonable. For the word “hospital” should not mislead us; we are dealing with places of confinement and sequestration. At first there was no medical purpose. Anything disrupting the streets of Paris—poverty, vice, madness—was locked up in the hospitals of Bicêtre and La Salpêtrière. Madness emerged primarily as an illness, as a public disturbance. The division into what makes sense and what is unreasonable coincided with that between good manners and impropriety, between conservatism and the transgressive.

最后一幕的开场，虽然是反过来的，却呼应了经典的排斥行为：菲利普·皮内尔，一位精神病院医生，曾是革命者，于1793年将疯子从锁链中解放出来，恢复了他们的人性——因为在旧制度下，疯子可以像野兽一样被束缚。正是在这一刻，疯癫从其与犯罪和恶习的罪恶亲缘关系中解脱出来，回归了其自身的真相：它变成了一种精神疾病，一种病态的决定论。

The scene that opens the final act echoes, though in reverse, the classical act of exclusion: Philippe Pinel, an asylum doctor and former revolutionary, released the mad from their chains in 1793, restoring them to their humanity—for under the ancien régime, the mad could be enchained like beasts. This is the moment when madness was delivered from its guilty kinship with crime and vice and restored to its own truth: it became a mental illness, a pathological determinism.

因此，福柯通过这三个重要的连续序列构建了他的故事：在文艺复兴时期，人们通过诗意的想象来理解疯癫，将其视为不稳定的界限；在古典时代，人们从警察的视角来理解疯癫，将其视为社会和政治问题；在我们现代，人们通过将其置于科学定义之中的诊断来理解疯癫。诚然，福柯意识到，至少自古希腊医学以来，疯癫就引起了人们的关注，尤其是医学治疗。人类显然并没有等到皮内尔和十九世纪的精神病院才将疯癫视为一种疾病。然而，他的想法是对精神病理性进行“考古学”，这构成了“正常”个体与“疯子”之间界限的基础。医学诊断之前，警方的歧视无处不在。尽管哲学传统上捍卫理性的论题，认为理性具有整合性、和解性和分类性，但福柯的故事却将理性的另一面描绘成排斥、谴责和歧视。我们引以为豪的这种优秀的古典理性，或许也隐藏着某种暴力的因素。精神病学声称通过使疯子成为其病态的“受害者”，从而“拯救”了他们。但这种医学化是有代价的：在被完全客观化后，疯癫失去了其令人担忧的力量。然而，如果萨德、荷尔德林和阿尔托的“谵妄”比医学论文将它们贬低为一种无关紧要的症状，更能告诉我们欲望和世界的现实，那又会怎样呢？

Foucault thus builds up his tale through these three great succeeding sequences: In the Renaissance, madness was apprehended through a poetic imaginary that saw it as destabilizing boundaries; in the classical age, it was apprehended from a police perspective, which held it to be a social and political problem; in our modern era, it is apprehended by a diagnosis enclosing it within scientific definition. Admittedly, Foucault was aware that at least since the medicine of the ancient Greeks, madness had given rise to solicitude and specifically medical treatment. Humanity clearly did not await Pinel and the nineteenth-century asylum to consider madness as an illness. Yet the idea is to conduct an “archaeology” of psychiatric reason, which underpins the division into “normal” individuals and the “mad.” Medical diagnosis was preceded by police discrimination. While philosophy traditionally defends the thesis of reason as integrating, conciliatory, and classificatory, Foucault’s tale portrays the other face of rationality as that which excludes, condemns, and discriminates. This fine classical reason of which we are so proud perhaps carries within it an element of hidden violence. Psychiatry claims to have “saved” madmen, by making them “victims” of their pathology. But this medicalization comes at a cost: In being entirely objectivized, madness loses its powers to worry. Yet what if the “delirium” of de Sade, of Friedrich Hölderlin, of Antonin Artaud told us more about the reality of desire and the world than medical dissertations reducing them to the insignificance of a symptom?

本书出版于1961年，十年后，所谓的反精神病学思潮（例如，罗纳德·莱恩和大卫·库珀，其英国化版本）批判了精神疾病的“神话”。反精神病学家们声称，社会将人逼疯，家庭规范将最脆弱的人推向精神错乱，要么是因为他们代替他人发疯，要么是因为他们发现谵妄提供了摆脱“理性”桎梏的途径。福柯的论点预见了这些激进的探究。它以坚定的尼采式启迪，使得人们能够探究理性知识与道德暴力之间隐秘的联系——而哲学却坚决拒绝正视这种联系。如果说，从根本上说，疯狂是一种崩溃，一种“作品的缺失”，那或许是因为真相令人眩晕，难以承受。

Ten years after this 1961 book, the so-called anti-psychiatric current (for example, Ronald Laing and David Cooper, in its English strain) denounced the “myth” of mental illness. It is society that drives people mad, the anti-psychiatrists said, it is family norms that condemn the most fragile to insanity, either because they become mad in the stead of others or because they find delirium offers an escape from the fetters of the “reasonable.” Foucault’s thesis anticipated these radical inquiries. With its resolutely Nietzschean inspiration, it made it possible to raise the question of the secret, hidden link—which philosophy adamantly refuses to envisage—between rational knowledge and moralizing violence. And if, at root, madness is a point of collapse, an “absence of an œuvre,” it is perhaps because the truth is vertiginous and unbearable.

弗雷德里克·格罗斯

Frédéric Gros

米歇尔·福柯，《Folie et déraison：Histoire de la folie à l'âge classique》（巴黎：Plon，1961）。由伽利玛（“Tel”）再版，1972 年。由乔纳森·墨菲和吉恩·哈法翻译成英文，名为《疯狂史》（伦敦和纽约：劳特利奇，2009 年）。

Michel Foucault, Folie et déraison: Histoire de la folie à l’âge classique (Paris: Plon, 1961). Republished by Gallimard (“Tel”), 1972. Translated into English by Jonathan Murphy and Jean Khalfa as History of Madness (London and New York: Routledge, 2009).

1962

1962

如何用语言做事:奥斯汀和语言作为行动

How to Do Things with Words: Austin and Language as Action

《如何用言语做事》于 1962 年在约翰·L·奥斯汀 (1911-1960) 逝世后出版，书中根据奥斯汀自己的笔记重现了 1955 年在哈佛大学的 12 场讲座。书名概括了这一论点：说话与其说是描述世界，不如说是作用于世界。当我说我将这艘船命名为伊丽莎白女王号时，我不是在赋予自己命名的权力，而是在为这艘船命名；当我说我保证会来时，是我保证会来；当我说会议现在开始时，是我宣布开会。在他的第一次讲座中，奥斯汀将这些陈述称为述行语，相对于陈述语，后者根据传统的语言观点描述世界。在另外十一场讲座中，奥斯汀试图定义和描述述行句，最终导致他对述行句的存在本身提出质疑，并“用两种我承认倾向于扮演老哈里的迷信来扮演老哈里”——即“(1)真/假迷信，和(2)价值/事实迷信”。

Published in 1962 after the death of John L. Austin (1911–1960), How to Do Things with Words reproduces twelve lectures that he gave in Harvard in 1955, based on Austin’s own notes. The title encapsulates the thesis: Speaking is not so much a matter of representing the world as acting on it. In saying I name this ship the Queen Elizabeth, I am not attributing to myself the property of naming but am naming the ship; in saying I promise to come, I promise to do so; and in saying the meeting is now open, I open it. In his first lecture, Austin labeled such statements performatives, as opposed to constatives, which, in accordance with the traditional view of language, describe the world. In the other eleven lectures, Austin sought to define and characterize performatives, finally leading him to question the very existence of constatives and “to play Old Harry with two fetishes which I admit to an inclination to play Old Harry with”—namely, “(1) the true/false fetish and (2) the value/fact fetish.”

因此，传统仅仅指出，语法上现在时态的陈述“我保证来”与承诺同时发生，而奥斯汀则认为，承诺是“在说”我保证来时发生的。“我保证来” 、“我将这艘船命名为伊丽莎白女王号”和“会议现在开始”这些陈述具有构成承诺、命名和开场白的语言价值，即使这些开场白、命名和承诺当然像所有行动一样可能会失败。语言正是通过借鉴惯例（奥斯汀所说的“幸福条件”）才使得行动成为可能，如果不遵循这些惯例，行动就不会发生。我可能我一直喊着“会议现在开始”，直到我脸色发青，但议会不会就此正式开会。正如奥斯汀所说，语言并非神奇。运用语言不足以采取行动，但运用语言却意味着寻求行动。

So, whereas the tradition merely noted that the statement in the grammatical present I promise to come occurred at the same moment as the promise, Austin argues that it is “in saying” I promise to come that the promise occurs. The statements I promise to come, I name this ship the Queen Elizabeth, and the meeting is now open have the linguistic value of constituting promises, namings, and openings, even if, of course, like all actions, these openings, namings, and promises may fail. It is by drawing on conventions (Austin speaks of “felicity conditions”) that language makes it possible to act, and if these conventions are not followed, the action does not take place. I may shout the session is now open until I am blue in the face, but parliament will not thereby start sitting. Language, as Austin describes it, is not magical. Using it does not suffice to act, but using it involves seeking to act.

修辞学早已研究过人们如何通过话语来感动、说服或安慰他人，因此修辞学同样将语言与行动联系起来。但奥斯汀所构想的这种联系比修辞学所认识到的联系更为紧密。为了阐明这种联系，他建议区分三种言语行为：“言外之意”行为，即从词汇中选择语音，然后根据语法生成和组织这些语音；“言外之意”行为，即在言语中以约定俗成的方式完成；以及“言后之意”行为，即通过言语这一行为本身而实现，是言语对他人或自身产生的效果。修辞学关注的是言后之意行为；奥斯汀发现了言外之意行为。即使是说出“猫在垫子上”这句话的人，也在进行言外之意行为——这种行为促使他断言垫子在猫的下面，并且如果没有垫子，这种行为就会失败。言语始终包含着行动，无论是否成功。

Rhetoric had already studied the ways in which, by the means of discourse, one may move, persuade, or console, and so rhetoric likewise tied language to action. But the connection that Austin conceives of is stronger than that recognized by rhetoric. To formulate it, he proposes distinguishing between three types of speech act: “locutionary” acts, which consist in choosing sounds from a vocabulary, then producing and organizing them in accordance with a grammar; “illocutionary” acts, which are accomplished conventionally in saying; and “perlocutionary” acts, which are carried out by the fact of saying and are the effects produced by saying on someone else or on myself. Rhetoric was interested in perlocutionary acts; Austin discovered illocutionary acts. Even the speaker of the statement the cat is on the mat is performing an illocutionary act—an act that engages him to assert that the mat is under the cat and that will fail if there is no mat. Speaking always consists in acting, with or without success.

奥斯汀英年早逝，留下的仅存文章随后出版于三本文集：《哲学论文》（1961）、《感觉与感性》（1962）和《如何用言语做事》（1962）。第三本文集引发了大量研究，也是最著名的一本。它深刻地影响了所有研究语言及其作用的人——无论是语言学家、社会学家还是哲学家——无论是在社会中还是在科学实践中。争论的主要问题在于言外之意行为与言后行为的界限。因为按照语言规则使用词语的说并不涵盖言语的所有事实后果，无论它们多么普遍。但是，真的可以将言语的后果与言语本身区分开来吗？如果命令不能被服从，那它还有什么意义？我能祝贺一个不明白我在祝贺他的人吗？

Austin died young and left only articles that were subsequently published in three collections: Philosophical Papers (1961), Sense and Sensibilia (1962), and How to Do Things with Words (1962). The third collection gave rise to much research and is the most famous. It has profoundly influenced all those—be they linguists, sociologists, or philosophers—who are interested in language and its role, either within society in general or in scientific practice in particular. The main question of debate concerns the boundary separating illocutionary from perlocutionary acts. For saying, using words in accordance with language rules, does not encompass all factual consequences of utterance, however commonplace they may be. But is it really possible to isolate the consequences of an utterance from the utterance itself? What is an order if it may not be obeyed? Can I congratulate someone who does not understand I am congratulating him?

言外之意行为理论一直是人们讨论的话题，尤其是在当代人类学家和历史学家对写作的研究中。当话语像墙上的涂鸦一样被书写，没有任何签名时，谁在行动？“行动”的含义是否与特定行为的含义相同？个人说“我保证会来”是“行为”，君主在信件上盖章是“充当”君主？然而，在语言学中，奥斯汀非常具有创新性的理论被约翰·塞尔的理论所淡化。这将话语的含义与代表世界的命题和言外之意价值联系起来，主要表明说话者是否在保证命题与世界的一致性（如陈述中的情况），或者相反，说话者是否在要求世界以符合命题的方式改变（如命令中的情况）。由于言外之意现象被孤立、限制和界定，奥斯汀的理论很容易被接受。正如传统认为可以把祈使句和疑问句的研究放在一边，而只专注于研究陈述句一样，许多语言学家不合逻辑且自相矛盾地只关注所表达的命题，而将其言外之意价值问题置之不理。当代语言学和语言哲学的大部分研究开始重新关注命题的构成及其真值条件：语境在完成命题的过程中起着什么作用？语法时态如何进行定性？命题指的是现实世界，还是仅仅指一个可能世界？“真/假迷信”正在卷土重来。

The theory of illocutionary acts continues to be a topic of discussion, particularly with contemporary research into writing by anthropologists and historians. Who is acting when the utterance is written as a graffiti on a wall, without any signature? Is it in the same meaning of “acting” that a particular individual “acts” by saying I promise to come, and that a monarch “acts” as monarch in signing a letter with his seal? In linguistics, however, Austin’s very innovative theory was watered down by John Searle’s formulation of it. This associates within the meaning of an utterance a proposition, representing the world, and an illocutionary value, indicating primarily whether the speaker is guaranteeing the conformity of the proposition to the world (as is the case in statements), or if, on the contrary, the speaker is asking that the world change in such a way as to conform to the proposition (as is the case in orders). The illocutionary phenomenon being thus isolated, limited, and circumscribed, Austin’s theory was readily accepted. Just as the tradition held that it could leave the study of imperatives and questions to one side and focus solely on studying statements, so many linguists, illogically and paradoxically, have solely paid attention to the proposition expressed, leaving to one side the question of its illocutionary value. Much of contemporary linguistics, together with the philosophy of language, has started paying renewed attention to the constitution of a proposition and its truth conditions: What role does the context play in completing it? What dating is carried out by grammatical tenses? Is it referring to the real world or only to a possible world? The “true/false fetish” is fighting back.

马里恩·卡雷尔

Marion Carel

约翰·L·奥斯汀，《如何用语言做事：威廉·詹姆斯 1955 年在哈佛大学的演讲》（牛津：克拉伦登出版社，1962 年）。

John L. Austin, How to Do Things with Words: The William James Lectures Delivered at Harvard University in 1955 (Oxford: Clarendon Press, 1962).

1962

1962

公共领域的结构转型：哈贝马斯与“公共性”的衰落

The Structural Transformation of the Public Sphere: Habermas and the Decadence of“Publicness”

正如所有伟大的著作一样，《公共领域的结构转型》 （Strukturwandel der Öffentlichkeit ）有时也成为自身成功的牺牲品。将Öffentlichkeit译为“public sphere” ，将“公共性”作为理论原则和话语实践领域，不应误导我们将其视为一个效仿公共广场、向所有人开放的公共空间（本书的法语书名是“L'espace public”）。本书回顾了从十七世纪末到二十世纪公共领域的变迁。在旧制度下，个人与其地位密不可分，政治沟通垂直运作，在盛大的君主仪式中展示权力。这就是尤尔根·哈贝马斯（生于 1929 年）所说的“由代表结构化的公共领域”，这是专制主义和秩序型社会的特征。他将其与“资产阶级公共领域”相对照，并详细描述了后者在18世纪的出现和发展，以及法国大革命后的政治化。受经济交流发展推动的资产阶级公共领域，以批判性讨论和论证为基础，这要归功于私人与公共交汇处新社交形式的出现（共济会会所、咖啡馆、俱乐部和沙龙），以及报纸的阅读。它受到一种理想驱动，即私人之间的自由讨论，这种理想使“公共运用推理”能够对抗权力，即使其接受批判。最后，自19世纪起，出版资本主义、文化工业和政治传播。大众文化时代公共领域的扩张，却矛盾地摧毁了赋予其批判力量的公共原则。因此，哈贝马斯谴责公共领域的“再封建化”：理性、横向和批判性讨论的理念，从此被利益集团和试图控制舆论的技术所颠覆。公共性让位于广告、营销和舆论制造。

Like all great books, Strukturwandel der Öffentlichkeit (The Structural Transformation of the Public Sphere) has at times been a victim of its own success. The choice of “public sphere” for the English translation of Öffentlichkeit, “publicness” as theoretical principle and realm of discursive practice, should not mislead us into viewing this as designating a public space (in French, the title of the book is “L’espace public”) open to all, on the model of the public square. The book goes over changes to the public sphere from the late seventeenth century through to the twentieth century. Under the ancien régime, individuals were indissociable from their status, with political communication operating vertically to stage power in great monarchic rituals. This is what Jürgen Habermas (born 1929) calls the “public sphere structured by representation,” a characteristic of absolutism and an order-based society. He opposes this to the “bourgeois public sphere,” whose appearance and development during the eighteenth century and politicization in the wake of the French Revolution he describes at length. This bourgeois public sphere, favored by the development of economic exchange, was based on critical discussion and argument, thanks to the emergence of new forms of sociability at the intersection between the private and the public (masonic lodges, coffeehouses, clubs, and salons), together with the reading of newspapers. It was fueled by an ideal of free discussion between private individuals making “public use of reasoning” and thus capable of opposing power—that is, subjecting it to criticism. Finally, as of the nineteenth century, this public sphere was denatured by publishing capitalism, the culture industry, and political communication. The expansion of the public sphere in the days of mass culture paradoxically ruined the principle of the public that had endowed it with its critical strength. Hence, Habermas denounces the “refeudalization” of the public sphere: The idea of rational, horizontal, and critical discussion has been henceforth subverted by vertical communication by interest groups and by technologies seeking to control opinion. Publicness has given way to advertising, marketing, and the manufacture of opinion.

尽管——或者正因为——这种“兴衰”的叙事，这本书深刻地影响了社会科学的诸多领域，重新引发了关于自由民主国家中公众舆论的性质和作用的辩论。这本书对十八世纪的历史学家的影响尤为强烈。在20世纪90年代，在文化史（书籍史、社会史和政治文化史）的主张下，他们将“公共领域”作为解读启蒙运动的主导范式。在最初的热情驱使下，历史学家们质疑哈贝马斯的线性叙述，提出了其他公众（女性、人民），并根据过时的文献目录对他的许多解读进行了细致的修改。但这些修改并未影响这本书的核心，它的学术研究既不是传统意义上的历史学，也不是社会学，而是彻底的哲学。哈贝马斯试图重构启蒙公共领域的理想类型，以提取能够指导当代政治批判的规范性原则。在这方面，本书忠实于哈贝马斯在法兰克福的导师们的传统，他们试图建立意识形态批判理论的规范性原则。但与阿多诺和霍克海默不同，哈贝马斯并不谴责启蒙运动及其否定的辩证法。相反，他着手理解公共性，摆脱其对公众舆论和品味的束缚，将其作为振兴民主和批判的源泉。资产阶级公共领域被认为是康德启蒙运动的鼓励，可以为公民社会提供一种民主模式，并治疗大众民主的病态。

Despite—or because of—this narrative in terms of “rise and fall,” the book has profoundly influenced many sectors in the social sciences, relaunching debates about the nature and role of public opinion in liberal democracies. The book’s impact was particularly strong among historians of the eighteenth century, who, during the 1990s, in the context of the assertion of cultural history (the history of the book, of sociability, and of political cultures), took the “public sphere” as the dominant paradigm for interpreting the Enlightenment. Following this initial enthusiasm, historians questioned Habermas’s linear accounts, put forward other publics (women, peoples), and nuanced many of his interpretations grounded in an outdated bibliography. But these revisions do not affect the heart of the book, whose intellectual project is neither historical nor sociological, in the classical sense of the term, but thoroughgoingly philosophical. Habermas seeks to reconstitute the ideal-type of the Enlightenment public sphere in order to extract the normative principle capable of guiding contemporary political critique. In this respect, the book remains faithful to the tradition of Habermas’s masters at Frankfurt, who sought to establish the normative principles of a critical theory of ideologies. But unlike Adorno and Horkheimer, Habermas does not denounce the Enlightenment and its negative dialectic. On the contrary, he set out to apprehend publicness, shorn of its ensnarement in public opinion and taste, as a source capable of revitalizing democracy and critique. The bourgeois public sphere, conceived as the encouragement of the Kantian project of the Aufklärung, may provide a democratic model for civil society and remedy the pathologies of mass democracies.

今天重读他的书，人们会被书中对代议制民主的批判的雄心所震撼，它借鉴了马克思主义批判的某些元素，同时又兼顾了民主原则的解放性。继承自启蒙运动和自由主义思想的理性讨论。从某些方面来看，毫无疑问，正是这种雄心壮志赋予了本书在当今自由民主国家根基日益不稳、受到新自由主义、媒体转型以及威权宗教传统主义意外回归的威胁的时代背景下的现实意义。

Rereading his book today, one is struck by the ambition of its critique of representative democracy, drawing on certain elements from Marxist criticisms, while accommodating the liberating fertility of the principle of rational discussion inherited from the Enlightenment and liberal thought. In some respects, it is no doubt this ambition that endows the book with its topicality at a time when liberal democracies seem increasingly less steady on their foundations, threatened by neoliberalism, the transformation of the media, and the unexpected return of authoritarian religious traditionalism.

因此，在当代读者眼中，书籍的局限性与其说在于其对历史的简化，不如说在于其逻各斯中心主义和过度的理性主义，仿佛民主社会的建构过程以及公共领域的批判性美德仅仅依赖于理性论证。我们越来越意识到，无论是在十八世纪还是在我们这个时代，公共空间都深受图像的塑造，受激情的滋养，受好奇心的刺激，并受媒体关注范围的左右。公共性内在的美学和情感运作机制或许会促进“公共领域的再封建化”，又或许会滋养对权力的批判和集体解放。因此，可以说，在新媒体和数字革命的时代，我们迫切需要做的是思考启蒙运动的文化和政治遗产如何引导我们正视公共性在其不同维度上的内在矛盾，无论是理性的、美学的还是情感的。

Hence the limits of the book in the eyes of a contemporary reader reside less in its historical simplifications than in its logocentrism and excessive rationalism, as if the processes by which society is instituted as a democracy and the critical virtues of the public sphere hang solely on the thread of rational argumentation. We are ever more aware that public space, both in the eighteenth century and in our days, is profoundly shaped by images, fed by passions, stimulated by curiosity, and rhythmed by media attention spans. These aesthetic and emotional inner workings of publicness may favor the “refeudalization of the public sphere” or else feed the critique of power and collective emancipation. And so arguably, what we urgently need to do today, in the age of new media and the digital revolution, is to think of how the cultural and political legacy of the Enlightenment invites us to face up to the inherent contradictions of publicness in its different dimensions, be these rational, aesthetic, or emotional.

安托万·利尔蒂

Antoine Lilti

于尔根·哈贝马斯，Strukturwandel der Öffentlichkeit：Untersuchungen zu einer Kategorie der bürgerlichen Gesellschaft（法兰克福：Suhrkamp，1962）。托马斯·伯格 (Thomas Burger) 与弗雷德里克·劳伦斯 (Frederick Lawrence) 翻译成英文，名为《公共领域的结构转型：对资产阶级社会类别的探究》（马萨诸塞州剑桥：麻省理工学院出版社，1989 年）。

Jürgen Habermas, Strukturwandel der Öffentlichkeit: Untersuchungen zu einer Kategorie der bürgerlichen Gesellschaft (Frankfurt: Suhrkamp, 1962). Translated into English by Thomas Burger with Frederick Lawrence as The Structural Transformation of the Public Sphere: An Inquiry into a Category of Bourgeois Society (Cambridge, MA: MIT Press, 1989).

1962

1962

科学革命的结构:库恩将科学视为工作共同体

The Structure of Scientific Revolutions: Kuhn Conceives of Science as Work Communities

如果说《科学革命的结构》是二十世纪下半叶最具影响力的著作之一，也是托马斯·库恩（1922-1996）迄今为止最著名的著作，那是因为它在20世纪60年代和70年代引发了令人难忘的论战，尤其是在科学哲学家、历史学家和科学社会学家之间，随后又蔓延到许多其他知识领域。这本书的核心（以及它的成功和由此引发的攻击）在于范式的概念。库恩将其定义为：团结一个群体的学科矩阵；支撑他们事业的概念、做事方式和技术工具；以及该群体共享的一套本体论和原则。在 1969 年的后记中，库恩承认他赋予了该术语许多不同的含义，如果他将其与科学界的培训，特别是“范例”的作用更紧密地联系起来，人们会更好地理解他的意思——范例是指理科学生必须进行的重复练习和任务，通过这些练习和任务，他们在环境中学习做科学的方式，了解解决问题的“正确”方法和“有效”的工具。

If The Structure of Scientific Revolutions is one of the most influential books of the second half of the twentieth century, and by far the most famous work of Thomas Kuhn (1922–1996), it is because it sparked memorable polemics throughout the 1960s and 1970s, particularly between philosophers, historians, and sociologists of science, and subsequently spread to many other fields of knowledge. At the heart of the book (and its success and the attacks it triggered) lies the notion of paradigm. Kuhn defines it as the disciplinary matrix uniting a group; as the concepts, ways of doing, and technical tools underpinning their undertaking; and as the set of ontologies and principles shared by the group. In the 1969 postscript, Kuhn recognizes that he loads the term with many different meanings and that he would have been better understood had he linked it more closely to the training of scientific communities and, particularly, the role of “exemplars”—namely, the repeated exercises and tasks that science students must perform and by which they are socialized in the milieu on the ways of doing science and knowing the “correct” ways of addressing problems and the tools that “work.”

范式的概念意味着从一个范式到另一个范式的反复转换，库恩称之为“科学革命”。当惯常的解决问题的方法不再奏效时（例如相对论和量子力学的起源），概念革命就会发生，新的范式框架就会出现。因此，库恩将科学的动态概念化为一系列“正常”阶段（一种范式占据主导地位的时刻）和危机时刻（当相互矛盾的表述并存时，（原型是玻尔1913年提出的原子模型）。因此，他强调，老派人士很难适应这个新世界，也很难理解这些新事物在形式层面之外的深层物理含义。在这一点上，库恩回想起了量子概念之父马克斯·普朗克，他写道：一个理论永远不会说服任何人，但一代人去世，一代人诞生，对他们来说，新理论是自然而然的。

The notion of paradigm implies recurrent shifts from one to the next, what Kuhn calls “scientific revolutions.” When habitual ways of addressing problems no longer work (such as at the origins of relativity and quantum mechanics, for example), conceptual revolutions occur, and new paradigmatic frameworks emerge. Kuhn thus conceptualizes the dynamic of science as a series of “normal” phases (moments when one paradigm reigns supreme) and moments of crisis (when contradictory representations coexist, the prototype being Bohr’s 1913 model of the atom). He thus insists on the difficulty the old guard have in living in this new world and in appropriating, beyond the formal aspects, the deep physical meaning of these novelties. On this point Kuhn goes back to Max Planck, the father of the idea of quanta, who wrote that a theory never convinces anyone, but that one generation dies and another is born for whom the new theory is natural.

因此，科学的主角并非孤独地、探究世界的个人，而是组织起来的实践者群体及其集体实践的隐含维度。库恩忠于其导师亚历山大·柯瓦雷，坚持认为任何知识都不可能脱离先验的理念——无论是本体论的还是哲学的。他借用迈克尔·波兰尼的“隐性知识”概念，认为“整合做事方式”，即创造第二天性，是学术实践的基础。他还与路德维希·维特根斯坦一起强调，充分理解行动和知识意义的唯一途径是通过实践。简而言之，科学也是一种生命形式。

The main actor in science is thus not the solitary inquiring individual facing the world but the organized community of practitioners and the implicit dimension of their collective practices. Faithful to his master Alexandre Koyré, Kuhn insists on the impossibility of any knowledge devoid of a priori ideas—be they ontological or philosophical. Borrowing Michael Polanyi’s idea of “tacit knowledge,” he argues that the “incorporation of ways of doing,” the creation of a second nature, is what underpins scholarly practice. And with Ludwig Wittgenstein, he emphasizes that the only way to fully assimilate the meaning of action and knowledge is through usage. In short, science too is a form of life.

因此，我们或许能体会到科学哲学家和科学史学家的震惊（相比之下，科学家们的震惊更为强烈，因为他们常常将这本书视为日常经验的反映）。库恩被解读为“去神圣化”了科学，因为他抹去了科学与真理之间的关系，而这一点他在辩护中又详细地提到了。他被认为为知识的相对性铺平了道路，使得科学知识过于依赖于其产生的条件。此外，有人认为，范式因其相对的不可通约性，破坏了科学哲学家们所珍视的知识的累积性——库恩对此提出了质疑，呼吁人们以更开放的视角解读他的著作。

One may thus appreciate the shock felt by philosophers and historians of science (more than by scientists, who often saw this book as reflecting their daily experience). Kuhn was read as “desacralizing” science, since he erases the issue of how it relates to truth, a point to which he returned at length in his defense. He was deemed to have paved the way to the relativity of knowledge, making scientific knowledge too dependent on the conditions of its production. And it was argued that paradigms, in their relative incommensurability, destroyed the cumulative nature of knowledge that philosophers of science held so dear—something that Kuhn disputed, calling for a less rigid reading of his work.

不可否认，库恩彻底背离了以往的观点。但他在很大程度上也是一位与时代紧密相关的思想家。在20世纪60年代，以结构为视角的思考十分普遍， “范式”的概念与当时的社会科学和历史科学相契合，因为当时的社会科学和历史科学的思考基于长期框架、稳定性以及组织一个时代思想结构的原则。至于“革命”一词，它当然是当代地缘政治和马克思主义的核心。随着“革命”一词在许多知识分子中的使用达到顶峰，它便在19世纪的历史和科学哲学中泛滥开来。柯瓦雷发明的“科学革命”是欧洲现代性的奠基之举。

There is no denying that Kuhn departed radically from previous perspectives. But he was also very much a thinker of his time. Thinking in terms of structure was commonplace in the 1960s, and the notion of paradigm fit in easily with the social and historical sciences of the period, which were thinking in terms of long-time frames, stabilities, and the principles organizing the thought structures of an era. As for the term revolution, it is of course central to contemporary geopolitics and Marxism. As its usage peaked among many intellectuals, it flooded through history and the philosophy of science in the wake of Koyré’s invention of the “scientific revolution” as the founding act of European modernity.

库恩也以一种更深层次的方式体现了他所处的时代——也就是说，他倾向于以单一的“宏观”尺度来分析事物。在这一点上，他的继承者——后来创立了科学研究——与他的工作分道扬镳。他们与历史学（通过微观史学）和其他社会科学（例如通过格尔茨的人类学和波尔坦斯基的社会学）并驾齐驱，将注意力转向深入分析，赋予主体性和行动者的反思性以新的地位，同时也打破了科学往往被置于的孤立状态，将其与政治动态和技术运作联系起来。与此相比，库恩描绘的科学是一个由学术共同体组成的自主世界，它们孤立地运作，与世界隔绝。当我们思考他所讨论的对象（例如量子力学）的性质时，这并不奇怪。但当我们思考冷战所引领的科学类型时，这便令人惊讶了。这与战争努力紧密相连，受军事技术和社会需求驱动，面向创新和经济生活。这让我们回想起库恩在哈佛大学科学通识教育项目中为年轻科学家教授历史的经历。他的任务是向广大公众传达科学的驱动原理及其内在运作，这无疑是他无视当时影响科学工作者的深刻变革的一个因素。他因此保留了一个重要的神话，即“科学”的神话——即一套本质上纯粹的知识体系，因为它遵循自身的规则，远离日常生活的喧嚣。

Kuhn was also very much of his time in a deeper way—namely, his tendency to analyze things on a single, “macro” scale. On this point his heirs, who went on to invent science studies, parted ways with his work. In tandem with history (through microhistory) and other social sciences (through Geertz’s anthropology and Boltanski’s sociology, for example), they turned their attention to in-depth analysis, giving a new place to agency and actors’ reflexivity, while also dismantling the silo in which science tended to be placed, instead linking it to political dynamics and technical operations. In comparison to this, Kuhn’s portrait of science is of an autonomous world of scholarly communities at work, operating in isolation and cut off from the world. That is not surprising when we think of the nature of the objects he was discussing, such as quantum mechanics. But it is surprising when we think of the type of science being ushered in by the Cold War. This was tightly bound up with the war effort, driven by military technology and social demands, and geared toward innovation and economic life. This takes us back to Kuhn’s formative involvement in teaching history to young scientists in the General Education in Science program at Harvard. His task was to communicate to this broad public the principles driving science, and their internal functioning, and this was no doubt a factor in his setting aside the profound transformations affecting those working in science at that time. He thereby preserved a major myth, that of “Science”—that is, a body of knowledge that is essentially pure because living in accordance with its own rules, far removed from the tumult of ordinary life.

多米尼克·佩斯特

Dominique Pestre

托马斯·S·库恩，《科学革命的结构》（芝加哥：芝加哥大学出版社，1962 年）。

Thomas S. Kuhn, The Structure of Scientific Revolutions (Chicago: University of Chicago Press, 1962).

1963

1963

英国工人阶级的形成:汤普森还原工人阶级的经历

The Making of the English Working Class: Thompson Restores the Experience of the Working Class

1963 年 12 月，具有社会主义倾向的伦敦出版商 Victor Gollancz 出版了一本 800 多页的书，名为《英国工人阶级的形成》。尽管研究对象是古典的，但这本书却非同寻常且具有煽动性。封面描绘了一位来自米德尔顿的矿工回家的场景，背景是最早用于将煤炭运到附近利兹的蒸汽机之一。然而，这本书并不是从工业革命开始；而是从 18 世纪 90 年代开始，与法国大革命的事件相呼应，当时英国见证了许多工人阶级政治协会的迅速崛起。研究结束于 19 世纪 30 年代和 40 年代，标志着宪章运动的兴起，该运动推动了议会政治制度的民主化。这本书在公众中获得了意想不到的成功。在接下来的十年里，这本书再版了五次，并被翻译成意大利语（1969年）、西班牙语（1977年）、德语（1987年）、葡萄牙语（1987年）和法语（1988年）。之后又陆续出现了更多译本，最近又陆续出现了中文（2001年和2013年）、日语（2003年）和土耳其语（2004年）。

In December 1963, Victor Gollancz, a London-based publisher with socialist leanings, brought out a book of over 800 pages, The Making of the English Working Class. While the object of study was classical, the book was unorthodox and provocative. The cover shows a miner from Middleton going back home, with one of the first steam engines for transporting coal to nearby Leeds in the background. Yet the book does not start with the industrial revolution; rather, it begins with the 1790s, when, echoing events in revolutionary France, England witnessed the rapid emergence of many working-class political associations. The study ends with the 1830s and 1840s, marked by the emergence of the Chartist movement that pushed for the democratization of the parliamentary political system. The book was an unexpected success with the public. It was republished five times over the following decade and translated into Italian (1969), Spanish (1977), German (1987), Portuguese (1987), and French (1988). Further translations continued to appear, with more recent ones in Chinese (2001 and 2013), Japanese (2003), and Turkish (2004).

爱德华·P·汤普森（Edward P. Thompson，1924-1993）虽然毕业于剑桥大学，但在1963年时，他仍然处于学术界的边缘。他自1948年起在利兹大学任教，为成年人开设夜校课程，学生大多来自老工业区的工人。他自1940年起积极加入共产党，并于1956年离开共产党，参与新左派的兴起，捍卫自己的人文社会主义理念。他尤其反对将经济问题简单化。汤普森反对决定论和自上而下的政治运动组织。相反，他倡导普通民众基于自身社会经验采取政治行动。至此，汤普森已撰写了大量关于文学、政治和历史的著作。

Although educated at Cambridge University, Edward P. Thompson (1924–1993) was still on the margins of academia in 1963. He had been teaching at Leeds University since 1948, where he gave evening classes to adults, most of whom were workers from the old industrial region. An active member of the Communist Party since 1940, he left it in 1956 to defend his idea of humanist socialism by participating in the emergence of the New Left. He particularly objected to the simplifications of economic determinism and to the top-down organization of political movements. Instead, he campaigned for political action by ordinary people rooted in their own social experiences.
