时间与叙事：利科尔重新定义时间

Time and Narrative: Ricœur Refigures Time

我们生活在时间之中，时间是存在本身所固有的；然而，对时间的思辨是一种“无结果的沉思”。面对这一困境，保罗·利科（Paul Ricœur，1913-2005）建议探索叙事所提供的路径：“时间性无法在现象学的直接话语中被言说，而是需要通过叙事的间接话语来中介。” 这正是利科在“美国时期”写成的三卷本《时间与叙事》 （Temps et récit）的理念。当时，他往返于巴黎和芝加哥两地。这种跨越大西洋的往返经历，使他在现象学、分析哲学、叙事学和史学之间展开了一场漫长的对话。

We live in time, and time is inherent to being; however, speculation on time is an “inconclusive rumination.” Confronting this aporia, Paul Ricœur (1913–2005) suggests exploring the path provided by narrative: “Temporality cannot be spoken of in the direct discourse of phenomenology, but rather requires the mediation of the indirect discourse of narration.” This is the idea underlying the three volumes of Temps et récit (Time and Narrative), written during Ricœur’s “American period,” when he divided his time between Paris and Chicago. This shuttling back and forth across the Atlantic led him to develop a lengthy conversation between phenomenology, analytic philosophy, narratology, and historiography.

他的核心论点是“三重摹拟”，即介于时间与叙事之间的中介，是一个模仿或再现行动的主动过程。摹拟一与我们对生活时间性的预设相关；摹拟二与作品结构及其传统与创新之间的特定互动所构建的实际情节相关；摹拟三与读者对作品以及自身世界、感受和行动方式的重塑相关。他与诺思洛普·弗莱共同探讨了文学叙事，旨在表明小说作为一种“无形式的形式”的出现以及“讲述艺术的终结”并不意味着情节的终结：新叙事形式的诞生证明，叙事功能虽然可能经历深刻的变化，但并未消失。

The core of his argument is “triple mimesis,” mediating between time and narrative, an active process imitating or representing action. Mimesis I relates to the preunderstanding we have of lived temporality; mimesis II to the actual plotting proposed by the configuration of the work and its specific interplay of tradition with innovation; and mimesis III to the readers’ refiguration not only of the work but also of their own world and ways of feeling and acting. The entire exploration of literary narrative, conducted in discussion with Northrop Frye, seeks to show that the advent of the novel as a “form without form” and the “end of the art of telling” in no way means the end of plotting: the birth of new narrative forms proves that the narrative function, while it may undergo profound changes, does not disappear.

虚构的叙述重新构建了我们时间的体验，而这种体验总是混乱、无形、无声的。它们并不能解决悖论时间，而要让它们发挥作用，使它们富有成效。时间叙事循环非但不是恶性的，而且“很健康”，因为每一半都相互强化。因此，里克尔选取的三个“时间寓言”（《追忆似水年华》、《魔山》和《达洛维夫人》）通过“想象的变化”虚构地丰富了人类的时间体验。这三个寓言都指出了时间的不一致性，即年代时间和生活时间之间的差距，在时间中插入了冲突的维度。一天中的时间不仅在外部对所有人来说都相同，在私人领域中也存在差异，公共时间也被不相容的愿景所侵蚀：它没有将人聚集在一起，而是将人分开。

Fictional accounts reconfigure our temporal experience, which is always confused, formless, and mute, as it were. They do not resolve the paradoxes of time but put them to work and make them productive. Far from being vicious, the time-narrative circle is “in good health,” for each half reinforces the other. Thus, the three “fables about time” selected by Ricœur (In Search of Lost Time, The Magic Mountain, and Mrs. Dalloway) fictively enrich human experience of time through “imaginative variations.” All three point out the discordance of times, the gap between chronological time and lived time, inserting the dimension of conflict into time. Not only is the time of day only externally the same for all, while differing within the intimate realm, public time too is eroded by incompatible visions: it does not bring together; it sets apart.

历史叙事也回应了时间经验的困境。但这预设了我们对事件和叙事概念的扩展。里克尔指出，尽管布罗代尔曾宣称，他并没有完全摒弃个人、事件和叙事。行动非但没有被抽离，反而依然是核心，而“长时段历史”的概念本身与戏剧性事件——即事件的情节——密不可分。里克尔由此剥离了事件的冲动性（它并不一定“短暂而紧张，如同爆炸”），而是赋予它们症状或证词的地位。

Historical narratives too are a response to the aporias of temporal experience. But that presupposes expanding our concepts of event and narrative. Ricœur shows that despite Braudel’s proclamations, he did not manage to do away with individuals, events, and narrative. Far from being evacuated, action remains central, and the very idea of longue durée history is inseparable from the dramatic event—that is, the plotting of event. Ricœur thus strips events of their impetuous character (it is not necessarily “brief and nervous, like an explosion”) and instead assigns them the status of symptoms or testimonies.

《时间与叙述》提出了一条漫长而复杂的路径，其根基在于“间接的衍生联系”。里克尔认识到历史是一种叙事实践，并分析了历史与虚构之间的交叠之处。两者都通过相互借鉴而发展：历史意向性“通过将源于想象叙事形式的虚构化资源融入其预期对象而变得有效”，而虚构的意向性“只有通过对称地假设历史化资源（这些资源是通过尝试重建实际的过去而呈现给它的）才能产生其探寻和转化行动与苦难的效果”。然而，与海登·怀特不同，里克尔谨慎地区分了两种叙事话语。“只有历史才能声称其指涉镌刻于经验现实之中[……]。即使过去已不复存在，用奥古斯丁的话来说，它只能在过去的现在中才能触及，也就是说，通过成为历史学家文献的过去痕迹，它仍然确实发生了。”这带来了两个后果。

Temps et récit proposes a long and complex path, grounded in an “indirect connection of derivation.” Ricœur recognizes that history is a narrative practice and analyzes the overlaps between history and fiction. Both evolve through reciprocal borrowings: Historical intentionality “becomes effective by incorporating into its intended object the resources of fictionalization stemming from the narrative form of imagination,” while the intentionality of fiction “produces its effects of detecting and transforming acting and suffering only by symmetrically assuming the resources of historicization presented it by attempts to reconstruct the actual past.” However, unlike Hayden White, Ricœur is careful to maintain the distinction between the two types of narrative discourse. “Only history can claim a reference inscribed in empirical reality [ . . . ]. Even if the past no longer exists and if, in Augustine’s expression, it could be reached only in the present of the past, that is, through the traces of the past become documents for the historian, still it did happen.” This has two consequences.

首先，真理问题在历史学中始终是一个根本问题：过去被定义为历史知识力求与之恰当对应的参照点。“历史学家凭借文献和文献证据，受制于曾经发生的事情。他欠着过去，欠着对逝者的认可，这使他成为一个无力偿还债务的债务人。” 其次，正因为历史学追求客观性，它可能会将客观性的限度作为一个具体问题提出来。因此，任何将现实性概念应用于过去的过去性的天真设想都是不合格的。因此，历史与虚构的参照模型及其各自的目的之间存在着不对称性和互补性。

First, the problem of truth remains fundamental in history: The past is defined as the reference point to which historical knowledge seeks to correspond appropriately. “With the documents and by way of documentary proof, the historian is subject to what once happened. He has a debt to the past, a debt of recognition of the dead, which makes of him an insolvent debtor.” Second, precisely because history pursues objectivity, it may raise the question of the limits of objectivity as a specific problem. For this reason, any naive vision of the concept of reality applied to the pastness of the past is disqualified. Hence there is asymmetry and complementarity between the referential models and respective purposes of history and fiction.

叙事，时间的守护者：这一公式获得了巨大的成功。尽管利科尔谨慎地设定了它的界限，但它也引发了一些误解。对他而言，不存在完整的叙事，也不存在“所有情节的情节”（这意味着我们必须摒弃黑格尔式的诱惑）。此外，通过诗歌来弥补时间的困境，并不意味着叙事之外别无其他。利科尔将叙事视为时间顺序与主观生活经验之间的决定性中介，但他也承认，时间的某些方面是叙事本身无法理解或假设的，而且发生的事情并非已经具备叙事的形式。

Narrative, the guardian of time: The formula enjoyed great success. It also gave rise to some misunderstandings, despite Ricœur carefully setting out its limits. For him, there is no total narrative, no “plot of all plots” (meaning we must renounce Hegelian temptations). Furthermore, the idea of making up for the aporia of time via poesis does not imply that there is nothing beyond narrative. Ricœur sees narrative as a decisive mediator between chronological time and subjective lived experience, yet he recognizes that there are aspects of time that narrative per se cannot apprehend or assume, and that what happens does not already have the form of narrative.

萨宾娜·洛里加

Sabina Loriga

Paul Ricœur，《Temps et récit》，第 1 卷，《L'intrigue et le récit historique》，第 2 卷，《La configuration dans le récit de fiction》，第 3 卷，《Le temps raconté》（巴黎：Éditions du Seuil [“L'Ordre philosophique”]，1985）。由 Points（“Essais”）再版，1991 年。由 Kathleen McLaughlin、David Pellauer 和 Kathleen Blamey 翻译成英文，《时间与叙事》，3 卷。 （芝加哥：芝加哥大学出版社，1984 年、1985 年、1988 年）。

Paul Ricœur, Temps et récit, tome 1, L’intrigue et le récit historique, tome 2, La configuration dans le récit de fiction, tome 3, Le temps raconté (Paris: Éditions du Seuil [“L’Ordre philosophique”], 1985). Republished by Points (“Essais”), 1991. Translated into English by Kathleen McLaughlin, David Pellauer, and Kathleen Blamey as Time and Narrative, 3 vols. (Chicago: University of Chicago Press, 1984, 1985, 1988).

1986

1986

风险社会：贝克宣布科学的自我祛魅

Risk Society: Beck Announces Science’s Self-Disenchantment

当乌尔里希·贝克（1944-2015）出版《风险社会》 （Risikogesellschaft）时，他已是德国公认的知识分子。该书五年内销量达六万册，读者范围远远超出学术界，并深刻影响了德国的政治生态。毫无疑问，这本书的成功部分归功于其基调：贝克并非阐述严谨的实证研究成果，而是一篇乐于采用论战立场的文章，其主要目标是精准指出当代社会的特殊性。

When Ulrich Beck (1944–2015) published Risikogesellschaft (Risk Society), he was already a recognized intellectual in Germany. Selling 60,000 copies in five years, the book reached an audience far beyond academia and profoundly influenced German political ecology. No doubt the book’s success was partly due to its tone: rather than setting out the results of rigorous empirical research, it is an essay in which Beck readily adopts a polemical stance, and his prime objective is to pinpoint the specificities of contemporary societies.

因此，他提出了一套关于现代社会的普遍理论。本书主要探讨当代个人主义，分析它如何重塑社会不平等，以及性别关系、家庭、工作，更不用说科学技术。其核心思想是“反身性”。因此，当代个人主义虽然促使我们每个人逐渐摆脱工业社会特有的制度（社会阶层、核心家庭等），但这种解放源于我们构建和重新定向自身人生轨迹的能力——以及与之密不可分的指令。由于社会组织的存在，后者越来越不受传统或阶级的制约，而在形式上越来越取决于我们自身的决定。正因如此，个人主义可以说是反身性的：我们被引导去质疑我们是什么，尤其是我们渴望成为什么，去质疑那些先前被描述和接受为不言而喻的事物。贝克继续撰写这本书，该书于 1992 年被翻译成英文，但直到 2001 年才被翻译成法文，他与安东尼·吉登斯和斯科特·拉什等其他反身现代性理论家进行了合作。

He thus puts forward a general theory of modern societies. The book primarily examines contemporary individualism, analyzing how it reconfigures social inequalities, together with gender relations, the family, and work, not to mention science and technology. The key idea is that of “reflexivity.” Thus, while contemporary individualism leads to each of us being progressively emancipated from the institutions characterizing industrial society (social class, the nuclear family, etc.), this emancipation results from our capacity—and indissociably the injunction—to construct and redirect our own biographical trajectory. By virtue of social organization, the latter is increasingly less determined by tradition or class and, formally, depends more and more on our own decisions. That is why individualism may be said to be reflexive: We are led to question what we are, especially what we wish to become, to call into question what was previously described and accepted as self-evident. Carrying on from this book, translated into English in 1992 yet into French only in 2001, Beck worked with other theoreticians of reflexive modernity such as Anthony Giddens and Scott Lash.

然而，贝克之所以声名狼藉，主要是因为他对科学与风险的论述。反思性的概念在此再次发挥了关键作用，贝克区分了科学合理化进程的两个阶段，这一进程逐步重塑了我们的社会。首先，科学将其系统性的怀疑应用于自然和人类，从而帮助“祛魅”世界：这是“简单现代性”的时代。然后，在20世纪，科学开始将这种方法应用于自身，检验其假设，质疑其工具、方法和结果及其社会和环境后果。科学因此自我祛魅，同时也摧毁了对进步的任何信念。贝克指出，人文科学和社会科学在科学的去神秘化过程中发挥了至关重要的作用，尤其是科学与知识的认识论和社会学。

Still, it is mainly what Beck has to say about science and risk that won it notoriety. The idea of reflexivity plays a key role here once again, with Beck distinguishing two phases in the process of scientific rationalization that progressively reshaped our societies. First, science applied its methodical doubt to nature and to men, thus helping to “disenchant” the world: This was the era of “simple modernity.” Then, over the course of the twentieth century, science started to apply this approach to itself, examining its hypotheses, calling into doubt its tools, methods, and results along with their social and environmental consequences. Science thus disenchanted itself, torpedoing any faith in progress at the same time. Beck notes that the human and social sciences have played a crucial role in this demystification of science, particularly the epistemology and sociology of science and knowledge.

随着反思性现代时代的发展，当代科学如今产生的是片面的、暂时的、充满争议的知识。它们已经“割据”，我们正在目睹一个过程，在这个过程中，科学、准科学和伪科学被置于同一水平，而后者可能会用“科学”自身的论证来反驳它。贝克将科学描述为一种超市，我们每个人都可以根据自己的信仰和兴趣，在多种相互竞争的知识形式中进行选择。因此，科学正处于结构性危机之中，尤其是在它面临着新的风险时。这些风险是它促成的，但它却无法产生稳定的共识性知识来应对这些风险。这些新风险主要是财富生产活动的副产品，其中涉及大量的科学。它们也是无形的，与所生产的财富不同，它们无法被我们的感官所察觉，从而促进了它们的悄无声息的扩散。最后，它们常常构成前所未有的规模，以至于具有“民主性”，因为没有人能够最终逃脱它们。贝克在这里指的是我们每天吸入和摄入的众多微小污染物，但没有人真正了解它们会对我们的健康造成什么后果。但最终，时事最能体现他的分析，并对其成功起到了决定性的作用。《风险社会》出版于1986年，恰逢切尔诺贝利核灾难发生的那一年，而疯牛病危机（也称为疯牛病）发生在这本书被翻译成英文后的几年。那么，放射性尘埃或朊病毒又是什么呢？比起科学辅助下的经济活动所产生的我们无法预见、无人能够逃脱的隐形风险呢？

With the development of the reflexive modern era, contemporary sciences now produce partial, provisional, contested knowledge. They have become “balkanized,” and we are witnessing a process in which science, quasi-science, and pseudo-science are being placed on the same level, and in which the latter may turn “science’s” own arguments back against it. Beck describes science as a sort of supermarket, in which we may each choose between multiple competing forms of knowledge in the light of our beliefs and interests. Science is therefore in a state of structural crisis, especially as it is confronted with new risks that it helped cause but about which it is incapable of producing stable consensual knowledge for tackling them. These new risks are the primarily the by-products of wealth-producing activities, involving a sizable dollop of science. They are also invisible, escaping detection by our senses, unlike the wealth produced, thus facilitating their silent proliferation. Lastly, they often pose risks of such unprecedented scale as to be “democratic,” since no one may ultimately escape them. Beck here refers to the many microscopic pollutants we inhale and ingest on a daily basis without anybody really knowing what the consequences on our health might be. But it was ultimately current affairs that best illustrated his analyses, decisively contributing to their success. Risikogesellschaft came out in 1986, the same year as the Chernobyl nuclear catastrophe, while the BSE crisis (also called mad cow disease) occurred just a few years after the book was translated into English. And what are radioactive dust or prions other than invisible risks we cannot apprehend from which no one may escape, produced by economic activities assisted by science?

从这个角度来看，这本书的成功恰恰最好地体现在它某些论点的过时性上，这本身就自相矛盾。如今，许多“新风险”不再默默地滋生，而是引发了广泛的担忧，甚至抗议。并非所有担忧的人都读过贝克的著作，但他们都经历过他所宣告的一些危机和灾难。此外，反思性现代性的概念虽然引发了激烈的批评，但仍然具有实用价值。贝克最富有成果的分析或许与科学社会学的发展及其对争议的分析所带来的科学祛魅有关。值得注意的是，布莱恩·韦恩是英文版序言的作者之一，而法文版序言则由布鲁诺·拉图尔撰写，这两位都是科学研究领域的杰出人物。在许多评论家谈论“后真相”或“后事实”社会的时代，重读一位认为“后”这个前缀是我们这个时代的定义词的作者对当代社会中真相地位的令人振奋的分析无疑是有益的。

From this point of view, the book’s success is paradoxically best illustrated by the obsolescence of some of its theses. Nowadays, many “new risks” are no longer proliferating silently; rather, they are triggering widespread concern, and outcry even. Not all those who worry have read Beck, but all have experienced some of the crises and catastrophes that he announced. Additionally, the idea of reflexive modernity, though giving rise to stimulating criticism, continues to be of use. Perhaps the most fertile of Beck’s analyses relates to the disenchantment of science through developments in the sociology of science and its analysis of controversy. It is revealing that Brian Wynne was one of the authors of the foreword to the English edition while the French edition’s foreword was written by Bruno Latour, both eminent figures in science studies. At a time when many commentators are speaking of “post-truth” or a “post-factual” society, it may no doubt be useful to reread the bracing analyses of the status of truth in contemporary societies by an author who considered the prefix “post” to be the defining word of our era.

帕特里克·佩雷蒂-瓦特尔

Patrick Peretti-Watel

Ulrich Beck，Risikogesellschaft：Auf dem Weg in eine andere Moderne（法兰克福：Suhrkamp，1986）。马克·里特 (Mark Ritter) 将《风险社会：走向新现代性》翻译成英文（伦敦：Sage，1992 年）。

Ulrich Beck, Risikogesellschaft: Auf dem Weg in eine andere Moderne (Frankfurt: Suhrkamp, 1986). Translated into English by Mark Ritter as Risk Society: Towards a New Modernity (London: Sage, 1992).

1987

1987

近代早期法国印刷术的文化用途：Chartier与社会领域的文化史

The Cultural Uses of Print in Early Modern France: Chartier and the Cultural History of the Social Realm

用法、技巧与敏锐；策略、重新利用与偏差；差异化的挪用而非单一的效果；多重分化而非等级森严：罗杰·沙蒂尔（生于1945年）在本系列文章中提出的“法国从十六世纪到十九世纪的文化历程”的历史，描绘了近代早期法国复杂、多元且瞬息万变的社会领域。它将以行动者的倾向和实践为中心的词汇融入社会史，构建了一种关注社会动态以及过去个体如何建构其存在意义的视角。本书反对将世界划分为平民与精英的固定描述，反对将十七世纪视为彻底决裂（与专制国家和天主教宗教改革）的年代学，反对传统口头文化与基于书面文字的现代性之间的对立，描绘了一条复杂化并重构近代早期法国社会文化图景的历程。这种重构基于对“大众文化”概念的激进批判：米歇尔·德·塞托（Michel de Certeau）在 1970 年与多米尼克·朱利亚（Dominique Julia）和雅克·雷维尔（Jacques Revel）合著的《死亡之美》（La beauté du mort）中指出，大众文化的理念和兴趣根植于“压制它的东西”，使其形式和内容具体化，并使其脱离任何颠覆性维度。Chartier 将这一驳斥更进一步，展示了旧制度文化的复杂性。他指出了写作渗透到识字能力很少或根本没有影响力的世界的程度，质疑了口头社会和写作世界之间的严格划分，并展示了任何书面对象中包含的纪律或约束机制（关于什么是好的死亡、关于文明等）隐藏着“颠覆它的策略”，以及任何文化模式的传播如何产生新的区别实践。

Usages, skills, and acumen; tactics, repurposings, and deviations; differential appropriations rather than univocal effects; multiple divides rather than hierarchies: The history of the “cultural course taken by France from the sixteenth to the nineteenth century” as proposed by Roger Chartier (born 1945) in this collection of articles depicts a complex, multiple, shifting social realm in early modern France. It injects a lexicon centered on actors’ dispositions and practices into social history, building up a vision attentive to social dynamics and how individuals of the past constructed the meaning of their existence. Against a fixed description of a world divided into the people and the elites, against a chronology that takes the seventeenth century as a radical break (with an absolutist state and the Catholic Reformation), against the opposition between traditional oral culture and a modernity based on the written word, the book plots a course that complexifies and recomposes the sociocultural landscape of early modern France. This reconfiguration is based on a radical critique of the concept of “popular culture”: Michel de Certeau, in “La beauté du mort,” written with Dominique Julia and Jacques Revel in 1970, had pointed out how the very idea and interest in popular culture was grounded “in that which suppresses it,” in reifying it in its forms and contents, in shearing it of any subversive dimension. Chartier takes this refutation a step further, displaying the complexity of ancien régime cultures. He points out the extent to which writing penetrated worlds where literacy held little or no sway, questions the watertight division between oral societies and worlds of writing, and shows how any disciplinary or constraining mechanisms contained in written objects (on what constitutes a good death, on civility, etc.) secretes “tactics which subvert it” and how any divulgation of a cultural model gives rise to new practices of distinction.

这并不是要提出一个新的解释来取代之前的解释。Chartier 提出了一系列关于问题（城镇居民关于印刷文字的实践、农民的阅读）和语料库（ “临终艺术”、礼仪手册、“蓝调图书馆”）的研究，所有这些研究都作为观察独特却又相互关联的文化世界的窗口。阅读是本书的核心，但不仅仅是研究对象：通过赋予阅读以意义深远的社会行动的全部密度，Chartier 颠覆了历史学家与其印刷资料的关系。早期现代法国文化史学家，例如罗伯特·芒德鲁，经常将文本内容与社会群体——人民和精英——联系起来。《旧制度法国的讲座与读者》首先强调“非识字读者对识字文本的使用”，反之亦然。因此，文化的社会特征应该根据使用和实践来识别。关于“蓝书”（Bibliothèque bleue，特鲁瓦十六至十九世纪出版的廉价作品）的三项研究指出，它们如何不断地将学术传统文本与文学新意结合起来：特鲁瓦的印刷商和出版商将这些作品改编、剪辑和重新组合，形成一种在城乡都流通的通用出版格式。虽然我们无法用特定的文本和形式来定义“大众文化”，但Chartier描述了这些出版商在印刷这些作品时，是如何将他们对读者技能的理解融入其中的：“蓝书”（livres bleus）的短小段落和简化的情节，通常穿插着图像，隐含地预设了阅读的断断续续、断断续续和基础性。

This is not a matter of coming up with an account to replace one that preceded it. Chartier presents a series of studies on questions (town dwellers’ practices concerning the printed word, peasants’ reading) and on corpuses (“arts of dying,” civility manuals, the “Bibliothèque bleue”), all acting as windows onto singular yet linked cultural worlds. Reading is at the heart of the book, but not just as an object of research: By endowing reading with all the density of a signifying social action, Chartier overturns how historians relate to their printed sources. Historians of early modern French culture, such as Robert Mandrou, had often identified textual contents with social groups—people and elites. Lectures et lecteurs dans la France d’Ancien Régime first emphasizes the “usages of literate texts by readers who were not literate,” and vice versa. The social characteristics of culture are thus to be identified in terms of usages and practices. The three studies on the “Bibliothèque bleue” (cheap works produced in Troyes from the sixteenth to the nineteenth century) point out how they constantly reused texts from the learned tradition together with literary novelties: The printers and publishers in Troyes adapted, cut up, and recomposed these writings in a common publishing format that circulated in town and countryside alike. While it is impossible to identify a “popular culture” with specific texts and forms, Chartier describes how these publishers, in setting out these works for printing, incorporated the representations they had of their readers’ skills: the short paragraphs of the “livres bleus” with their simplified plots, often punctuated by images, implicitly postulate discontinuous, halting, and elementary reading.

这带来了重大的方法论转变。通过关注书面文字的物质性，并着手整理印刷作品，书面文字、印刷品和书籍作为对象，成为了关注实践的社会文化史的资料来源。这不再仅仅是记录人们去世时所编制的清单中印刷作品的不平等分配，这只能告诉我们最富有者有限的社会世界，而对实践却一无所知。相反，印刷作品通过文本的印刷排版方式、文本的物质性、形式方面、页面布局、排版选择，所有这些都预设了阅读类型和写作的可能用法。这是 Chartier 作品的主要内容之一，与唐纳德·麦肯齐的“材料书目”所更新的文本社会学进行对话，并通过对“接受美学”的批判性阅读来考察读者的期望。但这并不止于此。《法国旧制度下的讲座和读者》也为近代法国政治史的复兴铺平了道路。1990 年，在《法国大革命的文化起源》中，Chartier 回归阅读实践和印刷材料的流通，强调它们在十八世纪最后几十年去神圣化过程中的作用。书籍的影响既源于其颠覆性的内容，也源于一种不再尊重意义权威的阅读方式。这揭示了沙蒂尔与主导启蒙运动理解的思想史相距多远。

This brings about a major methodological shift. For by paying attention to the materiality of the written word and to setting out works for printing, the written word, printed material, and books become, as objects, the sources for a sociocultural history focusing on practices. It is no longer a matter of just noting the unequal distribution of printed works in inventories drawn up when people died, which can only tell us about the limited social worlds of the wealthiest and nothing at all about practices. Instead, the printed work becomes the archive of its usages, via ways of setting out texts for printing, their materiality, their formal aspects, page layouts, typographical choices, all of which postulate types of reading and possible usages for writings. This is one of the main thrusts in Chartier’s work, in dialogue with a sociology of texts that had been renewed by the “material bibliography” of Donald McKenzie and with examination into the expectations of readers stemming from a critical reading of “reception aesthetics.” But it does not stop there. For Lectures et lecteurs dans la France d’Ancien Régime also paved the way to a renewal in the political history of early modern France. In 1990, in Les origines culturelles de la Révolution française (The Cultural Origins of the French Revolution), Chartier returned to reading practices and the circulation of printed material, emphasizing their role in the process of desacralization characterizing the final decades of the eighteenth century. The impact of books stemmed both from their subversive content and from a way of reading that no longer respected meaning-prescribing authorities. This reveals just how far Chartier had traveled from the history of ideas dominating understanding of the Enlightenment.

通过鼓励社会和政治历史学家以及文本专家研究印刷材料的使用方式，并设想其物质性，Chartier 教导我们不要预先断定我们自以为了解过去人们的文化行为。因为阅读实践的历史时刻警惕着那些难以捉摸的东西，警惕着那些真正独特的、转瞬即逝的、不留痕迹的挪用。而这种不安正是他这本书的持久教益之一。

In encouraging social and political historians as well as text specialists to examine how printed material was used, and to envisage them in their materiality, Chartier taught us to not decide in advance what we think we know about the cultural behavior of men and women of the past. For the history of reading practices is alert to what eludes it, to the actual singular, ephemeral appropriations that leave no traces. And this disquiet is one of the lasting lessons of his book.

朱迪思·里昂-卡昂

Judith Lyon-Caen

Roger Chartier，《Lectures et lecteurs dans la France d'Ancien Régime》（巴黎：Éditions du Seuil [“L'Univers historique”]，1987）。琳达·G·科克伦 (Linda G. Cochrane) 翻译成英文，附加两章《早期现代法国印刷品的文化用途》 （新泽西州普林斯顿：普林斯顿大学出版社，1987 年）。

Roger Chartier, Lectures et lecteurs dans la France d’Ancien Régime (Paris: Éditions du Seuil [“L’Univers historique”], 1987). Translated into English, with two additional chapters, by Linda G. Cochrane as The Cultural Uses of Print in Early Modern France (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 1987).

1987

1987

《家族财富：大卫杜夫和霍尔分析性别与阶级的共建》

Family Fortunes: Davidoff and Hall Analyze the Co-construction of Gender and Class

到1987年，一种新的“性别史”迅速从20世纪60年代和70年代初女性主义历史学家所著的各种社会和文化史中涌现出来。卡罗琳·拜纳姆、杰奎琳·琼斯和克里斯蒂安·克拉皮什等学者（仅列举其中几位）不再满足于仅仅将女性纳入她们曾经被排除在外的历史叙事中，而是试图撰写女性与男性、男性气质与女性气质的历史，从而探索这两个类别始终相互建构的多种方式。正如我们将看到的，《家族财富》在将性别塑造为一个关系概念的更宏大的努力中发挥了重要作用。这一举措使学者们能够将关于性别差异和性别不平等结构的观念置于更全球化的社会、文化和政治史的核心。但这本书的写作也与那些研究现代英国阶级形成过程的历史学家和社会学家进行了对话。凯瑟琳·霍尔（生于1946年）和莱奥诺·达维多夫（1932-2014年）在序言中宣称，她们的研究对象是“十八世纪末至十九世纪中期英国中产阶级的制度和实践，既涉及男性也涉及女性”。作者们的措辞与爱德华·P·汤普森关于英国工人阶级形成的开创性著作相呼应，并进一步表达了他们的信念：“性别和阶级总是相互影响的，阶级意识总是以性别化的形式呈现。”

By 1987, a new “gender history” was fast emerging from the various social and cultural histories produced by feminist historians in the 1960s and early 1970s. No longer content merely to add women to a historical narrative from which they had been excluded, scholars such as Caroline Bynum, Jacqueline Jones, and Christiane Klapisch (to name but a few) sought instead to write histories of women and men, of masculinity and femininity, and thus explore the multiple ways in which these two categories are always mutually constructed. As we shall see, Family Fortunes played an important role in this larger effort to cast gender as a relational concept. This move would allow scholars to locate ideas about gender difference and gendered structures of inequality at the heart of more global histories of society, culture, and politics. But the book was also written in dialogue with those historians and sociologists who were studying processes of class formation in modern Britain. The prologue by Catherine Hall (born 1946) and Leonore Davidoff (1932–2014) thus announces that theirs is a study of the “institutions and practices of the English middle-class from the late eighteenth to the mid nineteenth centuries [which] concern both men and women.” In language that echoes Edward P. Thompson’s pathbreaking book on the formation of the British working class, the authors further state their conviction that “gender and class always operate together, and that consciousness of class always takes a gendered form.”

这项雄心勃勃的计划遭到一些人的质疑和蔑视。这些评论往往带有作者的恐惧所谓的激进研究对悠久历史传统所谓的中立性构成了威胁，而这种传统实际上只关注男性的活动。诺曼·麦考德因此断言，由于作者对“先入为主的教条”的“执着奉献”，《家族财富》很难被视为一部学术著作。而哈罗德·珀金则宣称，“霍尔和大卫多夫被女权主义议程蒙蔽了双眼”，使他们“无法”理解“尽职尽责、心甘情愿满足的妻子和母亲”的感受。1

This ambitious program was received by some with a mixture of suspicion and disdain. Often these reviews were marked by their authors’ fear of the threat that so-called militant research posed to the alleged neutrality of a long historical tradition that, in fact, focused solely on the activities of men. Norman McCord thus asserted that Family Fortunes could hardly be considered a work of scholarship, thanks to its authors’ “tenacious devotion” to “preconceived dogmas,” while Harold Perkin declared that “Hall and Davidoff were blinded” by a feminist agenda that rendered them “incapable” of understanding the feelings of “dutifully dedicated and willfully contented wives and mothers.”1

但在1987年，女性与性别研究被最保守的职业卫道士及其男性等级制度的轻蔑解读所推翻的时代已经过去了。因此，《家族财富》也引发了女性主义、马克思主义以及马克思主义女性主义历史学家的浓厚兴趣——当然，是批判性的兴趣，但同时也是严肃而引人入胜的——这本书为他们开辟了许多新的视角。四十年后，它的重要性得到了证实，因为它当时提出的“性别是阶级形成的核心”这一论点在今天看来显而易见。然而，一旦我们将这本书置于20世纪80年代末的时代背景中，我们就能清晰地看到，《家族财富》通过展示社会阶级的形成始终受到性别关系的影响，在多大程度上改变了社会历史。霍尔和大卫多夫的论点在当时是惊人的新颖：米里亚姆·斯莱特对他们放弃公共和私人之间的严格划分、转而采取强调两者相互联系的方法表示赞赏，而约翰·吉利斯则表示，《家族财富》 “转变”了我们思考那个时期的方式，为历史学家和社会学家提供了一个在其他背景或历史时刻研究家庭的“模型”。

But in 1987, the time had passed when research into women and gender could be pushed to one side by the dismissive readings of the most conservative guardians of the profession and its masculine hierarchies. Hence, Family Fortunes also sparked great interest—critical interest, to be sure, but serious and engaged nonetheless—from feminist, Marxist, and Marxist feminist historians, for whom the book opened many new perspectives. Forty years later, its importance is confirmed by the fact that its then-novel thesis—that gender is central to class formation—now strikes us as obvious. Yet once we resituate the book in the context of the late 1980s, we can clearly see the extent to which Family Fortunes transformed social history by demonstrating how the formation of social classes is always fashioned by gender relations. Hall and Davidoff’s theses were strikingly new at the time: Miriam Slater applauded their abandonment of a strict division between the public and private in favor of an approach that stresses their interconnection, while John Gillis stated that Family Fortunes had “transformed” our way of thinking about the period, offering historians and sociologists alike a “model” for studying the family in other contexts or moments of history.

这种热烈的反响至少有四个根源：一是作者坚持认为身份必然具有性别特征，而性别差异的组织是社会组织的核心。二是他们的小说性别类别的理解是不稳定的，它陷入了社会实践和制度中不断上演的建构、争论和重构过程。霍尔和大卫多夫借鉴葛兰西的观点，认为这些过程导致了对性别角色的多元甚至相互冲突的认知，而这种多元意义为协商和变革创造了空间。然而，对于性别差异，总存在着一种看似统一的“常识”，它超越了这些不同的解读，将其存在隐藏在看似统一的结构和意义背后。第三，作者反复论证，公共领域与私人领域的界限实际上是多孔且易变的，而家庭作为一种将市场与家庭领域联系起来的制度，在公共领域和私人领域之间充当着中介。最后，将男性也视为性别存在体进行研究的理念，以及男性气质本身是一种社会建构的信念，意味着《家族财富》预示了后来男性气质研究的兴起。

This enthusiastic reception has at least four roots: One is the authors’ insistence that identities are necessarily gendered and that the organization of sexual difference is central to social organization. Second is their novel understanding of gender categories as unstable, caught up in processes of construction, contestation, and reconfiguration that continually play out within social practices and institutions. Drawing on Gramsci, Hall and Davidoff argue that these processes give rise to diverse, even conflicting, perceptions of gender roles and that this plurality of meaning creates spaces for negotiation and change. Yet there is always an apparently unified “common sense” to gender distinctions that arches over and above these diverse interpretations, concealing their existence behind a seemingly unified structure and significance. Third, the authors repeatedly demonstrate that the boundaries between public and private are in fact porous and mobile and that the family, as an institution binding the market to the domestic sphere, acts as a mediator between the public and private spheres. Finally, the idea of studying men too as gendered beings, and the conviction that masculinity was itself a social construct, meant that Family Fortunes heralded later work in masculinity studies.

因此，这本书在构建新的性别史方面发挥了至关重要的作用。它借鉴了广泛的家庭和文学资料：婚姻记录、遗嘱、书信、日记、家族企业和地方协会的档案、人口普查，以及医生、牧师和地方作家创作的歌曲、诗歌和小说。《家族财富》雄心勃勃且精准地运用了社会史技术，为琼·斯科特几个月前出版的《性别：一个有用的历史分析范畴》（1986）提供了一种替代方案。后者倡导一种后结构主义方法，其原则是性别类别是通过话语和表述而非实践层面建构的。在随后的“理论之战”——围绕着推进女性和性别思考的最有效方法展开的激烈冲突——中，《家族财富》激励了整整一代关注社会实践和结构力量的历史学家。

The book thus played a crucial role in elaborating a new history of gender. It did this by drawing on a vast range of family and literary sources: marriage records, wills, letters, diaries, archives of family businesses and local associations, censuses, together with songs, poetry, and novels written by doctors, priests, and local authors. With its ambitious and precise use of the techniques of social history, Family Fortunes provides an alternative to Joan Scott’s “Gender: A Useful Category of Historical Analysis” (1986), published just a few months previously, which advocates a post-structuralist approach based on the principle that gendered categories are constructed through discourse and representations rather than at the level of practices. During the ensuing “theory wars”—fierce conflicts over the most useful methods for furthering thought about women and gender—Family Fortunes would inspire an entire generation of historians attentive to the force of social practices and structures.

这本书最终于2014年被翻译成法语，这体现了19世纪法国历史对英语著作缺乏一定的渗透性。但法语版的出版正值抵制新自由主义和资本主义危机的氛围。《家族财富》因此找到了新的读者群体，他们被阶级观念的复兴所吸引。人们越来越普遍地认为，无论历史学家的专业领域是什么，他们都不能忽视其研究中的性别维度。

The book was finally translated into French in 2014, illustrating a certain lack of permeability in nineteenth-century French history to works in English. But the French edition came out in a climate of resistance to neoliberalism and the crisis of capitalism. Family Fortunes thus found a new public, one that was attracted by renewed interest in the idea of class and the increasingly widespread sentiment that, whatever their field of expertise, historians can ill afford to sideline the gendered dimensions of their research.

劳拉·李·唐斯

Laura Lee Downs

莱昂诺尔·大卫多夫 (Leonore Davidoff) 和凯瑟琳·霍尔 (Catherine Hall)，《家族财富：英国中产阶级的男人和女人，1780-1850》 (芝加哥：芝加哥大学出版社，1987 年)。

Leonore Davidoff and Catherine Hall, Family Fortunes: Men and Women of the English Middle Class, 1780–1850 (Chicago: Chicago University Press, 1987).

1 请参阅 Norman McCord对 Leonore Davidoff 和 Catherine Hall 合著的《家庭财富：英国中产阶级的男人和女人，1780–1850》一书的评论，载于《英国历史评论》 103，第 409 期（1988 年 10 月）：996；以及 Harold Perkin 在《经济史评论》 41，第 2 期（1988 年 5 月）：309 中的评论。

1 See Norman McCord, review of Family Fortunes: Men and Women of the English Middle Class, 1780–1850, by Leonore Davidoff and Catherine Hall, English Historical Review 103, no. 409 (October 1988): 996; and Harold Perkin’s review in Economic History Review 41, no. 2 (May 1988):309.

1988

1988

天赋的性别：斯特拉森将性别转化为行动的能力

The Gender of the Gift: Strathern Turns Gender into a Capacity for Action

1988年，美拉尼西亚的人类学家发现了一本书名、内容和风格都令人费解的书。《天赋的性别》彻底颠覆了迄今为止关于这一地区的著作，将性别从人的属性转变为一种行动和交往的能力。

In 1988, anthropologists of Melanesia discovered a book with a most perplexing title, content, and style. The Gender of the Gift was a radical departure from what had hitherto been written about this part of the world, transforming gender from a property of people into a capacity for acting and relating.

自20世纪70年代中期以来，巴布亚新几内亚一直是众多女性民族志研究的对象，她们在女权主义浪潮的推动下，怀疑某些男性同行的著作中存在男性偏见。玛丽莲·斯特拉森（生于1941年）比她们早了足足十年，致力于研究新几内亚高地梅尔帕（或哈根）族群的女性活动及其行动范围。她发现，人们被定义为男性或女性，与其说是基于固定的属性，不如说是基于行动方式：也就是说，在一个以群体间礼仪和竞争性交换为主要集体活动的社会中，女性从事（商品）的生产，男性从事交易。

Since the mid-1970s, Papua New Guinea had been the subject of many ethnographic works by women who, driven by the feminist wave, suspected male bias in the works of certain of their male counterparts. Marilyn Strathern (born 1941) was a good ten years ahead of them in devoting her research to women’s activities and their scope for action among a population of the New Guinea Highlands, the Melpa (or Hagen). She had discovered that persons were defined as men or women on the basis not so much of fixed attributes than of modes of action: namely, production (of trade goods) for women and transaction for men, in a society where the main collective affair was ceremonial and competitive exchange between groups.

20世纪80年代初，斯特拉森对美拉尼西亚性别问题的思考受到了其他研究美拉尼西亚的女性学者和女权主义者的批评，她们指责她陷入了男性偏见的陷阱，或认为人类学和女权主义之间难以共存。她愿意以任何严谨分析中必然存在的距离感和缺乏让步的态度来思考女权主义，这或许被那些试图在公共领域留下印记、参与辩论的女性同事视为缺乏忠诚。

In the early 1980s, Strathern’s thoughts on gender in Melanesia were stimulated by criticism from other women working on Melanesia and feminists who accused her of falling into the trap of male bias or of deeming that anthropology and feminism sat awkwardly with each other. Her willingness to consider feminism with the distance and lack of concession that is part of any rigorous analysis was probably perceived as a lack of loyalty by female colleagues involved in debates seeking to make their mark in the public sphere.

正如副标题“美拉尼西亚的女性问题与社会问题”所示，本书将对学科及其分析范畴的思考，与基于其两大支柱——性别和天赋——对美拉尼西亚思想和实践世界的解读联系起来。这项浩大的工程从根本上改变了英语人类学分析南太平洋这一地区社会生活和思想形式的方式。然而，法国人类学并未立即受到影响。

As indicated by the subtitle, Problems with Women and Problems with Society in Melanesia, the book associates thinking on the discipline and its analytical categories with an interpretation of the world of Melanesian ideas and practices based on two of its pillars: gender and gift. The result of this vast undertaking was to fundamentally alter the way English-speaking anthropology analyzed the forms of social life and ideas in this region of the South Pacific. French anthropology, however, was not immediately affected.

本书基于这样的观点：对于美拉尼西亚人而言，社会和文化概念并非完全相关，因此有必要找到一种既非整体主义也非个人主义的替代方案，以便理解这些人的共同思考和行动方式。通过对“前女权主义”和女权主义方法的批判，《社会之神》（GOG）（本书的通常名称）试图揭示一系列思想和实践，其中许多集体活动在于瓦解关系、拆解关系，从而揭示其隐藏的含义，并使不可见的东西浮出水面。这些象征性的表现过程是在一系列事件中实现的，通常是仪式化的，对其进行分析可以理解美拉尼西亚人相互联系的方式（“社会性”）。

The book is based on the idea that for Melanesians, the concepts of society and culture are not entirely relevant, making it necessary to find an alternative that is neither holistic nor individualistic in order to make sense of the way these peoples think and act together. Using a critique of both “pre-feminist” and feminist approaches, The GOG—as the book is commonly called—seeks to bring to light a set of ideas and practices in which many collective activities consist in unmaking relations, in disassembling them, thereby revealing their hidden significations and causing that which was invisible to rise to the surface. These symbolic processes of representation are implemented during sequences of events, most often ritualized, an analysis of which makes it possible to apprehend the Melanesian way of being related to each other (“sociality”).

人与物是这些过程的核心。“个体人格”的概念源自麦金·马里奥特，强调了影响和构成人的多种因素。玛丽莲·斯特拉森指出，人格是各种关系的缩影，其生命始于他人行为的产物。因此，儿童被称为“完整的”或“跨性别的”，因为他们源于父系和母系物质的混合。由于这种完整性，他们无法生育。在象征性地分离或提取自身的一部分（例如通过放血仪式）之后，儿童随后成为“不完整的”、“同性”或“单性”的人。只有到那时，他们才有能力生育，并且更普遍地说，成为行动者。根据斯特拉森的模型，一个人的生命因此被认为是交替变化的内部状态，这些状态将关系状态展现出来。虽然斯特拉森没有对此进行定义，但关键词是“关系”，这是美拉尼西亚社会树立为一种价值观的概念，即“社会赖以运作的事物”。

People and objects are at the heart of these processes. The notion of “dividual person,” taken from McKim Marriott, emphasizes the diverse influences bearing on and constituting persons. The person, Marilyn Strathern notes, is a microcosm of relations who begins life as the product of others’ actions. Children are thus said to be “complete” or “cross-sex” because they issue from the mixing of paternal and maternal substances. Because of this completeness, they are incapable of reproduction. A child subsequently becomes an “incomplete,” “same-sex,” or “single-sex” person after a symbolic detachment or extraction of a part of themselves (through a rite involving bloodletting, for example). It is only then that they are capable of reproduction and, more generally, of being an agent. According to Strathern’s model, a person’s life is thus conceived as alternating variable internal states that bring relational states to light. For, though not defined by Strathern, the key word is “relation,” a concept that Melanesian society erects as a value, that is, “with which it works.”

《礼物的性别》充满思想，给人的印象是它反映了作者试图理解的美拉尼西亚民族志材料：它从未被彻底理解，人们必须重新审视它才能发现隐藏的层面，那些初读时无法触及的层面。阿尔弗雷德·盖尔在一篇被幽默地命名为《斯特拉瑟恩图谱》（1999）的论文中绘制了图表和图画，为读者提供了极大的帮助，这些图表和图画描绘了斯特拉瑟恩关于“可分割的人”、家猪所处关系，以及人与人之间关系的“中介”或“非中介”性质（取决于是否有物体在他们之间流通）的假设。

The Gender of the Gift is brimming with ideas, giving the impression that it mirrors the Melanesian ethnographic material the author is seeking to make sense of: It is never understood once and for all, and one has to revisit it to discover hidden levels, those which were inaccessible on first reading. Alfred Gell did the readers a great service by producing diagrams and drawings in a paper humorously called “Strathernograms” (1999), depicting Strathern’s hypotheses on the “partible person,” on the relations in which a domestic pig is embedded, or on the “mediated” or “unmediated” nature of the relations between human beings, depending on whether or not an object circulates between them.

盖尔也曾调侃地将玛丽莲·斯特拉森在《天赋性别》（GOG）中构建的一套观念描述为“M系统”，其中M代表美拉尼西亚，或者更倾向于用玛丽莲。他或许是想以此暗示一种模糊性：这个“M系统”究竟是玛丽莲·斯特拉森所分析的民族志描述中各个族群的思维模式，还是一个用来平滑差异的共同点，从未在任何地方真正体现？无论如何，《天赋性别》为美拉尼西亚及其他地区的人类学家提供了丰富的思考素材，并在性别研究领域留下了永久的印记。

It is also Gell who mischievously described the set of ideas built by Marilyn Strathern in The GOG as the “system M,” with M standing for Melanesia or Marilyn as one preferred. He probably thus wished to signal an ambiguity: Was the “system M” the mode of thinking of each of the populations whose ethnographic descriptions are analyzed by Marilyn Strathern, or was it a common denominator smoothing over variability and never genuinely represented anywhere? Be that as it may, The Gender of the Gift has provided plentiful food for thought for anthropologists of Melanesia and further afield, and it has made a permanent mark on gender research.

帕斯卡尔·博纳梅尔

Pascale Bonnemère

玛丽莲·斯特拉森，《礼物的性别：美拉尼西亚的女性问题和社会问题》（伯克利：加州大学出版社，1988 年）。

Marilyn Strathern, The Gender of the Gift: Problems with Women and Problems with Society in Melanesia (Berkeley: University of California Press, 1988).

1989

1989

灵长类动物视野：哈拉维在灵长类动物学中发现激进抗议的工具

Primate Visions: Haraway Finds in Primatology Tools for Radical Protest

正当法国以盛大的出版业和共和主义的盛况庆祝法国大革命两百周年之际，唐娜·哈拉维（生于1944年）出版了她的第一部重要著作《灵长类动物视野》（Primate Visions），这是一部500页的八开本插图著作。这部全面的综述既提供了灵长类动物知识史，也提供了西方发明的政治史。唐娜·哈拉维借用了福柯（后者曾借用克劳塞维茨的思想）的观点，指出“灵长类动物学是另一种意义上的政治”。关于灵长类动物的知识被解读为一个复杂的科学构想，“它包含了自我与他者、文化与自然、人类与动物，以及被定义为目的与资源、行动者与行动对象的东西”。

While France was celebrating with great publishing and republican pomp the bicentenary of the French Revolution, Donna Haraway (born 1944) published her first major work, Primate Visions, a 500-page illustrated octavo. This comprehensive survey provides both a history of knowledge about primates and a political history of the invention of the West. Repurposing Foucault, who had repurposed Clausewitz, Donna Haraway states that “primatology is politics by other means.” Knowledge about primates is interpreted as a complex scientific construct “of self and other, culture and nature, human and animal, of what is defined as purpose and resource, actor and acted upon.”

灵长类动物学的知识在此体现为诸多创造西方和人类的行为。启蒙运动时期知识的“人”（而非人类），工具理性的普遍男性，作为政治主体的人，工业时代的白人，殖民者，自然攫取者。哈拉维的事业是一部不受束缚的谱系学。因为她的目标恰恰在于质疑现代性在科学与非科学、文化与自然、男人与女人、人类与动物、西方人与殖民者之间所建立的界限。

Knowledge in primatology here transpires as so many deeds to produce the West and man. The Enlightenment “man” (not mankind) of knowledge, the universal male of instrumental reason, man as political subject, the white man of the industrial period, man the colonizer, man the grabber of nature. Haraway’s enterprise is a genealogy unbound. For her object is precisely to question the boundaries modernity erects between science and nonscience, culture and nature, man and woman, human and animal, Westerner and colonized.

灵长类动物，作为探究的对象，正处于这些伟大手法被铭刻的征兆之地。它们如同一面镜子，映照着“我们”（理性的白人现代人，因此排除了女性作者的可能性）如何书写“我们”关于世界生产与改造、关于人类的伟大科学、政治和种族叙事。统治和排斥“他者”。作为一名科学史学家和科学人类学家，一名关注黑人女权主义强大声音的女权主义理论家，哈拉维质疑这个“我们”的白人性和男性气质，而这个“我们”的中立性在两百周年的法国从未受到质疑——在那个法国，对共和模式的普遍性或知识生产的情境性质的探究遭到了粗暴的打压，并且对所有外国入侵以及各种“研究”中体现的任何反思性批评都采取了关闭状态。

Primates, the objects of inquiry, are situated at the symptomatic place where these great devices are inscribed. They are the mirror of how “we” (white rational modern man, hence excluding the possibility of a female author) have gone about writing “our” great scientific, political, and racial narratives of the production and transformation of the world, of the domination and exclusion of “others.” As a historian and anthropologist of science, a feminist theoretician attuned to the powerful voices of Black feminism, Haraway questions the whiteness and masculinity of this “we” whose neutrality went unquestioned in bicentenary France—a France where inquiring into the universality of the republican model or the situated nature of the production of knowledge was violently slapped down and which was closed to all foreign incursions, to any of the reflexive critique embodied in the various “studies.”

《灵长类动物的视角》带领我们穿越许多地方，体验各种研究灵长类动物、人类起源、进化史，或从动物本身理解人类的尝试；恒河猴——人类血液分类系统的名称由此而来——长期以来一直被用作科学实验室的实验材料。读者由此穿梭于一个精心重构的世界，从博物馆到实验室，再到动物园，最终进入太空（第一批类人猿被送往太空），然后“进入天堂”，第一批女性灵长类动物行为学家（例如珍·古道尔）被置于聚光灯下，如同伊甸园中侍立在大自然床边的贞女。

Primate Visions transports us to many places and many attempts to study primates, man’s origin, the history of evolution, or to understand man on the basis of the animal; the rhesus monkey that gives its name to the system for classifying human blood has long been used as material for experiments in science laboratories. The reader thus moves through a patiently reconstructed world, from the museum to the laboratory, to the zoo, up into space (with the first apes sent there), then “to paradise” when the first female primate ethologists (such as Jane Goodall) were placed in the spotlight, like vestal virgins at nature’s bedside in the garden of Eden.

这本书的范围很广：纽约自然历史博物馆透视模型中展示的大猩猩（被猎杀、归化，并被“自然地”安排成一个美国核心家庭）；哈利·哈洛在其行为心理学实验室中折磨的猕猴宝宝（它的遭遇激发了关于如何帮助 20 世纪 50 年代美国的单亲家庭（主要是黑人家庭）的社会心理定势）；聪明的哈姆（第一只机器人黑猩猩，其缩写“霍洛曼航空航天医疗中心”由科学界命名）被送入太空，探索西方文明在科技饱和下的异位未来；热带环境为探索和等级划分（人类和动物）物种提供的无数花园，灵长类动物的自然生存环境，以及被西方定义为“第三世界”的资源世界。故事可能会发生变化，但所有故事都是科学与社会密不可分的纠结。

The book casts its net wide: the gorillas presented in the diorama at the New York Museum of Natural History (hunted, naturalized, and staged “naturally” as an American nuclear family); the baby macaque tortured by Harry Harlow in his behavioral psychology laboratory (and whose suffering fueled psychosocial doxa about how to assist single-parent, mainly Black families in 1950s America); the wise Ham (the first cyborg chimpanzee whose acronym, bestowed by science, came from the “Holloman Aerospace Medical Center”) who was sent into space to explore the allotopic future of a Western civilization saturated in technology; the countless gardens provided by tropical milieus for exploring and hierarchizing (human and animal) species, the natural living environment for primates, and the resource-world defined by the West as “third world.” The stories might change but all are an inextricable tangle of science and society.

这部著作既是经验性的，又是理论性的，无与伦比，也无法复制，但它点燃了人们对启蒙运动的热情，认为启蒙运动是社会科学辛勤工作的实证主义工坊；它也点燃了“硬”科学及其诠释者的热情。几十年来，人们一直在宣扬纯粹性，哈拉维是一位对科学的内在逻辑推崇备至的人，她对被认为是“外在”的东西（社会结构、文化和社会环境、统治和权力关系）一无所知。她对构成灵长类动物学的科学以及灵长类动物学如何受到这些世界塑造和制约提出了一种激进的、严厉的、学术性的解读。继她引起全球反响的早期著作《赛博格宣言》（1984 年）之后， 《灵长类动物愿景》使哈拉维成为科学社会研究、文化研究和女性主义科学批判的主要声音之一（继伊芙琳·福克斯·凯勒、桑德拉·哈丁和卡罗琳·麦钱特之后）。该领域的先驱生物学家安妮·福斯托-斯特林称赞它是一部定义科学史写作“新标准”的重要著作，她认为这部著作“很难超越”。

The work is empirical and theoretical, unparalleled and non-reproducible, but it lit a fuse under the perception of the Enlightenment as a hardworking positivist workshop for the social sciences; it also lit a fuse under the “hard” sciences and their exegetes. Against decades of rhetoric asserting the purity of science, whose internal logic was exulted in all ignorance of what was deemed to be “external” (social structures, cultural and social environments, relationships of domination and power), Haraway proposed a radical, excoriating, and learned reading of the sciences forming primatology and of how primatology was shaped and conditioned by these worlds. Coming after her earlier work, A Cyborg Manifesto (1984), which resonated worldwide, Primate Visions established Haraway as one of the major voices in social studies of science, cultural studies, and feminist critique of the sciences (in the wake of Evelyn Fox Keller, Sandra Harding, and Carolyn Merchant). The biologist Anne Fausto-Sterling, a pioneer in the field, hailed it as a major work defining “new standards” for writing the history of science that she felt “difficult to surpass.”

《灵长类动物的视野》是哈拉维作品中不断重写的关键之作之一，与布鲁诺·拉图尔、伊莎贝尔·斯滕格斯和文西安·德普雷特进行了批判性对话。哈拉维的作品汲取了其弟子、活动家和艺术家们的创作灵感，他们有时以新的方式运用她的作品，其创作动力源于与动物世界的关系，这成为了她的主要探究对象之一：她不仅考察人类作为一种生物社会状态的状况，也考察我们“物种关系”的“本质”，以及我们可能针对与我们共同进化、改变着我们自身和环境的环境采取何种类型的政策。

Primate Visions is one of the high points in an oeuvre being constantly rewritten, in critical dialogue with Bruno Latour, Isabelle Stengers, and Vinciane Despret. Haraway’s oeuvre, drawing on the work of disciples, activists, and artists who at times use her works in new ways, is driven by the relation to the animal world, which became one of her main objects of inquiry: examining the human condition as a biosocial condition but also the “nature” of our “species relations” and the type of policies we may adopt toward environments within which we co-evolve, transforming both them and us.

《灵长类动物的视野》是一项浩大的工程，它跨越了认知和政治的界限，进行着偷猎和窃取。它也是一个令人叹为观止的研讨会，探讨历史的书写和当下的可能性。1989年，在马克思主义的末期，唐娜·哈拉维勾勒出权力与知识的新版图。福斯托-斯特林承认，读了这本书后，她失去了“纯真”，她问道：“历史学家今后是会保持清醒的头脑，还是会继续生活在无知之中？”

Primate Visions is a vast undertaking, poaching and filching across epistemic and political boundaries. It is also an amazing workshop for writing history and narrating possibilities for the present. In 1989, in the dying days of Marxism, Donna Haraway sketched out new maps of power and knowledge. Fausto-Sterling, who acknowledges that she lost her “innocence” on reading this book, asks whether “historians will henceforth work open-eyed, or else continue to live in ignorance?”

德尔菲娜·加迪

Delphine Gardey

唐娜·J·哈拉维，《灵长类动物的视野：现代科学世界中的性别、种族和自然》（纽约：劳特利奇，1989 年）。

Donna J. Haraway, Primate Visions: Gender, Race, and Nature in the World of Modern Science (New York: Routledge, 1989).

1990

1990

性别麻烦：巴特勒制造性别麻烦

Gender Trouble: Butler Sows Trouble in Gender

我们习惯于将（两种）“性别”之间的差异视为生物学普遍性，而社会科学则引入了“性别”的概念来思考文化的多样性。在不同社会中，女性和男性的角色各不相同，甚至颠倒。玛格丽特·米德明确指出，如果某些文化的性别分工与我们所谓的“自然”模式不符，那是因为生物学与社会角色的定义无关。同样，存在两种以上“性别”的社会，其中一种性别不一定被归类为“女性”或“男性”，这强化了这样一种观点：性别是一个与生物学规律无关的社会类别。在心理学领域，罗伯特·斯托勒的研究和约翰·莫尼对新生儿进行的性别重置手术不仅表明，从给定的生物学基础中，人们可以同样完美地塑造出社会男性和女性，而且“性别”甚至可以通过塑造个体的解剖结构强加于个体。由此，“性别”最终从“性”中解放出来。

Where we have been accustomed to thinking of the difference between the (two) “sexes” as a biological universal, the social sciences introduced the idea of “gender” to think about cultural variability. From one society to the next, the role of women and of men differ or are even inverted. With Margaret Mead, it became clear that if there are cultures where the sexual division of labor does not correspond to the models we deemed “natural,” it is because biology has nothing to do with the definition of social roles. Equally, the existence of societies where there are more than two “genders,” where one is not necessarily classified as a “woman” or a “man,” reinforces the idea that gender is a social category that is indifferent to the lessons of biology. In psychology too, research by Robert Stoller and sex reassignment operations on newborns by John Money not only showed that one could equally well produce a social man as a social woman from a given biological substrate but also that “gender” was imposed on individuals by formatting their very anatomy even. Thus “gender” was definitively emancipated from “sex.”

朱迪斯·巴特勒（生于1956年）于1990年出版了《性别麻烦》（Gender Trouble ） ，副标题为《女性主义与身份的颠覆》（Feminism and the Subversion of Identity），她重新洗牌了性别/性别二分法。“性别”的概念脱离了生物学范畴，进入了女性主义领域，与性别一样，也是一种文化建构。“性别”远非构成“性别”差异被嫁接于其上的建构基础，“或许它本身就本身就是性别，结果，性别与性别之间的区别最终变得毫无区别。” 因此，她确立了性别的首要地位，这变成了“这种对‘性’的建构是彻底的非建构”，而后者只是在随后出现。

When Judith Butler (born 1956) published Gender Trouble in 1990, with the subtitle Feminism and the Subversion of Identity, she reshuffled the cards in the sex/gender dichotomy. The concept of “sex” left the biological terrain and entered the feminist sphere, being just as much a cultural construct as gender. Far from “sex” forming the architectonic ground onto which “gender” differences were then grafted, “perhaps it was always already gender, with the consequence that the distinction between sex and gender turns out to be no distinction at all.” She thus posits the primacy of gender, which becomes “this construction of ‘sex’ as the radically unconstructed,” with the latter only emerging subsequently.

巴特勒借用语言哲学家约翰·L·奥斯汀的“表演”概念，认为个体通过其行为被“性别化”。但某些戏仿表演“确实制造了麻烦”，而另一些最终被驯化并“作为文化统治的工具”流传。这种“性别表演”为酷儿思想和实践铺平了道路。《性别麻烦》由此理论化了主体对规范的颠覆和解构。但这难道不是幻觉吗？

Borrowing the concept of performance from the philosopher of language John L. Austin, Butler argues that individuals become “gendered” through what they do. But certain parodic performances “really sow trouble,” where others end up being domesticated and circulating “as instruments of cultural domination.” This “gender performance” paves the way to queer thought and practices. Gender Trouble thus theorizes the subversion and deconstruction of norms by the subject. But is this not an illusion?

《性别麻烦》因其在精神分析领域的定位而引人注目，尤其是通过对琼·里维埃“化装舞会”概念的探讨，巴特勒还对文化可理解性的性别规范进行了尖锐的批判：这些规范“建立并维持了生理性别、性别、性实践和欲望之间的连贯性和连续性关系”。将一个人分配到某种“性别”会带来一种性别认同，这种认同与渴望异性或生理性别成员的义务相关——巴特勒称之为“异性恋矩阵”。这种异性恋的指令使得某些认同成为可能，同时排除或否认其他认同。迄今为止，巴特勒并没有主张个人关于性别的自由，而是认为它是一个限制性的系统：性别是确立存在两种性别这一事实的根源。

While Gender Trouble stands out for being positioned within the field of psychoanalysis, particularly through its discussion of Joan Riviere’s concept of “masquerade,” Butler additionally conducts a biting critique of the gendered norms of cultural intelligibility: those which “institute and maintain relations of coherence and continuity among sex, gender, sexual practice, and desire.” Assigning an individual to a “sex” brings with it a gender identity linked to an obligation to desire a member of the opposite gender and sex—what Butler calls the “heterosexual matrix.” This heterosexual imperative makes certain identifications possible while excluding or disavowing others. Thus far, from asserting the individual’s freedom concerning their gender, Butler thinks of it as a restrictive system: gender is what institutes the fact that there are two sexes.

因此，性别被定义为持续的“身体风格化”，使身体成为重复的产物。更广泛地说，身体，尤其是其“性”，成为一个尤为密集的权力场域。追随米歇尔·福柯的思路，巴特勒将“性别的规训生产”视为一系列规制性、话语性和身体性的实践，这些实践生产出一种“重要的肉体性”，一种“可行的”身份。我们的性身份、性别和性欲并非“被选择”，而是由不同的吸收和内化过程所生产，而这些过程大多隐藏于视野之外。

Gender is thus defined as the sustained “stylization of the body,” making the body a product of repetition. More generally, the body, and particularly its “sex,” becomes a particularly dense site of power. In the wake of Michel Foucault, Butler thinks through the “disciplinary production of gender” as a set of regulatory, discursive, and physical practices producing a “significant corporeality,” a “viable” identity. Our sexual identities, gender, and sexuality are not “chosen” but produced by different processes of incorporation and interiorization, which are mainly hidden from view.

《性别麻烦》引发了诸多批评，其中一些源于误读。巴特勒认为身体是由政治力量塑造的，而政治力量的利益在于让身体继续由“性别标记”构成。有人反对这种观点，认为物质性并非权力的产物。因此，身体的概念被列入了针对后结构主义思潮与德里达的解构主义：据说，在巴特勒的世界里，一切都是“文本”，一切都是“建构”和“语言游戏”。这种反响在法国尤为强烈，辛西娅·克劳斯的译本直到2005年才出版，比原著晚了15年，而当时“社会建构”的概念正成为激烈争论的话题。

Gender Trouble attracted much criticism, some based on misreading. Against Butler’s idea of the body as fashioned by political forces, in whose interest it is that the body continue be constituted by “sex markers,” it has been argued that materiality is not the effect of power. The idea of the body has thus been included on the charge sheet brought against the post-structuralist current and Derridean deconstruction: In Butler’s world, it is said, all is “text,” all is “construction” and “language games.” This reception was even more accentuated in France, where Cynthia Kraus’s translation was only published in 2005, fifteen years after the original, at a time when the notion of “social construct” had become a topic of fierce debate.

巴特勒以《重要的身体：论“性”的话语限度》 （1993）回应了这些批评。但从标题开始，“性”一词再次只出现在引号中。对巴特勒而言，思考身体这一问题必然会引出其他领域，因此物质性只能通过物化的政治过程来探讨。性这一范畴是规范性的：它构成了一种“生产其所治理的身体的监管实践”，或者用福柯的话来说，是一种“监管理想”。巴特勒认为主体与权力“最初共谋”，这意味着成为主体必然是一种主体化。只有援引权力，“我”才能获得存在并在其中持久立足。这种思考服从或成为主体、吸收权力以便更好地颠覆权力的方式是有争议的，特别是从精神分析的角度来看，它要求我们将主体从服从/主体化的二分法中移除。

Butler responded to these criticisms with Bodies That Matter: On the Discursive Limits of “Sex” (1993). But once again, from the title onward, the word “sex” only ever appears in scare quotes. For Butler, thinking the matter of bodies necessarily leads to other domains, so that materiality is approached solely through the political processes of materialization. The category of sex is normative: It constitutes a “regulatory practice which produces the body it governs,” or a “regulatory ideal” in Foucault’s meaning of the term. Butler attributes the subject with “originary complicity with power,” which means that becoming a subject is necessarily a subjectivation. It is always by citing power that the I may accede to existence and take a lasting hold there. This way of thinking about subjection or becoming a subject, absorbing power the better to subvert it, is debatable, particularly from a psychoanalytic point of view that invites us to remove the subject from the subjection/subjectivation dichotomy.

《性别麻烦》精彩地展现了接纳非话语性性别的不可能性，表明所有关于性的话语都传达着权力关系。然而，将主体封闭在一个毫无外在性的世界里，对于理解抵抗的兴起以及规划改造世界的道路而言，似乎是一种值得商榷的方式。

Gender Trouble is a brilliant demonstration of the impossibility of acceding to nondiscursive sex, showing that all discourse about sex conveys power relations. But enclosing the subject in a world without any externality seems a questionable way of conceiving the emergence of resistance and of plotting the path toward transforming the world.

蒂埃里·奥凯

Thierry Hoquet

朱迪斯·巴特勒，《性别麻烦：女权主义与身份的颠覆》（纽约：劳特利奇，1990 年）。

Judith Butler, Gender Trouble: Feminism and the Subversion of Identity (New York: Routledge, 1990).

1990

1990

爪哇的十字路口：伦巴第重新洗牌全球历史

Le carrefour javanais: Lombard Reshuffles the Cards of Global History

《爪哇十字路口：迈向全球史》（ Le carrefour javanais: Essai d'histoire globale）因其文献资料的广度、空间和时间尺度以及论证的严谨性而引人注目。尽管丹尼斯·伦巴德（Denys Lombard，1938-1998）的这部巨作聚焦于15世纪末至20世纪上半叶，伦巴德也毫不避讳地提及史前研究的最新进展，并探讨当代热点问题。此外，本书探讨的爪哇绝不限于同名岛屿的海岸，因为它如同一个汇流盆地，汇聚了来自遥远源头的各种“影响”，无论是印度、中国、伊斯兰还是欧洲，所有这些影响都在古老的当地“基质”上扎根发芽，杂糅生长。

Le carrefour javanais: Essai d’histoire globale (The Javanese crossroads: Toward a global history) stands out for the extent of its documentary material, for its spatial and temporal scale, and for its arguments. While this masterwork by Denys Lombard (1938–1998) focuses on the period from the late fifteenth to the first half of the twentieth century, Lombard does not shy away from mentioning the latest developments in prehistoric research or tackling very contemporary issues. Additionally, the Java in question is in no way limited to the coasts of the eponymous island, since it acts as a confluence basin where “influences” converge from distant origins, all of which, be they Indian, Chinese, Islamic, or European, take root and sprout hybrid growths on an archaic local “substrate.”

套用米什莱的话来说，亚洲、中东，尤其是欧洲的世界，不足以解释爪哇。但这本书从一开始就颠覆了人们对重要“影响”之间直观的等级划分。第一卷奠定了基调，不仅列举了“西化”的遗产，也列举了其“局限性”，因为或许与欧洲的接触——1510年代与葡萄牙人的接触，以及随后几十年与荷兰人和英国人的接触——并非决定性事件：无论如何，爪哇长期以来仍然局限于沿海堡垒和工厂的有限领域。爪哇思想的一些基本特征几乎与欧洲毫无关联，例如时间和空间的范畴，这些范畴是在伟大的印度教-佛教帝国时期从印度传承下来的；又例如，反思性的“自我”这一概念，即一种与上帝神秘契合的避难所，源于“伊斯兰刺激”的洗礼。在苏丹国时代，群岛上遍布着这种宝石。虽然欧洲矿脉往往最显眼，但它并不一定是最珍贵的，它像云母一样闪闪发光，让人产生误解。

To paraphrase Michelet, the worlds of Asia, the Middle East, and especially Europe are not too much to explain Java. But from the outset, the book subverts the intuitive hierarchy between significant “influences.” The first volume sets the tone in providing an inventory not only of the legacies but also the “limits” of “Westernization,” for perhaps the encounter with Europe—with the Portuguese as of the 1510s, then the Dutch and British in the following decades—was not the determining event: In any case, Java long remained confined to the limited arenas of coastal forts and factories. Some of the basic features of Javanese thought owe next to nothing to Europe, such as the categories of time and space, carried over from India at the time of the great Hindu-Buddhist empires, or the idea of a reflexive “self,” a refuge in mystical rapport with God, stemming from the “Islamic stimulus” washing over the archipelago in the age of the sultanates. While the European vein is often the most visible, it is not necessarily the most precious, sparkling misleadingly like mica.

本书的另外两卷分别探讨了更深层次的联系，“亚洲网络”和“同心王国的遗产”，其中后者指的是爪哇的政治秩序，即在森林中开辟出来的国家，其仪式主权根据佛教的曼荼罗模型反复分配。伦巴第无疑是第一批让我们认识到“东南亚地中海”与其区域环境之间关系的作家之一。提到布罗代尔——这对本书的最初成功做出了贡献——并非仅仅是致敬：如果印度尼西亚世界形成了一个“地中海”，那主要是因为它是一系列“小海”，将各个地区与深厚的经济和政治联系连接起来。

The other two volumes of the book examine deeper seams, the “Asian networks” and the “legacy of concentric kingdoms,” respectively, where the latter expression refers to the Javanese political orders, the negara carved out of the forest and whose ritual sovereignty was distributed iteratively in accordance with the Buddhist model of the mandala. Lombard is certainly one of the first authors to make us appreciate how much the “Southeast Asian Mediterranean” owes to its regional environment. The reference to Braudel—which contributed to the book’s initial fortune—is no mere hat-doffing: if the Indonesian world forms a “Mediterranean,” it is primarily because it is a series of “little seas” linking up fractions of territories with deep economic and political ties.

尽管拥有强大的轮船，无论是定居在马来半岛和婆罗洲北部的英国人，还是通过一系列跳跃式扩张控制了几乎整个群岛的荷兰人，都未能完全控制这些海域。在十八和十九世纪，由礁石和滨海采集者组成的“水生社会”完全专注于长途贸易，以及像布吉人这样的航海王国，继续在边境地区和欧洲统治的缝隙中活动。海峡人民为中国市场提供珍珠、玳瑁和海参，构成长途贸易网络中的底层，是这些“亚洲网络”中的第一个环节，欧洲人由于无法控制它们，不得不与之进行斡旋。

Despite their powerful steamers, neither the British, who settled on the Malay Peninsula and in northern Borneo, nor the Dutch, who expanded their hold over virtually all the archipelago in a series of jumps, managed to exert full mastery over these maritime spaces. In the eighteenth and nineteenth centuries, “aquatic societies” of reef and foreshore gatherers entirely concentrating on long-distance trade and seafaring kingdoms, like that of the Bugis, continued to operate along the borderlands and in the interstices of European domination. The peoples of the Straits provided pearls, tortoiseshell, and sea cucumbers (trepang) for the Chinese market, forming the subaltern segment in long-distance trade networks, the first link in these “Asian networks” with which Europeans, being unable to control them, had to broker arrangements.

如果说有一场影响深远的“西方化”，那它就是由“伊斯兰化”引发的。印尼世界的伊斯兰化进程断断续续，虽然其确切时间仍有争议，但保守估计始于14世纪中叶。根据伦巴第的说法，这标志着一种特定现代性的到来。每年有几个月，信风沿途的苏丹国都成了季风旅客的家园，也门、古吉拉特和中国商人在这里装载着香料、稀有树脂和……海产品，然后耐心等待风向转变。因此，这些政治单位必然是基于商业交易的契约社会，并受到无数担保的约束，就像马六甲法律（约 1450-1470 年）一样。伦巴第开创性地提出，这种契约关系模式承认签署方在法律上平等，即使不是法律上的平等，也不仅限于商业交易领域。因此，1603 年以阿拉伯语和波斯语“王子之镜”为蓝本的《泰姬陵萨拉廷》提出了一种具体的契约主义版本的拉贾和他的人民（rakyat）之间的关系，他们受一系列相互义务的约束，尊重这些义务可以防止政权垮台和异议（fitnah）。伦巴第的分析将伊斯兰教视为文学、政治和哲学现代性的源泉，而不是压垮个人良知和公共自由的铅毯，这一分析仍然具有现实意义。

If there was a “Westernization” with powerful repercussions, it was brought about by “Islamization.” The Islamization of the Indonesian world progressed in fits and starts, and while its exact chronology remains open to debate, a conservative estimate places its beginnings in the mid-fourteenth century. According to Lombard, this marked the arrival of a specific modernity. For several months each year, the sultanates lying along the course of ships following the trade winds were home to monsoon passengers, Yemeni, Gujarati, and Chinese merchants loading cargoes of spices, rare resins, and sea produce, then patiently waiting for the winds to turn. These political units were thus, by necessity, contract societies based on commercial transactions surrounded by myriad guarantees, as under the Malacca laws (circa 1450–1470). Lombard makes the pioneering suggestion that this model of contractual relation, which recognizes equality in law if not legal equality between the signatories, was not limited to the domain of merchant transactions. Thus, the Taj us-Salatin, composed in 1603, modeled on Arabic and Persian “princes’ mirrors,” proposes a specifically contractualist version of relations between the raja and his people (rakyat), bound by a set of reciprocal obligations, respecting which prevents toppling into tyranny and dissent (fitnah). Lombard’s analyses, presenting Islam as the source of literary, political, and philosophical modernity, not as a lead blanket weighing down on individual consciences and public freedoms, are as topical as ever.

那么，这幅印度尼西亚世界的璀璨壁画，是否是一篇“全球史论文”？答案是肯定的，前提是它并非英美式的全球史，那种用大写字母来填充其广阔的社会沙漠，时代错乱的全球史，而是年鉴学派所钟爱的“整体史”。本书的分析摒弃了任何目的论，从一个因果关系的次序过渡到另一个因果关系的次序，涵盖了文学事件的“短暂时间”、经济形势的“周期性时间”，以及文学概念和经典的演变。《爪哇的十字路口》是一部关于接触带的合唱编年史，它细致地捕捉了每个历史性层面的动态。因此，它可以被视为“连通史”的先驱。

So, is this dazzling fresco of the Indonesian world an “essay in global history”? Yes, provided the pattern is not British- or American-style global history, which anachronistically peoples its vast social deserts with capitalized entities, but rather the “total history” dear to the Annales school. Shunning any teleology, the analysis passes from one order of causality to another, embracing the “short time” of literary events and the “cyclical time” of economic conjunctures and of transformations to literary concepts and canons. Le carrefour javanais is a choral chronicle of a contact zone, carefully catching in full each horizon of historicity in play. It may thus be deemed a precursor to “connected history.”

罗曼·伯特兰

Romain Bertrand

Denys Lombard，《爪哇家乐：全球史论》，第 1 卷，《西方化的限制》，第 2 卷，《亚洲人》，第 3 卷，《L'héritage des royaumes concentriques》（巴黎：Éditions de l'EHESS，1990 年）。

Denys Lombard, Le carrefour javanais: Essai d’histoire globale, tome 1, Les limites de l’occidentalisation, tome 2, Les réseaux asiatiques, tome 3, L’héritage des royaumes concentriques (Paris: Éditions de l’EHESS, 1990).

1991

1991

中间立场:理查德·怀特与跨文化适应

The Middle Ground: Richard White and Intercultural Accommodations

理查德·怀特 (1947 年生) 的第四本书是在他担任华盛顿大学 (西雅图) 教授期间出版的。1991 年，这位多产的作家出版了美国西部概览（“这是你的不幸，与我无关”：美国西部新史）以及中间地带，这是一部更具雄心的作品，开辟了一种理解欧洲人与美洲印第安人接触史的新方法。这本 500 多页的厚书是一个杰作。中间地带的概念，即文化融合和达成协议的中介理解场所，很快成为历史学术研究的重要参考。它使早期但持久的分析框架过时：边疆框架，即将殖民地与“处女地”分开的界线，根据弗雷德里克·杰克逊·特纳 (1893) 的说法，这些“处女地”是美国民主独特特征的熔炉。

The fourth book by Richard White (born 1947) came out when he was a professor at the University of Washington (Seattle). In 1991, this prolific author published an overview of the American West (“It’s Your Misfortune and None of My Own”: A New History of the American West) as well as The Middle Ground, a more ambitious work that invented a new way of apprehending the history of contact between Europeans and Amerindians. This dense book of over 500 pages is a masterstroke. The concept of the middle ground, an intermediary place of understanding where cultures mingle and create agreements, soon became a key reference in historical scholarship. It rendered obsolete the earlier yet persistent framework of analysis: that of the frontier, the line separating colonized zones from “virgin” lands, which according to Frederick Jackson Turner (1893) had acted as the melting pot for the singular characteristics of American democracy.

《中间立场》一出版便赢得了北美史学家的赞誉，并斩获诸多奖项。它确立了怀特作为美国杰出史学家之一的地位，并由此推动了美洲印第安人历史的规范化。然而，怀特并非第一个批评特纳论点的人，他的论点被认为过于民族中心主义和目的论化。他1991年出版的两本书实际上源自当时史学界非常活跃的三股思潮：新印第安史，兴起于20世纪60年代末的美国校园，旨在让美洲印第安人成为自身历史的行动者，并赋予他们“发言权”；环境史，从生态变化的角度审视印第安人的历史；以及新西方史，它采用了更怀特站在这三种思潮的交汇处，拒绝对征服、同化和反抗的“简单化”叙述，力图为美国历史提供“更复杂、更少线性”的故事。

On its publication, The Middle Ground won plaudits from North American historians, along with many prizes. It established White as one of the leading American historians and thereby helped normalize Amerindian history. Yet White was not the first to slate Turner’s thesis, which was judged too ethnocentric and teleological. His two 1991 books in fact flowed from three currents in historical scholarship that were very active at the time: new Indian history, which emerged on American campuses in the late 1960s, seeking to make Amerindians the actors of their history and to give them a “voice”; environmental history, examining the history of Indians from the angle of ecological change; and new western history, which adopted a more inclusive approach to the history of the American West and sought to break with the habitual narrative of the white man’s triumph in the “wilderness.” Lying at the confluence of these three currents and rejecting “simplistic” accounts of conquest, assimilation, and resistance, White sought to provide American history with “more complex and less linear” stories.

本书的萌芽源于一次堪称“布罗代尔式”的转变。它最初旨在围绕一位杰出人物——特库姆塞——展开。特库姆塞是肖尼族的酋长，也是十九世纪初印第安“抵抗”运动的传统英雄。但随着写作的推进，这位人物失去了中心地位，转而探索一片土地——五大湖地区，十七世纪法国殖民者将其命名为“上奥特地区”（Pays d'en Haut）。如同布罗代尔《地中海》 （La Méditerranée）中的腓力二世一样，特库姆塞最终只是在本书的结尾才被研究，因为他体现了构成中间地带的跨文化融合过程的垂死挣扎。因此，怀特的叙述遵循着一条循环路径：中间地带于十七世纪中叶在上奥特地区兴起，该地区对印第安人来说具有政治重要性，然后在1815年左右随着该地区的消失而消亡。

The germ of the book came from a transformation that may be described as “Braudelian.” It was initially meant to be built around an illustrious figure, Tecumseh, a Shawnee chief and traditional hero of Indian “resistance” in the early nineteenth century. But as the writing advanced, this figure lost his central place in favor of an exploration of a territory, the Great Lakes region, named the Pays d’en Haut by French settlers in the seventeenth century. Like Philip II in Braudel’s La Méditerranée (The Mediterranean), Tecumseh was finally only studied at the end of the book, as embodying the death throes of the process of intercultural accommodation comprising the middle ground. White’s account thus follows a circular path: the middle ground sprang up in the Pays d’en Haut in the mid-seventeenth century, in a region of political importance to the Indians, before disappearing around 1815 when the region vanished.

《中间地带》既不是美洲印第安酋长的历史写照，也不是一个“部落”的历史（类似于布鲁斯·G·特里格1976年出版的《阿塔恩特西克的子孙：休伦人史至1660年》）。它也没有分析殖民者对印第安人的政策，也很少关注影响原住民社会的文化变迁。怀特并非试图仅从印第安人的视角来撰写历史：由于缺乏足够的资料，他觉得这样的研究难以进行。通过勾勒出一系列令人惊叹的历史片段，他借鉴了丰富且未被充分利用的殖民资料（其中一些是法语），着手研究美洲印第安人和白人定居者在相互依存的环境中，通过相互调整形成了混合实践的动态过程。怀特认为，这些新的实践是基于双方对对方文化的（有时带有偏见的）理解而拼凑起来的。因此，怀特巧妙地使边疆的概念发生了变化，因为印第安人和白人之间的关系是“新事物”出现的地方。

The Middle Ground is neither a historical portrait of an Amerindian chief nor the history of a “tribe” (along the lines of Bruce G. Trigger’s The Children of Aataentsic: A History of the Huron People to 1660, published in 1976). Nor does it provide analysis of colonial policies toward Indians, and it pays but scant attention to the cultural transformations affecting native societies. White did not seek to write a history solely from the Indians’ viewpoint: Given the lack of adequate sources, such a study struck him as difficult to conduct. By sketching an astonishing series of historical vignettes, drawing on abundant and underexploited colonial sources, some in French, he sets about studying a dynamic process by which the American Indians and the white settlers, placed in a situation of interdependence, forged mixed practices through mutual adjustments. These new practices, White argues, were cobbled together on the basis of the (sometimes biased) understanding each actor had of the other’s culture. White thus subtly subjects the idea of the frontier to metamorphosis, for relations between Indians and whites were the locus where “something new” emerged.

自1991年以来，《中间地带》一书持续影响着欧洲人与“他者”关系史的书写方式。其成功远超北美史领域，这无疑源于怀特在强调跨文化融合可能性的同时，丝毫不避讳对这一相遇的误解。该书出版之际，正值结构主义和文化主义人类学日渐式微。因此，怀特得以整合两位颇具影响力的作家（在其第一章和导言的开篇引用）的建议。他借鉴了埃里克·R·沃尔夫的观点，认为我们需要将所谓的原始社会历史化；也就是说，这些社会远非欧洲殖民者的受害者，它们对现代世界的到来做出了贡献，并且不可能孤立地研究一个社会。怀特与詹姆斯·克利福德一致，批判了那些被文化（或身份）纯粹性和真实性所主导的历史叙述。他试图淡化美洲印第安人的本质，在他看来，他们既不是善良的生态野蛮人，也并非深陷于传统的泥沼。怀特感兴趣的并非文化差异本身，而是文化之间不断涌现并最终促成新规范诞生的妥协。他告诉我们，历史是流动的，始终处于运动之中。欧洲人与美洲印第安人的接触提供了一个教科书式的例证。

Since 1991, The Middle Ground has continually influenced how the history of the relation between Europeans and “others” is written. This success, extending far beyond the field of North American history, is no doubt because White in no way skates over the misunderstandings of the encounter even while he emphasizes the possibility of intercultural accommodations. The book also came out at a time when structuralist and culturalist anthropology was on the wane. White was thus able to consolidate suggestions by two influential authors, quoted at the head of his first chapter and introduction. From Eric R. Wolf, he borrowed the idea that we need to historicize so-called primitive societies; that is, these societies, far from being just the victims of the European colonizers, contributed to the advent of the modern world, and it is impossible to study a society by considering it in isolation. And in unison with James Clifford, White denounces historical accounts dominated by an obsession with the purity and authenticity of cultures (or identities). He seeks to de-essentialize the American Indians, whom he sees neither as good ecological savages nor bogged down in tradition. What interests White is not cultural difference itself but the compromises that spring up between cultures and lead to the invention of new norms. He tells us that history is fluidity and always in movement. The contact between Europeans and Amerindians provides a textbook illustration.

吉尔斯·哈佛

Gilles Havard

理查德·怀特（Richard White），《中间地带：1650-1815 年大湖地区的印第安人、帝国和共和国》（剑桥：剑桥大学出版社，1991 年）。

Richard White, The Middle Ground: Indians, Empires, and Republics in the Great Lakes Region, 1650–1815 (Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 1991).

1992

1992

身份与控制:哈里森·怀特与新兴社会形态

Identity and Control: Harrison White and Emerging Social Formations

20世纪50年代，英国人类学家（尤其是约翰·巴恩斯和伊丽莎白·博特）研究了某些类型的关系，这些关系通过人与人或群体之间的互动而产生，其特点是跨越了既定群体之间的界限。为了理解此类关系所形成的结构，他们提出了“社会网络”的概念。这为持续发展的研究思潮奠定了基础，如今被称为“社会网络分析”。其主要思想源自人类学，同时也借鉴了格奥尔格·齐美尔的社会学、雅各布·莫雷诺的社会心理学以及数学图论等多种来源。

In the 1950s, British anthropologists (particularly John Barnes and Elizabeth Bott) studied certain types of relations that emerge through interactions between people or groups and are characterized by crossing borders between the instituted groups. To make sense of the structure such relations form, they forged the idea of a “social network.” This laid the groundwork for a research current that has continued to grow, now called “social network analysis.” This draws its main ideas from anthropology, together with such varied sources as Georg Simmel’s sociology, Jacob Moreno’s social psychology, and mathematical graph theory.

其发展很大程度上归功于专攻定量方法的北美社会学家，其中哈里森·怀特（Harrison White，生于1930年）是其主要倡导者。他最初研究理论物理学，后转向社会学。在对亲属关系、艺术市场和职业生涯进行研究并将其视为结构内位置链之后，他将注意力转向了社会网络。他提出了新的方法（尤其是运用结构等价的概念），并教授了一些后来成名的学生（包括马克·格兰诺维特、巴里·韦尔曼和约翰·帕吉特等），以及与他一起复兴经济社会学的学生。此外，他还开创了以网络分析为基础的连贯理论思想，而网络分析最初更像是各种方法的拼凑。《身份与控制》便是其成果。人们期待这部巨作能够在社会科学理论领域确立网络分析地位。

Its expansion owed much to North American sociologists specializing in quantitative methods, with Harrison White (born 1930) being a leading proponent. He had initially studied theoretical physics before turning to sociology. After noted work on kinship, art markets, and professional careers viewed as chains of positions within a structure, he shifted his attention to social networks. He proposed new approaches (particularly using the idea of structural equivalence) and taught students who went on to become famous (including Mark Granovetter, Barry Wellman, and John Padgett, among many others) or with whom he renewed economic sociology. Further still, he initiated coherent theoretical thought grounded in network analyses, which had initially been more of a patchwork of different methods. Identity and Control is the result. The work was expectantly awaited as the great work that would establish network analysis within the landscape of social science theory.

事实上，他的探索远不止于此。与许多网络分析家不同，怀特没有落入将网络视为社会世界其他部分的基础结构的陷阱。因此，他并没有撰写“关系社会学”的宣言（后来其他人也尝试过），而是试图严格梳理出这样一种社会世界观的后果：在这种社会世界中，“没有整齐的原子，也没有明确的世界，只有复杂的条纹和像聚合物粘性物质一样重复的长线”。在这里，社会结构似乎永远在涌现，永远在变化，而网络只是众多形式之一。

It in fact went much further. Unlike many network analysts, White did not fall into the trap of making networks a fundamental structure from which the rest of the social world issued. Thus, he did not write a manifesto of “relational sociology” (something others subsequently tried their hand at) but sought rather to rigorously tease out the consequences of a conception of the social world in which “there is no tidy atom and no clear-cut world, only complex striations and long strings repeating as in a polymer goo.” Social structures are here perceived as if they were forever emerging, forever transforming, with networks only constituting one form, among others.

本书共七章，阐述了主要概念。第一章以身份概念开始，它指代陷入特定情境的人类或事件。从一开始，这一概念就解构并转移了任何关于人或“行动者”的概念。第二章呈现了新兴秩序的形式——“学科”。第三章考察了网络，并将其简化至其阐释维度。身份生成的故事“将阐释交织进关系之中，并围绕关系展开，随着时间的推移，这些关系交织成网络形式”。第四章则转向制度：种姓制度（大学学科与之类似）、裙带关系、法团主义，以及任何具有规范维度的事物。第五章将网络和学科纳入更为普遍的风格概念，风格被视为阐释的部分连贯性来源，而这些阐释尤其可能赋予“人”的概念以意义。第六章则试图理解行动如何在这种相互作用的社会形式熔岩中涌现。最后一章探讨了“修辞学”（广义的规范意义，与机构相关）并探讨了理性的概念，然后回到身份和控制这两个基本概念。

The work has seven chapters setting out the main concepts, starting in the first chapter with that of identity, referring either to humans caught up in certain contexts or else to events. From the outset, this concept deconstructs, deflects any idea of person or “actor.” The second chapter presents the forms of emerging order—“disciplines.” The third examines networks, reduced to their interpretive dimension. Identities generate stories that “weave interpretation into and around relationships, as they then interweave over time into network forms.” The fourth chapter then turns to institutions: caste systems (to which university disciplines are compared), clientelism, corporatism, and additionally, anything with a normative dimension. The fifth chapter folds networks and disciplines into the more general concept of style, seen as a source of partial coherence for interpretations which, inter alia, may give meaning to the idea of a person. The sixth chapter seeks to understand how action may emerge in this magma of interacting social forms. A final chapter looks at “rhetorics” (taken in a broadly normative meaning, associated with institutions) and attacks the idea of rationality, before returning to the two fundamental concepts of identity and control.

文本内容复杂，常常令人不安。它引入了大量怀特特有的语言概念。书中有很多题外话和大量的实证案例。怀特的一些同事建议本书更容易理解，而法国社会学家也提出了翻译的建议，这促使本书进行了集体重写（现在每章都有共同署名），最终出版了第二版，英文版于2008年出版，法文版于2011年出版。副标题是新的（《社会形态如何出现》），章节顺序也进行了重新调整，主题是控制（这（此处似有缺失，原文似有缺失）并非权力，而是在社会物质中寻找立足点，这种社会物质被视为一片混沌，由此衍生出部分秩序形式。关于网络的章节位于关于身份和学科的章节之间。风格现在先于制度。政权的概念，即制度的某种平衡，在其自身的基础上得到了发展，本书以总结这些概念之间联系的总结作为结束。

The text is complex, and often unsettling. It introduces a very large number of concepts in a language specific to White. There are many digressions and a plethora of empirical examples. Suggestions by some of White’s colleagues to make the work more accessible and a proposal by French sociologists for a translation led to a collective rewriting (with each chapter now being cosigned), resulting in a second edition, published in English in 2008 and in French in 2011. The subtitle was new (How Social Formations Emerge), and the chapters were reordered, with the theme of control (which is not power but the search for footings in a social material seen as a chaos whence partial forms of order emerge) now placed earlier. The chapter on networks comes between those on identities and disciplines. Style now precedes institutions. The concept of regime, a certain balance to institutions, is developed in its own right, and the book closes with a summary formalizing the links between the concepts.

有些社会科学书籍最初让读者眼花缭乱，但在随后的重读过程中却会令人失望。但《身份与控制》却恰恰相反：读者每次重读都会发现新的宝藏。安德鲁·阿伯特在 1994 年发表于《社会力量》杂志的评论中解释说，最好的方法是先通读整本书，掌握一个整体思路，避免被较难的段落绊倒，然后在脑海中带着这个整体思路重读最重要的部分，有时还会参考与怀特观点相似的思想家的作品。那些付出努力的读者随后会发现，对阿伯特来说，这是“过去四十年真正重要的书籍之一”，它能够深刻地改变人们对社会世界的看法。

Some books in social sciences initially dazzle their readers but disappoint over the course of subsequent rereadings. But it is the exact opposite with Identity and Control: Readers discover new riches each time they revisit it. Andrew Abbott, in a commentary published in Social Forces in 1994, explained that the best idea was to first read the entire book to get an overall idea, without stumbling over more difficult passages, then reread the most important parts with this overall idea in mind, sometimes drawing on works by thinkers with a similar outlook to White. Readers who make the effort then discover what, for Abbott, is “one of the truly important books of the past forty years,” capable of profoundly transforming how one perceives the social world.

米歇尔·格罗塞蒂

Michel Grossetti

哈里森·C·怀特，《身份与控制：社会行动的结构理论》（新泽西州普林斯顿：普林斯顿大学出版社，1992 年）。

Harrison C. White, Identity and Control: A Structural Theory of Social Action (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 1992).

1993

1993

大数政治：德罗西埃尔探究统计知识的本体论

The Politics of Large Numbers: Desrosières Investigates the Ontology of Statistical Knowledge

阿兰·德罗西埃尔（Alain Desrosières，1940-2013）所著的《大数政治》 （La politique des grands nombres， 1940-2013）无疑是20世纪90年代法国统计学史研究领域中最具影响力的著作，该书曾有两版法语修订版，并在世界各地被译成多种语言。发表该书评论的期刊涵盖了社会学、人口统计学、经济学、哲学、科学史、政治学以及统计学等多个领域的众多顶尖出版物。
