The archipelago’s population and demographic density increased until it was necessary to supplement lagoon aquaculture and irrigated cultivation of taro in the valleys of the western isles by colonizing the eastern isles to grow yams and sweet potatoes on the plains, an activity subject to fluctuating rainfall and the disadvantages of lower marginal labor productivity, thus needing large number of workers as farming became intensified. The growing number of kinship groups encouraged statutory rivalries between the growing number of chiefs, who were exposed to attempts by their younger relatives to usurp them or to acquire autonomy. This led to the extraction of ever larger surpluses, thereby reinforcing the intensification and expansion of food and craft production. These two intrinsically linked processes gave rise to a new situation in the late sixteenth century when the depletion of available land coincided with the exhaustion of the soil and decline in the marginal productivity of labor, particularly in the plains. Native Hawaiians launched wars of territorial conquest against the western isles to expand their tributary bases and be able to draw on the labor and ecological resources they lacked. They then innovated in the fields of religion and matrimony: first, by reserving for their warrior elites the divine privilege of reproducing by incest between brothers and sisters and marrying between aristocratic houses from one island to another; and second, by subverting the religious ideology to serve the warlord’s interests, by building new temples to conduct an annual cycle of itinerant festivities (mahaliki) alternating between the gods of war and of agriculture, by ritualizing the payment of tributes and the opening of hostilities, and by replacing offerings of the first harvest and the domestic worship of ancestors with practices now centered on animals and plants.

如果这个波利尼西亚案例证实了国家不需要城市化、冶金术和书写就能崛起，那么它有力地表明，君主对破坏、（再）生产和通讯技术的垄断控制伴随着他的神化以及通过乱伦和活人祭祀所创造的政治实体的本质。

If this Polynesian case confirms that there is no need for urbanization, metallurgy, and writing for states to arise, it forcefully illustrates that the monopolistic control of technologies of destruction, (re)production, and communication by a sovereign is accompanied by his divinization and the hypostasis of the political entity thereby created through incest and human sacrifice.

洛朗·贝尔格

Laurent Berger

帕特里克·文顿·基尔希，《酋长如何成为国王：神圣的王权和古代夏威夷古老国家的崛起》（伯克利：加州大学出版社，2010 年）。

Patrick Vinton Kirch, How Chiefs Became Kings: Divine Kingship and the Rise of Archaic States in Ancient Hawai’i (Berkeley: University of California Press, 2010).

2011

2011

债务：格雷伯希望终结债务暴力

Debt: Graeber Wishes to End the Violence of Debt

很难说大卫·格雷伯的《债务：最初的5000年》属于哪个学科。格雷伯（1961-2020）是一位专门研究马达加斯加的人类学家、伦敦经济学院教授和活动家。这本书可以作为一篇经济史和人类学的论文来阅读，或者更准确地说，是一篇对古典经济学人类学基础的批判。然而，从第一页开始，读者就能意识到它还有更大的野心：在追溯“债务”概念的起源时，格雷伯实际上是在追随霍布斯和亚当·斯密的脚步，但同时也与他们背道而驰，撰写了一部新的《道德情操论》。他提出了一个复杂而新颖的理论，该理论围绕两种拟议的经济形式——人类经济和市场经济——之间的斗争展开，涉及四个漫长的周期：信用时代（公元前 3500 年至公元前 800 年）、轴心时代（公元前 800 年至公元 600 年）、中世纪（600-1450 年）和资本主义帝国时代（1450-1971 年）。

It is hard to say to what discipline David Graeber’s Debt: The First 5,000 Years belongs. Graeber (1961–2020) was an anthropologist specializing in Madagascar, a professor at the London School of Economics, and an activist. The book may be read as an essay in economic history and anthropology or, more precisely, as a critique of the anthropological underpinnings of classical economics. Yet, from the very first pages, the reader realizes that it has still greater ambitions: In going over the genealogy of the idea of “debt,” Graeber is in fact following in the footsteps of Hobbes and Adam Smith, but also going against them in writing a new Theory of Moral Sentiments. He puts forward a complex and original theory centered on the struggle between two proposed forms of economy, the human economy and the market economy, linked over four great lengthy cycles: the age of credit (3500 BCE to 800 BCE), the axial age (800 BCE to 600 CE), the Middle Ages (600–1450), and the age of great capitalist empires (1450–1971).

这本书既是一篇学术研究，也是一本政治小册子，以最近的重大金融危机为背景。这场系统性危机最初与美国的私人债务（次贷）有关，但当它跨越大西洋到达葡萄牙、意大利、爱尔兰、希腊和西班牙时，却伪装成一场公共债务危机。人们常说，所有债务都应该偿还，无论代价如何。作为一名人类学家，格雷伯以这句老生常谈的论调为出发点，但整本书都试图反驳它。为此，他解构了债务的概念，并努力理解它的起源、它激活的经济关系、它建立的道德纽带，以及它隐藏着哪些形式的身体或非人格暴力。

The book is both a scholarly study and a political pamphlet, built on the latest major financial crisis, a systemic crisis initially relating to private debt in the United States (subprimes) yet disguised as a public debt crisis once it crossed the Atlantic to Portugal, Italy, Ireland, Greece, and Spain. It is often said that all debts ought to be reimbursed, whatever the cost. As an anthropologist, Graeber takes this commonplace as his starting point, but the entire volume sets out to disprove it. To this end, he deconstructs the notion of debt and strives to understand its origins, what economic relations it activates, what moral ties it establishes, and further, what forms of physical or impersonal violence it conceals.

本书分为三个部分。第一部分批判了古典政治经济学的理论预设。格雷伯认为，将交换实践视为普遍的社群生活形式，在历史上是站不住脚的。他进一步指出，将个人利益或利己主义视为所有社会性背后的驱动力，在人类学上是错误的，而比较人类学的著作证明了他的观点是正确的。然而，这些预设正是治理我们经济制度的核心，更重要的是，它们也是我们常识的核心。我们只需想想亚当·斯密：格雷伯就表明，他将易货贸易视为市​​场在逻辑和历史上的先例是多么武断，而实际上，易货贸易是一种相当新的交换形式，其本质是仪式性的，而非经济性的。如果要寻找现代市场经济形态的先例，我们不应该转向仪式性的物品交换，而应该转向系统性地使用暴力作为征服工具。毫无疑问，公元前七世纪中国、印度和希腊同时发明的货币发行，最初是为了支付士兵的军饷，这绝非偶然。奴役和系统性地使用暴力，如果没有这两大运作方式，我们就无法理解几个世纪以来塑造着生活方式、政治权力和宗教权力与国家和市场之间关系变迁的结构。

The book is divided into three sections. The first is a critique of the theoretical presuppositions of classical political economy. Graeber holds that it is historically unjustified to think that the practice of exchange is a universal form of communal life. He further argues that it is anthropologically incorrect to take personal interest or egotism to be the driving force behind all sociality, a point on which works in comparative anthropology prove him right. Yet these are the presuppositions central to the economic institutions governing us and, still more seriously, central to our common sense. One need only think of Adam Smith: Graeber shows how arbitrary his decision is to place barter as the logical and historical antecedent to the market, whereas it is in fact a fairly recent form of exchange, and it is ritual, not economic, in nature. If one is looking for an antecedent to the modern configuration of the market economy, it is not to the ritual exchange of objects that one should turn but rather to the systematic usage of violence as an instrument of subjection. It is doubtless not by chance that the issuing of money, invented in the seventh century BCE in China, India, and Greece concomitantly, were initially to pay soldiers at war. Enslavement and the systematic use of physical violence are the two operations without which one cannot understand the structures shaping the changing relationship over the centuries between, on the one hand, forms of life, political power, and religious power and, on the other, the state and the market.

古典经济学（马克思除外）拒绝思考这种不间断的暴力链条。它被构建成甚至忽略了它，并把世界，正如经济学家所认为的那样，视为理性选择和私人利益的算术结果。这是一种巨大的防御机制（马克思的另一个观点），掩盖了一种通过暴力延续下来的统治形式的起源。格雷伯也将其解读为一种更深层次的人类学转型的征兆，在现代，货币经济开始摧毁人类经济，规范货币积累的非人格逻辑变成了一种真正的道德法则。

Classical economic science (with the exception of Marx) refuses to consider this uninterrupted chain of violence. It is so constructed to ignore it even and make the world, as thought by economists, transpire as the arithmetical result of rational choices and private interests. This is a vast defense mechanism (another of Marx’s points), concealing the origins of a form of domination perpetuated through violence. Graeber also interprets it as the symptom of a deeper, anthropological transformation when, in the modern age, the monetary economy started to destroy the human economy, and when the impersonal logic regulating the accumulation of money turned into an authentically moral law.

第二部分可以作为一本独立的书，简要论述经济关系的道德基础。格雷伯列举了三种道德基础：共产主义、交换和等级制度，这三者始终是混合的，永远不会存在于纯粹的状态。共产主义是一种基于地方性和具体共享的经济关系（因此，也是所有人类社会形式的基础）；商品交换指的是远距离同侪之间的经济关系，而等级制度则是一种基于优先权理念的不对称权力关系。

The second section could function as a stand-alone book, being a brief treatise on the moral foundations of economic relations. Graeber identifies three: communism, exchange, and hierarchy, all three of which are always mixed and never exist in a pure state. Communism is an economic relation based on locality and concrete sharing (and, consequently, the foundation of all forms of human sociality); the exchange of goods designates an economic relation between peers at a distance, while hierarchy is an asymmetric power relationship based on the idea of precedence.

第三部分最为宏大。格雷伯对人类社会中信用与借贷关系的历史进行了比较，涵盖了从最早的苏美尔文献到当代的历史。这分为四个重要时期，其特征要么是虚拟货币盛行，信用保护体系盛行；要么是金属货币传播，债务压迫体系盛行。“金属”时期通常更加暴力，战争和洗劫的强度远超相对和平的“信用”时期。然而，在这些交替的周期中，有一件事始终不变：债务与暴力和奴役之间的密切联系。这正是格雷伯著作的核心。这种关系在数千年中不断演变的历史随处可见，在“自由”和“荣誉”等词语背后，甚至在我们经济制度的具体表现中都能找到它的痕迹。正是这种关注很长时期的系谱学方法，以能够贯穿整个经济理论的人类学分析为基础，让格雷伯能够写出一篇关于人类凶猛和掠夺性破坏之谜的文章，这种谜团在今天伪装成博弈论和算法系列的市场机制中仍然存在。

The third section is the most ambitious. Graeber sets out a comparative history of credit and debit relations in human societies, from the earliest Sumerian documents through to the present day. This is divided into four great periods, characterized either by the prevalence of virtual monies and systems of protection by credit or by the dissemination of metal monies and systems of oppression by debt. The “metallic” periods are generally more violent, with wars and ransacking of an intensity unknown during “crediting” periods, which are comparatively pacific. Yet over these alternating cycles one thing remains constant: the close relationship linking debt to physical violence and enslavement. This is at the heart of Graeber’s book. The unceasing history of this relationship over the millennia may be detected everywhere, behind the terms “freedom” and “honor,” and even in the form taken by our economic institutions. It is this genealogical approach, attentive to very long periods, grounded in anthropological analysis capable of cutting through economic theory as a whole, which allows Graeber to write what is fundamentally an essay on the ferocity of humankind and the enigma of a predatory destructiveness that still exists today in market mechanisms dressed up as game theory and algorithmic series.

丹尼尔·巴利科

Daniele Balicco

大卫·格雷伯，《债务：第一个 5000 年》（纽约：梅尔维尔出版社，2011 年）。

David Graeber, Debt: The First 5,000 Years (New York: Melville House, 2011).

2012

2012

穿过针眼:布朗回归基督教财富问题的根源

Through the Eye of a Needle: Brown Returns to the Roots of the Christian Problem of Wealth

彼得·布朗（生于1935年）于1967年凭借其处女作——一部关于圣奥古斯丁的权威传记——成为英语学术界的领军人物之一。他的著作激励了几代古代史学家，并因其“晚期古代”的理念，帮助重新评估了地中海及其周边地区（从布列塔尼到伊朗）的剧烈变革，将影响这一广阔地区从四世纪到六世纪的所有意识形态和宗教问题都纳入了同一的思想体系之中。

Peter Brown (born 1935) became established as one of the leading intellectuals in English-speaking academia in 1967 with his first book, a magisterial biography of Saint Augustine. His writings have inspired several generations of historians of the ancient world and, thanks to his idea of “late antiquity,” helped reappraise the radical transformation affecting the Mediterranean world and its surrounding lands, from Brittany to Iran, encompassing within a single body of thought all the ideological and religious problems affecting this vast area from the fourth through to the sixth centuries.

《针眼》出版于其在牛津、伦敦、伯克利和普林斯顿大学（截至1986年）的职业生涯末期，是一部极具创新性的研究著作，探讨了财富——其获取、传承和社会分配——在古代晚期动荡时期所扮演的角色。这部著作内容深奥，中世纪史学家和古代史学家都对此感兴趣，它探讨了中世纪基督教世界赖以生存的意识形态基础的演变，以及影响西方直至12世纪的深层变革。本书探讨了当今历史研究中一些最热门的议题。

Through the Eye of a Needle, published at the end of a career spent at Oxford, London, Berkeley, and Princeton (as of 1986), is a highly innovative study addressing the place of wealth—its acquisition, transmission, and social distribution—in the upheavals taking place during late antiquity. It is a complex book, of interest to medievalists and historians of antiquity alike, examining the elaboration of the ideological underpinnings on which much of Christendom was based in the Middle Ages, along with deeper changes affecting the West through to the twelfth century. In so doing, it tackles some of the most topical themes in present historical scholarship.

布朗以一场根本性的文化转变作为出发点：四世纪的罗马社会关注的是社会等级、名誉和声望，而六世纪的罗马社会则将救赎——即灵魂的命运——置于所有其他关注之上。四世纪尚未出现的问题——教会财富、对穷人的关怀以及灵魂救赎之间的联系——在六世纪变得至关重要。因此，财富在基督教中被广泛使用。这为教会财富地位的转变提供了正当理由，教会财富之所以变得神圣且不可剥夺，正是因为其目的是救济穷人。在这一转变的最终阶段，教会财富被认为是穷人获得世间财产的途径，尽管他们从定义上被排除在外。贫困问题在这本关于财富的书中至关重要，因为它伴随着社会自身表象的彻底变革。

Brown takes as his starting point a fundamental cultural shift: Whereas fourth-century Roman society was preoccupied by matters of social hierarchy, reputation, and prestige, that of the sixth century placed salvation—that is, the fate of souls—above all other preoccupations. Problems that did not arise in the fourth century—the links between the church’s wealth, caring for the poor, and the salvation of the soul—became crucial in the sixth century. There was thus a Christian usage of wealth. This justified a change to the status of church wealth, which became holy and inalienable precisely because its purpose was to succor the poor. At the end of this shift, church wealth was considered as the way by which the poor could access property in this world, even though they were by definition excluded from it. The question of poverty is essential in this book about wealth, since it accompanies a radical change in how society represented itself.

将穷人纳入考量，并将他们的命运与灵魂的救赎联系起来，颠覆了社会行动的范畴。例如，以游戏的形式赠予公民，会立即得到喝彩和钦佩的回报，从而巩固了慷慨者的社会声望。然而，组织游戏在罗马人生活中仍然很重要，尤其是在意大利，至少一直到公元四世纪末，而精神主义（euergetism）也继续构建着罗马人的政治和社会生活，即使在精神斗争和智力竞争的背景下，出现了一些与之竞争的模式。米兰的安布罗斯是最早将贫困视为基督教核心要素并就此进行探讨的人之一，他与叙马库斯是同时代人，叙马库斯是旧社会精英最后一位伟大的代表，他笃信异教，并坚信尊重自古以来沿袭下来的仪式是维护世界秩序的唯一途径。

Taking the poor into account and linking their fate to the salvation of the soul upended categories of social action. Gifts to the citizens, in the form of games, for example, were immediately recompensed by acclamation and admiration, consolidating the social prestige of the generous individual. Yet organizing games continued to be important in Roman life, particularly in Italy, at least through to the end of the fourth century, and euergetism continued to structure the political and social life of the Romans, even though rival models were emerging in a context of spiritual combat and intellectual competition. Ambrose of Milan, one of the first to consider poverty as a central element in Christianity and to talk about the matter, was a contemporary of Symmachus, one of the last great representatives of the old social elite, deeply pagan and certain that respecting rites practiced since the beginning of days was the only way to maintain the order of the world.

相反，赠予上帝及其教会的礼物并不意味着任何立即的回报。如果捐赠者期望得到回报，那回报将被推迟，并且只能在尘世之后发生。因此，慷慨是一种积累非物质财富的方式，基督徒只有在来世，在对上帝和永恒至福的无限沉思中才能获得它。礼物就这样将尘世的财富转化为救赎的承诺。教会财产、救赎和保护穷人之间的联系，通过从安布罗斯到萨尔维安等人引发的争论，以及贵族精神观念的变化逐渐概念化。对贵族来说，“otium”（空）被赋予了新的内容，贫困和隐居成为公认的社会价值。五世纪的禁欲运动，尤其是在莱兰周围兴起的禁欲运动，在转变贵族对教会机构的社会和心理态度方面发挥了关键作用，并帮助定义了布朗恰如其分地引用的福柯所说的牧师权力。

Contrarily, gifts to God and his church did not imply any immediate return. If the donor expected a recompense, it was deferred and could only occur after life on earth. Generosity was thus a way of building up an immaterial treasure to which the Christian could only have access in the afterlife, in infinite contemplation of God and eternal beatitude. The gift thus converted earthly riches into promises of salvation. The link between church property, salvation, and protecting the poor was slowly conceptualized through controversies conducted by figures from Ambrose to Salvian and the change in ethos of the aristocracy, for whom otium was given new content and poverty and withdrawal from the world were recognized social values. The fifth-century ascetic movement, particularly that which sprang up around Lérins, played a key role in transforming the aristocracy’s social and mental attitudes toward ecclesial institutions and helped define what Foucault, duly cited by Brown, called pastoral power.

当今学术研究，尤其是中世纪早期的研究，广泛借鉴了布朗的研究方法和思路。对礼物和财富地位的探究，以及对世俗人士和神职人员如何使用这些财富的深入分析，如今已成为研究的焦点。理解财富转化为权力的过程，是中世纪学者和古代史学家的核心课题。这涉及到对保存、再生产和传承等社会科学重要思想的思考，所有这些思想都值得深入探讨。争论的核心在于基督教经济是否存在——也就是说，在古代和中世纪社会中，生产和交换是否以特定的方式运作。布朗的思想涵盖了中世纪早期与财富转移和精英统治模式相关的一切。

Present-day scholarship, particularly of the early Middle Ages, draws extensively on Brown’s methods and lines of approach. Inquiry into gifts and the status of wealth, and in-depth analysis of how they were used by laypeople and ecclesiastics alike, are now in the foreground. Understanding the processes by which wealth was transformed into power is a central topic for medievalists, as it is for historians of antiquity, too. This involves consideration of such major ideas in the social sciences as preservation, reproduction, and transmission, all of which come in for close examination. At the heart of the debate lies the question of the existence of a Christian economy—that is, of whether production and exchange functioned in specific ways in ancient and medieval societies. Everything relating to transfers of wealth and modes of domination by elites in the early Middle Ages is encompassed by Brown’s thought.

洛朗·费勒

Laurent Feller

彼得·布朗，《穿过针眼：财富、罗马的陷落以及西方基督教的形成，公元 350-550 年》（新泽西州普林斯顿：普林斯顿大学出版社，2012 年）。

Peter Brown, Through the Eye of a Needle: Wealth, the Fall of Rome, and the Making of Christianity in the West, 350–550 AD (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 2012).

2013

2013

《二十一世纪资本论》：皮凯蒂解读世纪经济不平等的变迁

Capital in the Twenty-First Century: Piketty Decrypts Shifts in Economic Inequalities over the Centuries

《二十一世纪资本论》是托马斯·皮凯蒂（生于 1971 年）十五年研究的结晶，期间他的几位同事也加入其中，共同探讨收入和资产不平等的历史变迁。二十世纪九十年代末，皮凯蒂发现这一主题缺乏统计数据和历史视角，于是着手重建长期数据序列（最初是法国的数据），以揭示资本和收入不平等的变化。结果与认为不平等会随着经济发展而减少的乐观观点形成鲜明对比，而是显示了政治决策（尤其与税收有关）和历史冲击（尤其是两次世界大战）对这种分配的影响程度，从而与任何无形的经济规律相矛盾。皮凯蒂的研究随后主要转向两个方向：国际比较和资本分析。随着世界经历灾难性的经济危机，这部作品在政治辩论和社会运动（包括占领华尔街）中引起了深刻的反响，尤其是在美国，正如皮凯蒂在各种出版物中所表明的那样，美国的收入不平等程度几乎达到了1914年之前的“未驯服的资本主义”和“强盗资本家”时期的水平。

Le capital au XXI e siècle (Capital in the Twenty-First Century) is the culmination of fifteen years of research by Thomas Piketty (born 1971), joined on the way by several colleagues, into historical shifts in income and asset inequalities. In the late 1990s, struck by the paucity of statistics and historical perspectives on the subject, Piketty set about reconstructing long data series, initially on France, to bring out changes in capital and income inequalities. The result contrasts with the optimistic vision claiming that inequalities diminish with economic development, instead showing the extent to which political decisions (relating to taxation in particular) and historical shocks (especially the two world wars) determined this distribution, thus contradicting any intangible economic law. Piketty’s research then headed in two main directions: international comparison and the analysis of capital. With the world going through a disastrous economic crisis, the work echoed deeply with political debates and social movements (including Occupy Wall Street), especially in the United States where, as Piketty had already shown in various publications, the level of income inequality had nearly reached levels last seen in the pre-1914 days of “untamed capitalism” and “robber barons.”

《资本论》进一步扩展了这些关于收入不平等的分析。它揭示了近期财富不平等的重构（尽管尚未达到1914年之前的水平），并分析了市场经济变革中特有的力量，这些力量在资本收益率超过增长率时会导致财富不平等加剧。皮凯蒂认为，没有什么是不可避免的。关于这些力量，以及它们在过去曾被反击过，本书最后提出了一些建议，其中最重要的就是对资本征收累进的全球税。

Le capital expands on these analyses of income inequalities. It throws light on the recent reconstitution of wealth inequalities (though without these reaching pre-1914 levels) and diagnoses forces specific to changes in market economies that bring about increased wealth inequality when capital yields exceed growth rates. Piketty argues that there is nothing ineluctable about these forces and that they have been countered in the past. The book thus closes on suggestions, the most important of which is a progressive global tax on capital.

然而，尽管这些论点吸引了最多的关注，但它们仅仅代表了本书的一个方面，其更大的目标是解释资本积累的过程及其如何依赖于劳动和社会组织。皮凯蒂用大量篇幅论述了奴隶制的历史和公共债务。他与马尔萨斯、李嘉图和马克思等古典经济学家对话，回归政治经济学的基本问题（财富分配、长期经济增长、生产要素收益率等），同时将大量分析用于国民经济核算统计数据，这些统计数据反映了社会赋予资本的角色。

Yet while these arguments captured the most attention, they only represent one aspect of the book, whose greater ambition is to explain the processes of capital accumulation and how they depend on labor and social organization. Piketty devotes many pages to the history of slavery and to public debt. Dialoguing with classical economists such as Malthus, Ricardo, and Marx, he returns to the fundamental questions of political economy (the distribution of wealth, long-term economic growth, yield on factors of production, etc.) while devoting much of his analysis to national account statistics, which reflect the role society attributes to capital.

该书于2013年底在法国出版，2014年春在美国被翻译，随后几乎在世界各地发行，并很快成为一部重要的、独一无二的著作。作为一部学术著作，它取得了非凡的成功，销量达数百万册，并在世界各地的公共辩论和政治评论中引起了强烈反响，尽管它最初在美国引起了媒体的关注。尽管它主要关注西欧和美国的不平等问题，但它在许多国家引发了常规学术网络之外的讨论，这表明社会科学领域正在出现一种新型的国际化。

The book was published in late 2013 in France, translated in spring 2014 in the United States, and then nearly everywhere else in the world, soon becoming established as a major and singular work. It met with exceptional success for an academic work, selling several million copies, and resonated strongly in public debate and political commentary worldwide, though it was initially in the United States that it captured media attention. Although mainly covering inequalities in Western Europe and the United States, it sparked debate in many countries outside the usual academic networks, indicative of a new type of internationalization in the social sciences.

值得注意的是，除了印刷版外，皮凯蒂的网站上还有大量的数据、参考文献和附录。很难说这是否促成了这本书的成功，但它无疑对相关争论产生了很大的影响：许多评论都是基于利用这些统计数据复制和修改其分析。皮凯蒂在书中鼓励这种借鉴和反应，并经常在媒体和专业期刊上进行回应。

It should be noted that in addition to the print version, there is also a mass of data, bibliographical references, and appendixes available on Piketty’s website. It is hard to tell whether this played a part in the book’s success, but it certainly did much to shape debate about it: Many commentaries have been based on replicating and modifying its analyses by drawing on the statistical data thus made available. In the book, Piketty encourages such appropriations and reactions and has frequently replied in the press and in specialized journals.

在21世纪初，《资本论》因其独特的格式而在学术经济学出版物中脱颖而出。大多数经济学家——或者至少是主流经济学家——不再将书籍形式视为有效的科学对象，而只重视文章。学术经济学家的著作往往是通俗易懂的著作、对公共辩论的贡献，或汇集……文章。《资本论》明确反对这种立场。皮凯蒂在引言和结论中明确阐述了这一点，他尖锐地批评了经济学这门学科，指责它拘泥于枯燥的经验和理论方法，忽视了社会科学和政治问题。皮凯蒂延续了他2001年出版的早期著作《二十世纪法国最高收入》的风格，但方式不 那么线性，也更具雄心，这次他回归了书籍的形式。统计分析在历史和多维研究中具有意义，只有这种研究才能揭示资本不平等随时间变化的社会和政治层面。经济学家在批评皮凯蒂的著作时往往忽略了这一特殊性，主要关注统计数据和理论，而没有考虑制度分析。但正是这种特殊性使得这本书与其他社会科学，特别是社会学、历史学、政治哲学和政治学产生了对话，正如其他学科的许多评论和借鉴所表明的那样。

In the early twenty-first century, Le capital stands out among academic economics publications because of its very format. Most economists—or mainstream ones, in any case—no longer view the book format as a valid scientific object, valuing only articles. Volumes by academic economists tend to be general-interest works, contributions to public debate, or collections of articles. Le capital is explicitly conceived against such stances. Piketty states this clearly in the introduction and conclusion, where he sharply criticizes economics as a discipline, accusing it of cleaving to sterile empirical and theoretical methods ignorant of the social sciences and political issues. In the same vein of his earlier 2001 book, Les hauts revenus en France au XX e siècle (Top Incomes in France in the Twentieth Century), but in a less linear and more ambitious manner, Piketty returns to the book format. Statistical analyses take on meaning within a historical and multidimensional study that alone brings out the social and political dimensions to changes in capital inequalities over time. In their criticisms of Piketty’s book, economists tend to ignore this specificity, focusing primarily on the statistics and theory, without taking the institutional analysis into account. But it is this specificity that has brought the book into dialogue with the other social sciences, particularly sociology, history, political philosophy, and political science, as illustrated by the many reviews and borrowings by other disciplines.

埃里克·莫内

Éric Monnet

托马斯·皮凯蒂，《Le Capital au XX e siècle》（巴黎：Éditions du Seuil [“Les livres du nouveau monde”]，2013）。亚瑟·戈德哈默 (Arthur Goldhammer) 译为英文《二十一世纪的资本》（马萨诸塞州剑桥：哈佛大学出版社，2014 年）。

Thomas Piketty, Le capital au XX e siècle (Paris: Éditions du Seuil [“Les livres du nouveau monde”], 2013). Translated into English by Arthur Goldhammer as Capital in the Twenty-First Century (Cambridge, MA: Harvard University Press, 2014).

2014

2014

身体的用途:阿甘本与生命作为用途

The Use of Bodies: Agamben and Life as Use

当读者发现《身体的用途》 （L'uso dei corpi）时，他们仿佛感受到一个预言成真。二十世纪下半叶最伟大的哲学巨著之一终于问世，这本书是《神圣人》系列的第九卷，也是最终卷，为乔治·阿甘本（生于1942年）二十年的研究画上了句号。然而，尽管是“最终卷”，这本书与其说是一部总结，不如说是阿甘本主要主题的重现，其编曲如同恰空舞曲——一种以缓慢、庄严和固定音型为特征的巴洛克风格作曲形式。

When readers discovered L’uso dei corpi (The Use of Bodies), they felt as though a prophecy had come to pass. One of the greatest philosophical canvases of the second half of the twentieth century was now complete, the book being the ninth and crowning volume of Homo Sacer, bringing twenty years of research by Giorgio Agamben (born 1942) to a close. Yet despite being the “final” volume, the book is not so much a conclusion as a reprise of Agamben’s main motifs, orchestrated like a chaconne—a baroque form of composition characterized by slowness, solemnity, and ostinato.

“使用”如何转化为一种精神特质（ethos）和一种生命形式？什么样的本体论和伦理学与一种在使用中被建构为与其形式不可分割的生命相符？” 《最高的贫困》 （Altissima povertà，2011）所终结的问题在此得到了解答，即“使用本身的定义”。它意味着一种非操作性的本体论，以及一种摆脱了义务和意志概念的伦理学和政治学。为了将“使用”和生命形式区分开来，阿甘本的论述分为三个阶段，外加一个序言、一个结语和两个间奏——第一个关于海德格尔，第二个关于福柯。

“How can use be translated into an ethos and a form-of-life? And what ontology and ethics would correspond to a life that, in use, is constituted as inseparable from its form?” The question on which Altissima povertà (The Highest Poverty, 2011) had closed is here answered, in the “definition of use in itself.” It implies an ontology of non-operativity, together with an ethics and a politics liberated of the concepts of duty and will. To isolate “use” and form-of-life, Agamben proceeds in three stages, plus a prologue, an epilogue, and two interludes, the first about Heidegger and the second about Foucault.

第一部分探讨“身体的用途”，这也是整本书的标题。它探讨了一个双重命题的彻底性：道德和政治需要从身体出发进行思考；为此，我们需要用“用途”的概念取代“行动”的概念。身体的生命，无论是秘密的还是神圣的，都是这一事业的起点，前提是我们不是抽象地理解这种生命，而是将其视为赤裸的生命，从一开始就将其作为一种手段来把握。这就是“用途”概念的力量。“身体的用途”这一表述，借用自亚里士多德对奴隶制的分析，不仅指出了一种非生产性（闲散）活动，也指出了人造身体与活体、自身身体与他人身体、zoé与bios、physis与nomos之间的灰色地带。动词chresthai（使用），在其最严格的意义上，并不是指使用某物，而是指“人与自身的关系”。在福柯看来，chrésis的概念与自我相关，而对阿甘本来说，它可能提供一种超越所有主体诠释学的方式，与“自我与关系的本体论对应性”相联系。因此，主体性不再是实质性的，而更像是一种与关系的关系。福柯背后的问题也是他与海德格尔的长期争论。如果说“使用”需要摆脱海德格尔的概念来重视，那是因为海德格尔再次在自身性和本真性的视野中思考了它。但使用意味着与不可占有之物建立一种关系，阿甘本探讨了不可占有的三个形象：身体、语言和风景。这种差异源于本体论，而一种新的本体论是必要的，这意味着需要重新诠释斯多葛学派的“生命之道”（ oikeiosis ）概念，将使用视为“生命形式”，而非活动。

The first part, on “the use of bodies,” gives its title to the whole volume. It explores the full radicality of a dual thesis: Morality and politics need to be thought of starting from bodies; to do so, we need to replace the concept of action with that of use. The life of bodies, both secret and sacred, serves as a starting point for this undertaking, provided we do not apprehend this life abstractly but as bare life, captured, from the outset, as a means. This is the power of the concept of use. The expression “use of the body,” borrowed from Aristotle’s analysis of slavery, indicates a nonproductive (idle) activity but also a gray zone between an artificial body and a living body, one’s own body and the body of others, zoé and bios, physis and nomos. The verb chresthai (to use), in its strictest meaning, does not designate using something but rather the “relation one has to oneself.” Whereas in Foucault, the concept of chrésis related to the self, for Agamben it may provide a way of moving beyond all hermeneutics of the subject, being linked to an “ontological adequation of self to the relationship.” Hence subjectivity is no longer substantial and becomes more like a relation to relationship. What is at issue behind Foucault is also the long dispute with Heidegger. If “use” needs to be prized free of the Heideggerian conception, it is because Heidegger thought of it, once again, within the horizon of own-ness and authenticity. But using entails a relationship with the inappropriable, of which Agamben explores three figures: the body, language, and landscape. The difference stems from ontology, and a new ontology is necessary, implying a reinterpretation of the Stoic concept of oikeiosis to think of use not as activity but as “form-of-life”

我们需要走一条“宏大”的道路，即用模态本体论来解决实体本体论的难题，这方面的指导可以在斯宾诺莎和莱布尼茨的著作中找到。第二部分的目的正是探讨“通往第一哲学，即本体论的途径，在今天是否仍然——再次——可能”。莱布尼茨正是以此为出发点，提出了“实体连接” （vinculum substantiale ）的概念，该概念将多元单子统一于单一实体之中，阿尔弗雷德·伯姆和吉尔·德勒兹也继承了这一思想。阿甘本则坚持“要求”的概念：如果这种连接需要单子，那么要求就需要取代实体，成为本体论的核心概念；存在并非占有存在模态，而是需要并被置于存在模态之中——它只不过是存在模态的变型。这种新的本体论就是使用本体论。在生命形式中，在作为形式呈现和发生的生命中，生命体（zoé）和生命（bios）不再是对立的，而是相互联系的——它们相互需要。它们相互接触，相互联系。

What is needed is to take the “grandiose” path, which consists in resolving the aporia of hypostatic ontology by a modal ontology, for which instructions may be found in Spinoza and Leibniz. That is the purpose of the second part, which inquires whether “access to a first philosophy, that is, to an ontology, is today still—once again—possible.” This was the approach taken by Leibniz in venturing the concept of “vinculum substantiale,” a link uniting the multiplicity of monads within a single substance, which was picked up on by Alfred Boehm and Gilles Deleuze. For his part, Agamben insists on the concept of “requirement”: If the link requires the monads, the requirement needs to replace substance as the central concept of ontology; being does not appropriate modes of being, it requires and is deployed in them—it is nothing other than its modifications. This new ontology is that of use. In the form-of-life, in the life that takes on and transpires as form, zoé and bios are no longer opposed but linked to each other—they require each other. They touch and are in contact.

这种“非关系和使用本体论”呼吁一种新的政治，因为它使得超越西方哲学所建立的“分裂生命”的分离成为可能，并解放了生命形式的概念——即，其最严格的定义是“一种永远不可能孤立和区分类似赤裸生命之物的生命”。阿甘本将生命与其形式之间的联系描述为不可分割的，是一个“不可分割的整体”。我们所说的生命形式对应着一种风格的本体论，它指的是“单一性在存在中见证自身，而存在在单一身体中表达自身的模式”。换句话说，它在方式上也被“挪用”。结语提出了一种“废止潜能理论”。

This “ontology of non-relation and of use” calls for a new politics, for it makes it possible to move beyond the separations of “divided life” on which Western philosophy is built and frees the concept of form-of-life—that is, in its most rigorous definition, a “life where it is never possible to isolate and keep distinct something like bare life.” Agamben describes as inseparable the link uniting life to its form, an “indivisible whole.” What we call form-of-life corresponds to an ontology of style and designates the “mode in which a singularity bears witness to itself in being and being expresses itself in the singular body.” In other words, it is also “disappropriated” in manner. The epilogue sets out a “theory of destituent potential.”

如果这部著作最终被视为里程碑，那正是因为它对“用途”、对“模态”和“要求”的本体论，以及对生命形式的本体论要求的重新编排，阿甘本才始终如一地将之应用于社会科学及其用于思考实践、存在模式和行为方式的概念工具箱。它已在伦理学、形而上学、美学和政治学等多个领域引发了争论，而最重要的是，它被重新整合这些领域的雄心所驱动。

If this work will come to be seen as a landmark, it is precisely because of its reorchestration of “use,” of the ontology of “modality” and “requirement,” and of the form-of-life in an ontological requirement that Agamben persistently addresses to the social sciences and to their conceptual toolkit for thinking about practices, modes of being, and ways of doing. It has already sparked debate in various fields, including ethics, metaphysics, aesthetics, and politics, and, above all, is driven by the ambition of joining them back together.

阿甘本选用了提香的《安德罗斯人的狂欢》作为封面。这一场景发生在安德罗斯岛。在科凯恩的蓝天下，人们正在举行盛大的祭酒仪式。人们或因醉酒而活跃起来，或因睡意而昏昏欲睡。人们翩翩起舞。背景中，一个裸体的萨提尔正在熟睡，双腿分开。前景中，一位年轻女子慵懒地躺着，胸部优雅地拱起，乳房微微向外挺起。我们的目光被她吸引，“就像山脚下一座宁静的小村庄”。她熟睡时脸红了。一个小男孩撩起衬衫小便。身体的用途是什么？睡觉、跳舞、小便、玩耍和性享受。所有这些身影都懒洋洋地躺在天空这片破烂的帐篷下，阿甘本希望引导我们继续他未竟的事业。

For the cover, Agamben selected Titian’s The Bacchanal of the Andrians. This scene is at Andros. The libation is in full swing under blue skies of Cockayne. Bodies are enlivened by inebriety or giving into sleep. People dance. In the background a naked satyr is sleeping, his legs apart. In the foreground a young woman languishes, her bust graciously arched, her breasts raised slightly outward. Our eyes are drawn to her, “like a peaceful hamlet at the foot of the mountain.” She blushes as she sleeps. A little boy raises his shirt to have a pee. The use of bodies? Sleeping, dancing, peeing, playing, and sexual enjoyment. And all these figures are lounging beneath the ragged tent of the sky, where Agamben wishes to lead us to take up the inquiry where he has left off.

马丁·鲁埃夫

Martin Rueff

乔治·阿甘本，《L'uso dei corpi》。 Homo Sacer，IV，2（Vicenza Neri Pozza [“La Quarta posa”]，2014）。 Adam Kotsko 翻译成英文，名为《身体的使用：Homo Sacer》，IV，2（加利福尼亚州斯坦福：斯坦福大学出版社，2016 年）。

Giorgio Agamben, L’uso dei corpi. Homo Sacer, IV, 2 (Vicenza Neri Pozza [“La Quarta posa”], 2014). Translated into English by Adam Kotsko as The Use of Bodies: Homo Sacer, IV, 2 (Stanford, CA: Stanford University Press, 2016).

2015

2015

世界尽头的蘑菇：青追踪资本主义废墟中的生活

The Mushroom at the End of the World: Tsing Tracks Life in the Ruins of Capitalism

与阿基米德不同，安娜·青（生于1952年）需要的并非一个能够推动世界的定点，而是一种气味浓烈、难以找到的蘑菇——松茸，日本人对此推崇备至。这当然并非推动世界——一个一直激励着科学家和工程师的伟大梦想——而是揭示资本主义融入世界的渠道，以及我们赖以生存的行为方式。

Unlike Archimedes, it is not a fixed point to move the world that Anna Tsing (born 1952) needs but a single, strong-smelling, hard-to-find mushroom, the matsutake, which the Japanese prize highly. And it is surely not to move the world, a mighty dream that has always fired scientists and engineers, but rather to reveal the conduits by which capitalism inserts itself into the world and the behavior by which we may hope to survive it.

“我们” 意义重大，因为这本人类学著作在一系列短小的章节中探讨了相当广泛的生物名单，这些章节彼此重叠，就像松茸一样。

“We” is significant, because this book of anthropology works with a considerably expanded list of beings in a series of short chapters that overlap rather like the matsutake.

这本书在主题、研究方法和风格上都堪称典范，青深刻地诠释了“人”的含义。对她而言，身为人意味着与许多其他物种找到暂时的交集，而人并不一定处于中心地位。委婉地说，这本书并非以人类为中心——它将人类置于另一个轨道上。

In this book, which is exemplary in its subject, investigation method, and style, Tsing profoundly modifies what is meant by “human.” For her, being human means finding a provisional overlapping with many other species, and humans are not necessarily placed at the center. It would be a euphemism to say this book is not anthropocentric—it places humanity on another orbit.

它并非那种自然科学书籍，也不是博物学家分享树木、微生物、鲸鱼或肠道菌群惊人存在之知识的通俗读物。它是一部彻头彻尾的社会科学著作，而且是一部要求极高的社会科学著作。它从未偏离其宗旨：追踪资本主义的新本质，探索在其废墟中生存的可能性。

Nor is it one of those books of natural science or popular works in which naturalists share their knowledge about the surprising existence of trees, microbes, whales, or intestinal flora. It is a work of social science through and through, and of the most demanding kind. Not for one instant does it lose from view its purpose of tracking the new nature of capitalism and exploring the possibility of living among its ruins.

为什么蘑菇能让人们更好地理解资本主义——比互联网、武器贸易或粮食销售更好？原因既决定了本次研究的方法，也决定了研究对象：规模问题。这种蘑菇无法种植，因为它的生命周期变化无常，并且严重依赖于其他因素；它不是一个可扩展的对象。

Why should a mushroom make it possible to understand capitalism—better than the Internet, for example, or the arms trade, or the sale of grain? The reason defines both the method and the object of this investigation: a problem of scale. It is not possible to cultivate this mushroom because it has a capricious life cycle and depends heavily on other factors; it is not a scalable object.

本书的一大贡献在于，它重新定义了资本主义，赋予其创造可规模化本地条件的能力，而种植园正是这种资本主义的先驱和原型。采集松茸无法实现任何规模化，就像在俄勒冈州或中国采集松茸一样，而青密切关注着这些国家危险的经济。青批评了备受争议的“人类世”概念，实际上可以提出一个严肃的候选概念，正如唐娜·哈拉维所言：“种植园世”。

One of the major contributions of this book is that it redefines capitalism by its capacity to create local conditions that may be scaled up, and plantations are the precursor and the prototype. Gathering matsutake eludes all forms of scalability, as do those gathering it in Oregon or China, whose perilous economy Tsing tracks closely. Criticizing the disputed notion of the Anthropocene, Tsing could in fact put forward a serious candidate, as Donna Haraway suggests: the “Plantationocene.”

但这本书真正独具匠心之处，在于其研究方法也同样抵制可扩展性。青有效地恢复了所谓的“纯粹而简单”的描述——尽管它本身并无纯粹或简单之处。描述就是发明一门具体的科学，它不寻求概括，而是更深入地探究地点和历史的特殊性。这种特殊性难以描述，以至于那些像开发项目一样痴迷于可扩展性的“全地形”科学，系统性地未能理解物种重叠的特殊情况，从而导致废墟的增多。

But the truly ingenious thing about this book is that resistance to scalability also applies to its method of investigation. Tsing effectively rehabilitates what could be called “pure and simple” description—though there is nothing pure or simple about it. Describing is inventing a science of the concrete, which does not seek to generalize but to penetrate ever more deeply into the specificity of places and history. This specificity is so difficult to describe that “all terrain” sciences, which, like development projects, are obsessed by scalability, systematically fail to understand the ever so particular situation of overlapping species, thus multiplying the fields of ruins.

而本书的主题正是如何习惯于废墟中的生存，并懂得如何去适应。其原因在于它的研究对象：这种喜欢废墟的封闭蘑菇，尤其喜欢被伐木工人毁掉的松树林。它的生活方式缺乏自然的和谐与平衡。它的一切都是人为的；它发展过程中的一切都违反直觉。它抗拒一切稳定持久的定义，抗拒一切规模的变化。此外，与同属的其他成员一样，它拒绝被定义为一个物种。松茸在“破坏”中蓬勃发展，而青赋予“破坏”一词以积极的含义，它不抱任何回归“自然”境况的希望。

And becoming accustomed to living in the ruins, and knowing how to do so, is what this book is about. The reason is rooted in its object of investigation: this occluded mushroom that likes ruins, particularly pine forests laid waste by loggers. Its mode of life is devoid of the harmony and equilibrium of nature. Everything about it is artificial; everything in its development is counterintuitive. It resists all stable and lasting definition, all changes of scale. Additionally, like other members of its genus, it refuses to be defined as a species. The matsutake prospers amid disruption, a term to which Tsing imparts a positive meaning, against all hope of return to a “natural” situation.

这本书远非宣扬任何灾难主义观点，但“毁灭”一词在书中被赋予了积极的含义，这一次与方法论有关。如果说蘑菇“在世界末日”，那并非出于某种末日论的原因，而是因为开发项目的时代已经结束。更确切地说，它本身就是“投射”的概念，与对无限期的期盼息息相关。可扩展性，它已无法描述所有这些行动者和行动者的路径——松树、蘑菇、采集它们的亚洲移民、试图破坏森林以恢复其肥力的日本伐木工人、尽管破坏了世界各地的森林却仍设法在日本创造奢侈品经济的加拿大进口商——这些陆地生物（缺乏一个合适的词语来描述它们）最终如何相互交织。学会在资本主义的废墟中生存，意味着学会摆脱项目的概念，并最终转向对那些无法轻易改变规模的情境进行细致的描述。

In this book, which is far from espousing any catastrophist vision, the word ruin takes on a positive meaning, this time concerning the method. If the mushroom is “at the end of the world,” it is not for some apocalyptic reason but because the time of development projects is now over. More exactly, it is the very notion of projection, bound up with the hope for indefinite scalability, which is no longer able to describe how the paths of all these actors and doers—pines, mushrooms, the Asian migrants gathering them, the Japanese loggers seeking to disrupt the forest to restore its fertility, the Canadian importers who manage to create an economy for luxury products in Japan despite destroying forests the world over—how these terrestrials (the word to describe them is lacking) end up crossing one another. Learning to live in the ruins of capitalism means learning to do without the notion of projects and, finally, moving on to an attentive description of situations that cannot easily change scale.

唐娜·哈拉维（Donna Haraway）用她的爱犬卡宴（Cayenne）证明了物种间关系分析的深度。安娜·青（Anna Tsing）用她的松茸证明了我们还可以走得更远，不仅能改变待描述的景观，还能改变我们对细致描述的期望。

With her dog Cayenne, Donna Haraway had proved how far one could take analysis of relations between species. With her matsutake, Anna Tsing proves that we can go still further, modifying not only the landscape to be described but what we should expect of meticulous description.

布鲁诺·拉图尔

Bruno Latour

Anna Lowenhaupt Tsing，《世界尽头的蘑菇：论资本主义废墟中生命的可能性》（新泽西州普林斯顿：普林斯顿大学出版社，2015 年）。

Anna Lowenhaupt Tsing, The Mushroom at the End of the World: On the Possibility of Life in Capitalist Ruins (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 2015).

2016

2016

《金钱：阿格列塔揭示金钱的矛盾本质》

Money: Aglietta Unveils the Contradictory Nature of Money

米歇尔·阿列塔（Michel Aglietta，生于1938年）的《金钱：五千年的债务与权力》 （La monnaie: Entre dettes et souveraine ）是他三十余年著作的巅峰之作，其中包括他与安德烈·奥尔良（André Orléan）合著的三部著作：《金钱的暴力》（La violence de la monnaie ）、《主权货币》（ La monnaie souveraine）和《金钱：介于暴力与信任之间》（ La monnaie entre violence et confiance）。阿列塔这本2016年出版的书提出了一种不同于经济学正统理论的货币理论，但其目标并不局限于货币理论。这部创新的跨学科著作探讨了货币、债务、经济和社会之间的关系，彻底打破了经济学家中占主导地位的契约主义和市场主义观点。通过依次探讨“货币作为一种社会归属关系”、“货币的历史轨迹”、“危机与货币监管”以及“国际货币之谜”，阿格列塔表明，货币本质上是一种社会联系和政治关系。这一分析提供了一种途径，让我们摆脱那种由市场协调的社会关系的纯粹个人主义视角。事实上，那些倡导“有效市场”的经济学家未能预见到全球金融危机的爆发。

La monnaie: Entre dettes et souveraineté (Money: 5,000 Years of Debt and Power), by Michel Aglietta (born 1938), is the culmination of work undertaken over a thirty-year period, including three previous books written with André Orléan: La violence de la monnaie (The violence of money), La monnaie souveraine (Sovereign money), and La monnaie entre violence et confiance (Money: Between violence and trust). Aglietta’s 2016 book sets out an alternative theory of money to that of economic orthodoxy, yet its ambition is not limited to monetary theory. This innovative interdisciplinary work tackles the relation between currencies, debts, the economy, and society, effecting a radical break with the contractualist and market vision predominating among economists. By successively exploring “money as a relation of social belonging,” “the historical trajectories of money,” “crises and monetary regulation,” and “the enigma of international currency,” Aglietta shows that money is, in essence, a social link and a political relation. This analysis provides a way of leaving behind an exclusively individualist vision of social relations coordinated by the market. Economists advocating “efficient markets” were, for that matter, incapable of seeing the onset of the global financial crisis.

阿格列塔反对货币是特定商品的论点，他认为货币是伴随国家而生的一套制度实践体系。货币不能被简化为传统的支付、记账单位和价值储存功能，因为它所建立的支付体系是一种群体归属感，并且这种归属感因其对权威、神灵、祖先、君主以及它们所代表的政治整体的依赖而得到强化。

Against the thesis that money is a particular merchandise, Aglietta argues that money is a system of institutional practices born with the state. Money cannot be reduced to its traditional functions of payment, unit of account, and store of value, for the payment system it institutes is a way of belonging to a group, and it is strengthened by its dependency to the authorities, gods, ancestors, sovereigns, and political whole they embody.

这一历史回溯，结合运用所有社会科学的比较分析，揭示了债务在其各种含义中的根本性作用：终身债务、继承债务和社会债务。债务的核心重要性促使我们审视是什么促成了人们对货币的信任，以及是什么通过货币与其他形式财富的差异使其在交易中的使用合法化。阿格列塔表明，制度架构将货币转化为价值媒介，并由此产生了三个层次的信任，这些信任与支撑支付体系的三条规则相关：对社会持续存在的道德信任（与维持记账单位相关）、与国家主权融合的等级信任（确保补偿和支付原则），以及沉浸在经济交换中的系统性信任（允许债务流通）。

This historical detour together with comparative analyses drawing on all the social sciences brings to light the fundamental role of debt in its various meanings: life debt, inherited debt, and social debt. The central importance accorded to debt leads to examination of what procures confidence in money and what legitimates its use in transactions through its difference of kind in comparison to other forms of wealth. Aglietta shows that the institutional architecture turns money into the medium of value, and that this generates three levels of confidence linked to three rules underpinning the payment system: ethical confidence in the continued existence of society (correlated to maintaining the unit of account), hierarchal confidence fused with state sovereignty (ensuring the principle of compensation and payment), and methodical confidence immersed in economic exchange (permitting the circulation of debts).

此外，阿格列塔还将货币的矛盾性置于其思想的核心，揭示了货币秩序的致命弱点：它在暴力与信任之间摇摆不定。这种摇摆不定源于货币的矛盾性，它可能会引发灾难性的危机。事实上，货币既是典型的公共物品和协调原则（体现在铸币和支付体系中），也是最受追捧的私人物品，因为它可以被挪用和囤积，成为构建财富和权力的手段（流动性）。

Aglietta additionally places the ambivalence of money at the center of his thought, bringing out the fatal weakness of the monetary order, which oscillates between violence and confidence. This oscillation stems from the contradictory nature of money, which may engender catastrophic crises. Indeed, money is at one and the same time the prototypical public good and principle of coordination (instituted in coinage and the payment system) and the most sought-after private good, since it may be appropriated and hoarded as a means for constituting wealth and power (liquidity).

因此，制度变迁的历史提出了一个反复出现的问题：一方面，如何防范金融危机和通货紧缩；另一方面，如何防范货币危机和通货膨胀；如何避免任何一方加剧债权人和债务人之间的竞争，从而危及社会的生存。货币和金融混乱时期往往是政治动乱和社会冲突加剧的时期。正是在西方与这些危机相关的辩论和事件之后，银行的重要性才得以凸显，中央银行作为最后贷款人的角色也逐渐被接受。

The history of institutional changes thus raises the recurrent problem of knowing how to ward off financial and deflationist crises, on the one hand, and monetary and inflationist crises, on the other, and avoiding that either imperil the very existence of society by exacerbating rivalries between creditors and debtors. Periods of monetary and financial disorder have always been phases of acute political trouble and social conflict, and it is in the wake of debates and events correlated to these crises in the West that banks acquired their importance and the central bank’s role as lender of last resort gradually came to be accepted.

Aglietta 对货币现象的研究方法是独特的，特别是因为它以联合研究为基础：许多来自不同学科的研究人员直接或间接地做出了贡献，他们也从中获得了灵感，例如 Bruno Théret 关于危机的研究就证明了这一点。这种方法体现了路易·杜蒙特（Louis Dumont）的影响——杜蒙特是一位经济主义批评家，他将卡尔·波兰尼（Karl Polanyi）的思想引入法国——他认为金钱不能被视为商品。此外，它还借鉴了哲学家勒内·吉拉尔（René Girard）关于模仿暴力的论述、夏尔·马拉默德（Charles Malamoud）关于吠陀经文中存在主义债务概念的论述、丹尼尔·德·科佩（Daniel de Coppet）关于原始货币宗教起源的论述，以及卡洛·贝内蒂（Carlo Benetti）和让·卡特里埃（Jean Cartelier）关于货币作为支付体系的论述。

Aglietta’s approach to monetary phenomenon is singular, especially because it is underpinned by joint research: Many researchers from different disciplines contribute directly or indirectly, and they have also drawn inspiration from it, as evidenced by Bruno Théret’s work on crises, for instance. The approach shows the influence of Louis Dumont—a critic of economism who introduced Karl Polanyi’s thought to France—for whom money cannot be considered a merchandise. It also draws on theses of the philosopher René Girard on mimetic violence, of Charles Malamoud on existential debt as conceptualized in Vedic texts, of Daniel de Coppet on the religious origin of primitive currencies, and of Carlo Benetti and Jean Cartelier on money as payment system.

这部著作是规制学派的一项标杆性研究，它将规制学派的理论应用于对欧元和欧盟成员国主权的思考，为新的国际货币秩序奠定了可能的基础。本书仔细考察了主要国际货币的作用，以及货币之间建立等级制度和监管全球化资本主义的必要性，旨在理解2008年金融危机、欧元区的未来以及重启欧洲长期增长的可能性。阿格列塔坚决摒弃德国方案——该方案会以维护其秩序自由主义模式的名义延续南北之间的不对称——并通过探索重启欧洲建设的不同途径，完成了他对货币的精彩描绘，这些途径包括改变欧洲中央银行的职权范围、创建一个能够制定多年期政策的预算机构，以及启动一项以开发环境损害技术解决方案为基础的工业计划。简而言之，《货币》是一部内容丰富、有时颇具难度的著作，但它却展现出惊人的目标一致性。

This work, a benchmark study of the regulation school, applies its theory to thought about the euro and the sovereignty of states currently in the European Union, setting out the possible foundations for a new international monetary order. The role of key international currencies, and the need for a hierarchy between monies and for regulating globalized capitalism, are carefully examined in a bid to understand the 2008 financial crisis, the future of the eurozone, and the possibilities for relaunching long-term European growth. Firmly setting aside the German solution, which would perpetuate the asymmetry between the North and South in the name of conserving its ordoliberal model, Aglietta completes his great portrayal of money by exploring different ways to relaunch European construction, including altering the mandate of the European Central Bank, creating a budgetary authority capable of drawing up multiannual policies, and initiating an industrial plan grounded in developing technological solutions to environmental damage. In short, La monnaie is a dense and at times difficult work, but one of startling unity of purpose.

安德烈·蒂朗

André Tiran

米歇尔·阿列塔（与 Pepita Ould Ahmed 和 Jean-François Ponsot 合作），《La monnaie: Entre dettes et souveraineté》（巴黎：Odile Jacob，2016 年）。大卫·布罗德 (David Broder) 将其翻译成英文，名为《金钱：债务与权力的 5000 年》（伦敦：Verso，2018 年）。

Michel Aglietta (with Pepita Ould Ahmed and Jean-François Ponsot), La monnaie: Entre dettes et souveraineté (Paris: Odile Jacob, 2016). Translated into English by David Broder as Money: 5,000 Years of Debt and Power (London: Verso, 2018).

涵盖的书籍清单

List of Books Covered

阿多诺（Theodor W. Adorno）和马克斯·霍克海默（Max Horkheimer）。《启蒙辩证法》。1947年。

Adorno, Theodor W., and Max Horkheimer. Dialectic of Enlightenment. 1947.

阿甘本，乔治奥。《身体的用途：牲人》，IV，2。 2014年。

Agamben, Giorgio. The Use of Bodies: Homo Sacer, IV, 2. 2014.

阿格列塔，米歇尔。《金钱：5000年的债务与权力》。2016年。

Aglietta, Michel. Money: 5,000 Years of Debt and Power. 2016.

阿尔都塞、路易斯、艾蒂安·巴利巴尔、罗杰·埃斯塔布莱、皮埃尔·马谢里和雅克·朗西埃。读都. 1965年。

Althusser, Louis, Étienne Balibar, Roger Establet, Pierre Macherey, and Jacques Rancière. Reading Capital. 1965.

安德森，本尼迪克特。《想象的共同体：对民族主义起源与传播的思考》。 1983年。

Anderson, Benedict. Imagined Communities: Reflections on the Origin and Spread of Nationalism. 1983.

阿伦特，汉娜。《极权主义的起源》。1951 年。

Arendt, Hannah. The Origins of Totalitarianism. 1951.

Ariès, Philippe。《几个世纪的童年：家庭生活的社会史》。1960 年。

Ariès, Philippe. Centuries of Childhood: A Social History of Family Life. 1960.

Assmann, Jan.一神论的代价. 2003 年。

Assmann, Jan. The Price of Monotheism. 2003.

奥斯汀，约翰·L。《如何用语言做事：威廉·詹姆斯 1955 年在哈佛大学的演讲》。1962 年。

Austin, John L. How to Do Things with Words: The William James Lectures Delivered at Harvard University in 1955. 1962.

乔治·巴兰迪尔。《黑非洲社会学：中非社会动态》。1955 年。

Balandier, Georges. The Sociology of Black Africa: Social Dynamics in Central Africa. 1955.

Barth, Fredrik 编。族群与边界：文化差异的社会组织。1969 年。

Barth, Fredrik, ed. Ethnic Groups and Boundaries: The Social Organization of Culture Difference. 1969.

罗兰·巴特。《神话学》。1957 年。

Barthes, Roland. Mythologies. 1957.

贝克，乌尔里希。风险社会：迈向新现代性。1986 年。

Beck, Ulrich. Risk Society: Towards a New Modernity. 1986.

贝克尔，霍华德·S。艺术世界。1982 年。

Becker, Howard S. Art Worlds. 1982.

本维尼斯特，埃米尔。一般语言学问题。 1966 年。

Benveniste, Émile. Problems in General Linguistics. 1966.

Berger, Peter L. 和 Thomas Luckmann。《现实的社会建构：知识社会学论文》。1966 年。

Berger, Peter L., and Thomas Luckmann. The Social Construction of Reality: A Treatise in the Sociology of Knowledge. 1966.

伯曼，哈罗德 J.法律与革命。1983 年，2003 年。

Berman, Harold J. Law and Revolution. 1983, 2003.

波尔坦斯基、吕克和埃夫·恰佩罗。资本主义的新精神。 1999 年。

Boltanski, Luc, and Ève Chiapello. The New Spirit of Capitalism. 1999.

布迪厄，皮埃尔。《区别：对趣味判断的社会批判》。1979 年。

Bourdieu, Pierre. Distinction: A Social Critique of the Judgement of Taste. 1979.

布罗代尔，费尔南。腓力二世时代的地中海和地中海世界。1949 年。

Braudel, Fernand. The Mediterranean and the Mediterranean World in the Age of Philip II. 1949.

布朗，彼得。《针眼：财富、罗马的衰落与西方基督教的形成，公元 350-550 年》。2012 年。

Brown, Peter. Through the Eye of a Needle: Wealth, the Fall of Rome, and the Making of Christianity in the West, 350–550 AD. 2012.

巴特勒，朱迪思。《性别麻烦：女权主义与身份的颠覆》。1990年。

Butler, Judith. Gender Trouble: Feminism and the Subversion of Identity. 1990.

Callon, Michel, Pierre Lascoumes 和 Yannick Barthe。《在不确定的世界中行动：论技术民主》。2001 年。

Callon, Michel, Pierre Lascoumes, and Yannick Barthe. Acting in an Uncertain World: An Essay on Technical Democracy. 2001.

乔治·康吉莱姆，《生命的知识》。1952 年。

Canguilhem, Georges. Knowledge of Life. 1952.

卡斯特尔，罗伯特。从体力劳动者到雇佣劳动者：社会问题的转变。1995年。

Castel, Robert. From Manual Workers to Wage Laborers: Transformation of the Social Question. 1995.

Certeau, Michel de. 《日常生活的实践》。1980 年。

Certeau, Michel de. The Practice of Everyday Life. 1980.

Chartier, Roger。《近代早期法国的印刷文化用途》。1987 年。

Chartier, Roger. The Cultural Uses of Print in Early Modern France. 1987.

柯林斯，兰德尔。《暴力：一个微观社会学理论》。2008年。

Collins, Randall. Violence: A Micro-Sociological Theory. 2008.

科尔宾，阿兰。《恶臭与芬芳：气味与法国社会想象力》。1982 年。

Corbin, Alain. The Foul and the Fragrant: Odor and the French Social Imagination. 1982.

大卫杜夫，莱奥诺拉和凯瑟琳·霍尔。《家族财富：1780-1850年英国中产阶级的男人和女人》。1987年。

Davidoff, Leonore, and Catherine Hall. Family Fortunes: Men and Women of the English Middle Class, 1780–1850. 1987.

德里达，雅克。《论文字学》。1967 年。

Derrida, Jacques. Of Grammatology. 1967.

Descola, Philippe.超越自然与文化. 2005.

Descola, Philippe. Beyond Nature and Culture. 2005.

Desrosières, Alain.大数政治：统计推理史. 1993.

Desrosières, Alain. The Politics of Large Numbers: A History of Statistical Reasoning. 1993.

杜韦普、阿兰. Charonne，1962 年 2 月 8 日：国家大屠杀的人类学历史。 2006年。

Dewerpe, Alain. Charonne, 8 février 1962: Anthropologie historique d’un massacre d’État. 2006.

Didi-Huberman, Georges。《幸存的图像：时间的幽灵》和《幽灵的时间：阿比·瓦尔堡的艺术史》。2002。

Didi-Huberman, Georges. The Surviving Image: Phantoms of Time and Time of Phantoms: Aby Warburg’s History of Art. 2002.

道格拉斯，玛丽。《纯洁与危险：对污染与禁忌概念的分析》。1966年。

Douglas, Mary. Purity and Danger: An Analysis of the Concepts of Pollution and Taboo. 1966.

杜比，乔治。《布汶的传说：中世纪的战争、宗教与文化》。1973 年。

Duby, Georges. The Legend of Bouvines: War, Religion, and Culture in the Middle Ages. 1973.

杜梅齐尔、乔治。神话与流行：印欧人民流行的三种功能的意识形态。 1968年。

Dumézil, Georges. Mythe et épopée: L’idéologie des trois fonctions dans les épopées des peuples indo-européens. 1968.

杜蒙特，路易斯。《个人主义论文集：人类学视角下的现代意识形态》。1983年。

Dumont, Louis. Essays on Individualism: Modern Ideology in Anthropological Perspective. 1983.

埃利亚斯，诺伯特。《宫廷社会》。1969 年。

Elias, Norbert. The Court Society. 1969.

法夫雷特-萨达，珍妮。《致命的言辞：树丛中的巫术》。1977年。

Favret-Saada, Jeanne. Deadly Words: Witchcraft in the Bocage. 1977.

费弗尔、吕西安.历史上的战斗。 1953年。

Febvre, Lucien. Combats pour l’histoire. 1953.

福柯，米歇尔。《疯癫史》。1961 年。

Foucault, Michel. History of Madness. 1961.

弗里德兰德，索尔。《灭绝岁月：纳粹德国与犹太人，1939-1945》。2007年。

Friedländer, Saul. The Years of Extermination: Nazi Germany and the Jews, 1939–1945. 2007.

Furet, François。《解读法国大革命》。1978 年。

Furet, François. Interpreting the French Revolution. 1978.

加尔布雷斯，约翰·肯尼斯。《富裕社会》。1958 年。

Galbraith, John Kenneth. The Affluent Society. 1958.

加芬克尔，哈罗德。《民族方法学研究》。1967 年。

Garfinkel, Harold. Studies in Ethnomethodology. 1967.

格尔茨，克利福德。《文化的诠释：论文选集》。1973 年。

Geertz, Clifford. The Interpretation of Cultures: Selected Essays. 1973.

盖尔，阿尔弗雷德。《艺术与能动性：一种人类学方法》。1998 年。

Gell, Alfred. Art and Agency: An Anthropological Approach. 1998.

金兹堡，卡洛。《奶酪与蠕虫：一位十六世纪磨坊主的宇宙》。1976年。

Ginzburg, Carlo. The Cheese and the Worms: The Cosmos of a Sixteenth-Century Miller. 1976.

Godelier, Maurice.《伟人的诞生：新几内亚巴鲁亚人的男性统治与权力》，1982 年。

Godelier, Maurice. The Making of Great Men: Male Domination and Power among the New Guinea Baruya. 1982.

戈夫曼，欧文。《日常生活中的自我呈现》。1959年。

Goffman, Erving. The Presentation of Self in Everyday Life. 1959.

古迪，杰克。《野性心灵的驯化》。1977年。

Goody, Jack. The Domestication of the Savage Mind. 1977.

格雷伯，大卫。《债务：最初的5000年》。2011年。

Graeber, David. Debt: The First 5,000 Years. 2011.

古哈，拉纳吉特。《殖民地印度农民起义的基本方面》。1983 年。

Guha, Ranajit. Elementary Aspects of Peasant Insurgency in Colonial India. 1983.

哈贝马斯，尤尔根。《公共领域的结构转型：对资产阶级社会的一个范畴的探究》。1962 年。

Habermas, Jürgen. The Structural Transformation of the Public Sphere: An Inquiry into a Category of Bourgeois Society. 1962.

哈拉维，唐娜·J。灵长类动物的视野：现代科学世界中的性别、种族和自然。1989 年。

Haraway, Donna J. Primate Visions: Gender, Race, and Nature in the World of Modern Science. 1989.

哈托格，弗朗索瓦。《历史性体制：现在主义与时间体验》。2003 年。

Hartog, François. Regimes of Historicity: Presentism and Experiences of Time. 2003.

埃里蒂埃，弗朗索瓦丝。父母的锻炼。 1981年。

Héritier, Françoise. L’exercice de la parenté. 1981.

赫希曼，阿尔伯特·O。退出、发言权和忠诚度：对公司、组织和国家衰落的反应。1970年。

Hirschman, Albert O. Exit, Voice, and Loyalty: Responses to Decline in Firms, Organizations, and States. 1970.

霍布斯鲍姆，埃里克·J。极端时代：短暂的二十世纪，1914–1991。1994年。

Hobsbawm, Eric J. Age of Extremes: The Short Twentieth Century, 1914–1991. 1994.

霍加特，理查德。《读写能力的用途：工人阶级生活面向——特别是出版物和娱乐》。1957年。

Hoggart, Richard. The Uses of Literacy: Aspects of Working-Class Life with Special Reference to Publications and Entertainments. 1957.

坎托洛维茨，恩斯特。《国王的两个身体：中世纪政治神学研究》。1957 年。

Kantorowicz, Ernst. The King’s Two Bodies: A Study in Medieval Political Theology. 1957.

Kirch, Patrick Vinton。《酋长如何成为国王：神圣的王权与古代夏威夷古国的兴起》。2010 年。

Kirch, Patrick Vinton. How Chiefs Became Kings: Divine Kingship and the Rise of Archaic States in Ancient Hawai’i. 2010.

Koselleck, Reinhart.未来的过去：论历史时间的语义学。1979 年。

Koselleck, Reinhart. Futures Past: On the Semantics of Historical Time. 1979.

库恩，托马斯·S。科学革命的结构。1962 年。

Kuhn, Thomas S. The Structure of Scientific Revolutions. 1962.

拉波夫，威廉。《内城语言：黑人英语白话研究》。1972 年。

Labov, William. Language in the Inner City: Studies in the Black English Vernacular. 1972.

拉图尔，布鲁诺。《法国的巴氏杀菌法》。1984年。

Latour, Bruno. The Pasteurization of France. 1984.

Leach, Edmund。缅甸高地的政治制度：克钦社会结构研究。1954 年。

Leach, Edmund. Political Systems of Highland Burma: A Study of Kachin Social Structure. 1954.

勒戈夫，雅克。圣路易斯。 1996年。

Le Goff, Jacques. Saint Louis. 1996.

勒罗伊-古尔汉，安德烈。手势和言语。 1964年。

Leroi-Gourhan, André. Gesture and Speech. 1964.

克洛德·列维-斯特劳斯。《亲属关系的基本结构》。1949 年。

Lévi-Strauss, Claude. The Elementary Structures of Kinship. 1949.

伦巴第、丹尼斯.爪哇家乐福：全球历史论文集。 1990年。

Lombard, Denys. Le carrefour javanais: Essai d’histoire globale. 1990.

洛罗，妮可。《分裂的城市：论古代雅典的记忆与遗忘》。1997 年。

Loraux, Nicole. The Divided City: On Memory and Forgetting in Ancient Athens. 1997.

马林，路易斯。《国王的肖像》。1981 年。

Marin, Louis. Portrait of the King. 1981.

莫斯、马塞尔.社会学与人类学。 1950年。

Mauss, Marcel. Sociologie et anthropologie. 1950.

米德，玛格丽特。《男性与女性：变化世界中的性别研究》。1949年。

Mead, Margaret. Male and Female: A Study of Sexes in a Changing World. 1949.

梅亚苏，克劳德。《少女、食物和金钱：资本主义与家庭社会》。1975年。

Meillassoux, Claude. Maidens, Meals, and Money: Capitalism and the Domestic Community. 1975.

默顿，罗伯特·K。社会理论和社会结构。1949 年。

Merton, Robert K. Social Theory and Social Structure. 1949.

查尔斯·赖特·米尔斯。《权力精英》。1956 年。

Mills, Charles Wright. The Power Elite. 1956.

欧文·帕诺夫斯基，《视觉艺术中的意义》。1955年。

Panofsky, Erwin. Meaning in the Visual Arts. 1955.

帕特森，奥兰多。《奴隶制与社会死亡：一项比较研究》。1982年。

Patterson, Orlando. Slavery and Social Death: A Comparative Study. 1982.

皮凯蒂，托马斯。《二十一世纪资本论》。2013 年。

Piketty, Thomas. Capital in the Twenty-First Century. 2013.

彭慕兰，肯尼斯。《大分流：中国、欧洲与现代世界经济的形成》。2000年。

Pomeranz, Kenneth. The Great Divergence: China, Europe, and the Making of the Modern World Economy. 2000.

Ricœur, Paul. 《时间与叙事》 . 1985.

Ricœur, Paul. Time and Narrative. 1985.

萨林斯，马歇尔。《石器时代经济学》。1972年。

Sahlins, Marshall. Stone Age Economics. 1972.

萨义德，爱德华·W. 《东方主义》，1978 年。

Said, Edward W. Orientalism. 1978.

萨特，让-保罗。《情境 II》。1948 年。

Sartre, Jean-Paul. Situations II. 1948.

斯科特，詹姆斯 C.不被统治的艺术：东南亚高地无政府主义历史。2009 年。

Scott, James C. The Art of Not Being Governed: An Anarchist History of Upland Southeast Asia. 2009.

斯特拉森，玛丽莲。《礼物的性别：美拉尼西亚的女性问题与社会问题》。1988年。

Strathern, Marilyn. The Gender of the Gift: Problems with Women and Problems with Society in Melanesia. 1988.

Subrahmanyam, Sanjay。《关联历史探索：莫卧儿王朝与法兰克人：从塔霍河到恒河》。2005。

Subrahmanyam, Sanjay. Explorations in Connected History: Mughals and Franks: From the Tagus to the Ganges. 2005.

测试开始，阿兰。自愿奴役。 2004年。

Testart, Alain. La servitude volontaire. 2004.

汤普森，爱德华 P. 《英国工人阶级的形成》。1963 年。

Thompson, Edward P. The Making of the English Working Class. 1963.

Touraine, Alain。《后工业社会：明日的社会历史：程序化社会中的阶级、冲突和文化》。1969 年。

Touraine, Alain. The Post-Industrial Society: Tomorrow’s Social History: Classes, Conflicts and Culture in the Programmed Society. 1969.

Tsing, Anna Lowenhaupt.世界尽头的蘑菇：论资本主义废墟中生命的可能性。2015。

Tsing, Anna Lowenhaupt. The Mushroom at the End of the World: On the Possibility of Life in Capitalist Ruins. 2015.

韦尔南，让-皮埃尔。《希腊神话与思想》。1965 年。

Vernant, Jean-Pierre. Myth and Thought among the Greeks. 1965.

维恩，保罗。《面包与马戏：历史社会学与政治多元主义》。1976 年。

Veyne, Paul. Bread and Circuses: Historial Sociology and Political Pluralism. 1976.

瓦赫特尔，内森。《征服者的视野：印第安人眼中的西班牙征服秘鲁，1530-1570》。1971年。

Wachtel, Nathan. The Vision of the Vanquished: The Spanish Conquest of Peru through Indian Eyes, 1530–1570. 1971.

沃勒斯坦，伊曼纽尔。《现代世界体系：资本主义农业与十六世纪欧洲世界经济的起源》。1974年。

Wallerstein, Immanuel. The Modern World-System: Capitalist Agriculture and the Origins of the European World-Economy in the Sixteenth Century. 1974.

怀特，哈里森C.身份与控制：社会行动的结构理论。1992年。

White, Harrison C. Identity and Control: A Structural Theory of Social Action. 1992.

怀特，理查德。《中间地带：1650-1815年大湖地区的印第安人、帝国与共和国》。1991年。

White, Richard. The Middle Ground: Indians, Empires, and Republics in the Great Lakes Region, 1650–1815. 1991.
